Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse - Definition, Damages, and Statute of Limitations (The Child Victims Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "sexual abuse" for purposes relating to civil actions for child sexual abuse to include any act that involves an adult allowing or encouraging a child to engage in certain activities; establishing certain limitations on damages that may be awarded under the Act; repealing the statute of limitations in certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; repealing a statute of repose for certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The Child Victims Act of 2023 in Maryland extends the time limits for filing civil actions related to child sexual abuse, removes statutes of limitations and repose for such cases, and increases damages caps, especially for sexual abuse claims. It also clarifies definitions and provides retroactive application.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts, Maryland State Department of Education, Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, educational institutions, government entities, legal professionals, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily addresses civil liability and statutes of limitations related to child sexual abuse cases.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Union Dues
Synopsis: Allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain union dues paid during the taxable year; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland residents to subtract the amount of union dues paid during the taxable year from their Maryland income tax, provided those dues could have been deducted on federal taxes before 2018, with a maximum subtraction of $250.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Union members and Maryland taxpayers who pay union dues
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to individual income tax deductions for union dues.

Title: Maryland State Police Gun Center – Firearms Surrendered Under Final Protective Orders
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include the tracking, screening, and vetting of all firearms surrendered under final protective orders in the State; and requiring each law enforcement agency to report to the Center the number and type of firearms surrendered, the jurisdictions where the firearms were surrendered, and certain information regarding the individual who surrendered each firearm under final protective orders.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include tracking, screening, and vetting all firearms surrendered under final protective orders in Maryland. It requires law enforcement agencies to report detailed information about these firearms and related crimes to the Center.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police Department
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, firearm owners subject to protective orders, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily involves law enforcement and firearm tracking.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Crimes - Repeal of Spousal Defense
Synopsis: Repealing a certain prohibition on prosecuting a person for rape or a certain sexual offense against a victim who was the person's legal spouse at the time of the alleged rape or sexual offense.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the legal prohibition on prosecuting a person for rape or sexual offenses against their spouse, removing the spousal defense in such cases.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Victims of sexual offenses, particularly spouses, and the legal system involved in prosecuting such crimes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Department of General Services - Energy-Conserving Standards (Maryland Sustainable Buildings Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to establish and periodically update standards for State buildings to conserve energy and minimize adverse impacts on birds; requiring the Maryland Green Building Council to include the standards in certain requirements established for the Maryland High Performance Green Building Program; defining "State building" as one acquired, constructed, or renovated by the State or one for which 50% of the money for acquisition, construction, or renovation came from State funds; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Sustainable Buildings Act of 2023 requires the Department of General Services to establish and update standards for State buildings to conserve energy and minimize adverse impacts on birds, including measures like shielding and minimizing lighting during certain times of the year. It also mandates the inclusion of these standards in the Maryland High Performance Green Building Program.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State government agencies, building occupants, environmental and bird conservation groups, taxpayers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets state buildings and does not directly address small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Equity in Transportation Sector - Guidelines and Analyses
Synopsis: Requiring that equity be considered when State transportation plans, reports, and goals are developed; altering the membership of the advisory committee on State transportation goals; requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to conduct transit equity analyses, cost-benefit analyses, and consult with certain communities before announcing or proposing any major service change or any reduction or cancellation of a certain capital expansion project in the construction program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transit Administration to incorporate equity considerations into transportation planning, service changes, and capital project reductions, including conducting analyses, community consultations, and reporting on impacts to disadvantaged groups.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Racial and ethnic minorities, low-income populations, persons with disabilities, seniors, transit riders, and communities affected by transportation policies and projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on equity and community impact analyses in transportation planning and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Talbot County
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain local detention center officers of Talbot County in the event Talbot County becomes a participating governmental unit in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System; and providing that certain local detention center officers who join the Correctional Officers' Retirement System and receive certain service credit shall no longer be members of the Employees' Pension System and shall have no further rights to any benefit in the Employees' Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Talbot County detention center officers become members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System if the county joins it, replacing their previous membership in the Employees' Pension System.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: Local detention center officers of Talbot County and the Maryland State Retirement Systems
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Private Well Safety Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations by December 31, 2026, to identify additional standards for water quality testing; requiring the Department, subject to certain funding and in consultation with the Department of Information Technology, to utilize an online portal to receive and upload certain information and to provide public access to the information; requiring the Department of the Environment to consistently share the information collected with the Maryland Department of Health and local health departments; etc.
bill_summary: The Private Well Safety Act of 2023 establishes a program and fund to address private well water contamination in Maryland. It requires water quality testing, provides grants for testing and remediation, creates an online portal for data sharing, and mandates disclosure and testing for rental properties and real estate transactions.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Private well owners, residents served by private wells, counties, and tenants in rental properties
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public health and safety through testing, remediation, and data sharing, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Equitable and Inclusive Transit-Oriented Development Enhancement Act
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the Secretary of Transportation to designate transit-oriented development; establishing the Transit-Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to promote the equitable and inclusive development of transit-oriented developments; authorizing the Department of Transportation to use the Fund to provide financial assistance to local jurisdictions; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an amount sufficient to ensure a Fund balance of at least $5,000,000; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Transit–Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to promote equitable and inclusive development around transit stations and corridors in Maryland. It provides funding mechanisms, eligibility criteria, and reporting requirements to support transit-related development projects that enhance access and community benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, private developers, and communities near transit stations and corridors in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on supporting transit-oriented development through grants and loans can help stabilize and grow local economies, potentially reducing small business failures in these areas.

Title: Hate Crimes – Civil Remedy
Synopsis: Providing that a person who is the victim of an act that would constitute a violation of certain hate crime laws may bring a civil action against the person or persons who committed the act in a court of competent jurisdiction; and authorizing the court to impose an injunction and award certain economic and noneconomic damages.
bill_summary: The bill allows victims of acts that violate hate crime laws in Maryland to file civil lawsuits against the perpetrators, seeking damages and injunctions. It also specifies the types of damages that can be awarded, including economic and noneconomic damages, and allows for damages up to three times the actual damages.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and legal system
stakeholders: Victims of hate crimes in Maryland and the broader community affected by hate crimes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses civil remedies for hate crimes and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Family Law - Grounds for Divorce
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the court to decree a limited divorce; and altering certain grounds for an absolute divorce.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the authority for courts to grant limited divorces and modifies the grounds for absolute divorces in Maryland, including reducing the separation period required for divorce from 12 months to 6 months.
responsible_party: Maryland Family Law Courts and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals seeking divorce in Maryland, their families, and legal practitioners involved in family law cases.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects family law procedures and does not have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education – Title IX – Notice (Hear Our Voices Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each public school to provide information to students, faculty, staff, and parents regarding who serves as the Title IX coordinator for the school, the process in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint, and the support measures that are in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint and how to access the support measures.
bill_summary: The bill requires all public schools in Maryland to provide information to students, staff, and parents about the Title IX coordinator, the process for filing sexual misconduct complaints, and available support measures.
responsible_party: Public schools in Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, staff, and parents of public schools in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland General and Limited Power of Attorney Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering a certain statutory form for a general power of attorney by including certain provisions informing the principal and agent of certain matters, granting general authority with respect to tangible personal property and trusts and estates, authorizing the principal to grant the agent certain specific powers relating to successor agents, compensation, gifts, or transfers and opening joint accounts and beneficiary designations, and clarifying the force and effect of the form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's statutory forms for powers of attorney to include provisions related to governmental benefits, specific powers, and digital assets, and clarifies the force and effect of these forms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Mental Hygiene or the Maryland State Department responsible for legal affairs and estate planning.
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who wish to create or update powers of attorney, including seniors, persons with disabilities, and their families.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on estate planning and powers of attorney, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - License and Registration Issuance and Renewals - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, except under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, on an applicant's request, to print a paper copy of the verification of licensure or registration and send it by first-class mail to the address on the application; repealing the requirement that the Board include certain information on each license and registration; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices by first-class mail under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, modifies the process for sending renewal notices (allowing electronic notices and requiring mailing if electronic notices are undeliverable), and updates related licensing procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Psychologists licensed in Maryland and the general public who rely on licensed psychologists for services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines licensing and renewal processes through electronic means, which can reduce administrative burdens and improve efficiency for small psychology practices, potentially decreasing failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Notices and Payoff Amount for Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring that the holder of a certificate of sale include the e-mail address of certain persons in certain notices required to be sent to certain persons with an interest in a property that is sold at a tax sale; authorizing certain persons with an interest in owner-occupied property sold at a tax sale to request the current payoff amount to redeem the property; providing that the payoff amount to redeem the property provided by the holder of the certificate to the owner of the property is valid for 30 days; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires that notices sent to interested parties in a property tax sale include an email address, and it allows owners of owner-occupied residential properties sold at tax sale to request the current payoff amount to redeem the property before a foreclosure complaint is filed.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation or local tax collector offices
stakeholders: Owners of owner-occupied residential properties sold at tax sale, mortgagees, and other interested parties in property tax sales in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individual property owners and mortgagees involved in tax sales, and does not directly target small businesses or have a significant potential to reduce small business failure rates.

Title: Mobile and Manufactured Homes - Relocation Plans and Sales of Communities (Manufactured Housing Modernization Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering requirements relating to relocation plans for mobile home parks to require a plan for park residents who will be dislocated as a result of the change in land use; requiring the owner, 60 days prior to entering into a contract to sell the community, to provide notice of the terms of the offer to homeowners in the community and provide them the opportunity to purchase the housing community; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to list certain agencies to assist homeowners with the purchase of a community; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes regulations concerning the sale and relocation of mobile and manufactured homes in Maryland. It establishes requirements for relocation plans when mobile home parks change land use, mandates notice and opportunity for homeowners to purchase communities during sales, and sets penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners and residents of manufactured housing communities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to protect homeowners and stabilize manufactured housing communities, which can help reduce the failure rate of small businesses operating these communities.

Title: Health Occupations - Psychologists - Licensure Qualification
Synopsis: Requiring an individual, in order to be licensed as a psychologist by the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists, to have a doctoral degree in psychology from a certain school or university, to have received a postdoctoral respecialization certificate from a certain department of psychology that included a minimum of 1,750 hours in supervised internship, and to have completed at least 1,500 hours postcertification advanced training hours or precertification hours of service as a registered psychology associate; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications required to become a licensed psychologist in Maryland, including updates to the definitions of doctoral degrees in psychology and the experience requirements for licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Individuals seeking to become licensed psychologists in Maryland, including psychology students and professionals
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing qualifications and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Environment - On-Site Wastewater Services - Board, Fees, and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the State Board of On-Site Wastewater Professionals; clarifying and altering the distribution of certain fees and penalties; and clarifying the application of certain license requirements and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill establishes licensing requirements, fee structures, and regulatory oversight for on-site wastewater professionals in Maryland. It creates a State Board to oversee licensing, sets standards for training and certification, and allocates funds for administration and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the State Board of On–Site Wastewater Professionals
stakeholders: On-site wastewater service providers, local governments, and residents in Maryland who rely on on-site sewage disposal systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to formalize licensing and regulation, which can help improve industry standards and reduce failures, potentially lowering small business failure rates in this sector.

Title: Maryland Food System Resiliency Council
Synopsis: Establishing that the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council is in the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; and altering the process for electing a cochair of the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council within the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, defines its membership, and sets procedures for its operation, including election of co-chairs and appointment of members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Food producers, local food organizations, farmers, food industry workers, and communities involved in food security and local food systems in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill supports food industry stakeholders and local food businesses by creating a council that can develop strategies to improve food system resilience, which may help reduce small business failures.

Title: Real Property – Actions to Repossess – Proof of Rental Licensure
Synopsis: Requiring, in certain actions to repossess residential rental property, a landlord to submit to the clerk of the court evidence of compliance with local rental property licensure requirements and demonstrate that the landlord is compliant with the licensure requirements.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords in Maryland to provide proof of compliance with local rental property licensure requirements when filing to repossess residential rental properties, and establishes procedures for demonstrating licensure status in court.
responsible_party: The Maryland District Court and local licensing authorities are responsible for implementing the program, with landlords required to demonstrate compliance.
stakeholders: Landlords, tenants, and local licensing authorities in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying licensing requirements and procedures, the bill aims to reduce legal uncertainties and potential failures for small landlords operating rental properties.

Title: Commercial Law - Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation (Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from making certain telephone solicitations to a certain called party in a certain manner by restricting the methods, times, and identifying information that the person making the call may utilize; providing that the Act does not apply to certain entities and circumstances; and making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice that is subject to enforcement and penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023, prohibits certain types of telephone solicitations in Maryland by restricting methods, times, and caller identification practices. It aims to reduce unwanted and deceptive telemarketing calls and enforces penalties for violations under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act.
responsible_party: Maryland Consumer Protection Agency and Public Utilities Commission
stakeholders: Maryland residents and consumers who receive telemarketing calls
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes exemptions for certain business-to-business calls and charitable or political organizations, which suggests a limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Courts - Judgments - Exemptions From Execution
Synopsis: Exempting up to $500 in a deposit account or other accounts of a judgment debtor held by a depository institution from execution on the judgment without an election by the debtor to exempt the money; establishing procedures a depository institution is required to follow on receipt of a writ of garnishment or other levy or attachment under certain circumstances; establishing a $6,000 limit on the cumulative value of property and cash that may be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to increase the exemption amount for funds in deposit accounts from $500 to $6,000, and establishes procedures for garnishment and execution on judgment debtor accounts, including instructions for garnishees and limits on exempted property.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, specifically the sheriff's office and depository institutions handling garnishments.
stakeholders: Judgment debtors, creditors, banks, credit unions, and other depository institutions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects individual debtors' exemption limits and garnishment procedures, with minimal direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Payment of Balance After Foreclosure
Synopsis: Requiring each county to establish a process for a person entitled to  any balance over the amount required for the payment of taxes, interest, penalties, and costs of sale to claim the balance after a tax sale foreclosure; and requiring the collector of taxes for a county to notify the prior property owner, within 90 days after delivering a deed to a purchaser, of the amount of a certain balance and the process for claiming the balance.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties to establish a process for prior property owners to claim any remaining balance after a tax sale foreclosure, and mandates that counties notify owners of such balances and the claiming process.
responsible_party: County tax collectors and county governments
stakeholders: Prior property owners who have lost property through tax sale foreclosure
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses, but improves transparency and process for property owners, which could indirectly benefit small business owners involved in property transactions.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program – Collaborative Care Model Services – Implementation and Reimbursement Expansion
Synopsis: Repealing the Collaborative Care Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and provide reimbursement for services provided in accordance with the Collaborative Care Model under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing Collaborative Care Pilot Program and mandates the Maryland Department of Health to implement and reimburse for services based on the Collaborative Care Model across primary care settings for Medicaid recipients, expanding access to integrated somatic and behavioral health services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients and primary care providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By expanding the Collaborative Care Model and providing reimbursement, the program aims to improve mental health and overall health outcomes, which can contribute to reducing small business failures indirectly through healthier communities and workforce stability.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council
Synopsis: Codifying the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as an instrumentality of the State to submit, monitor, implement, and evaluate the State Plan under the federal Rehabilitation Act in conjunction with Centers for Independent Living in the State; and requiring the Attorney General to be the legal advisor to the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as an official state entity, with responsibilities to submit, monitor, implement, and evaluate the State Plan for Independent Living under the federal Rehabilitation Act. It creates a Board of Directors, defines its composition and appointment process, and sets operational guidelines for the Council.
responsible_party: The Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council, with oversight and support from the Maryland Department of Human Services and the designated State entity responsible for the State Plan for Independent Living.
stakeholders: People with disabilities across Maryland, community-based organizations serving them, and the broader Maryland community involved in independent living initiatives.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by establishing a formal council and operational framework, it may indirectly support community stability and inclusion.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Requirement to Sell
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the authority of certain local governments to set the time by which a property with taxes in arrears must be sold by the tax collector.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain limitations on how long local governments in Maryland can wait before selling properties with overdue taxes, allowing them more flexibility in setting the timing of tax sales.
responsible_party: Local government authorities and tax collectors in Maryland
stakeholders: Property owners with overdue taxes, local governments, and communities affected by property tax sales
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects tax sale procedures and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Open Meetings Act - State Ethics Commission (Maryland State Agency Transparency Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing enhanced requirements under the Open Meetings Act for the State Ethics Commission; and requiring the Department of Information Technology to provide technical staff, support, and equipment necessary to livestream the open meetings of the State Ethics Commission.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency requirements for the State Ethics Commission and other public bodies by mandating live streaming of open meetings, timely publication of agendas and minutes, and providing technical support for livestreaming.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology and the State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Public bodies in Maryland, including the State Ethics Commission, and the general public interested in transparency and open government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and open meetings, with no direct provisions aimed at reducing small business failure.

Title: Land Use - Public Service Companies - Pollinator-Friendly Vegetation Management and Utility-Designated Pollinator Areas
Synopsis: Prohibiting local jurisdictions from imposing any unreasonable limitations, including land use restrictions, on utility-designated pollinator areas maintained by a public service company under certain conditions; requiring certain public service companies to mow utility designated pollinator areas in a manner which minimizes disturbances to habitats; stating the intent of the General Assembly related to State and local laws regarding weed control and vegetation management by public service companies outside of pollinator areas; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits local jurisdictions from imposing land use restrictions on public service companies maintaining pollinator-friendly vegetation in utility-designated pollinator areas, provided certain conditions are met. It also sets guidelines for how these areas should be managed to support pollinators.
responsible_party: Public service companies and the Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public service companies, pollinators, environmental conservation groups, and local governments
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns utility vegetation management and land use restrictions.

Title: Certified Local Farm and Fish Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Program to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program; expanding the purpose of the Program to include food from certified Chesapeake invasive species providers in the overall percentage goal of 20% of the unit's total dollar value for certain procurement contracts; and altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Food Aggregation Grant Fund to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Food Aggregation Grant Fund.
bill_summary: The bill expands the existing Certified Local Farm Enterprise Program to include Chesapeake invasive species fish providers, sets procurement goals for food from these sources, and establishes a grant fund to support food aggregation and distribution sites across Maryland.
responsible_party: The Department of Agriculture, specifically the Office for the Certified Local Farm and Chesapeake Invasive Species Provider Fish Program, and the Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation.
stakeholders: Local farms, Chesapeake invasive species fish providers, state agencies involved in procurement and food distribution, and Maryland residents benefiting from local and invasive species fish products.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support local farms and invasive species fish providers through procurement goals and grants, which could help reduce small business failures by increasing market opportunities and infrastructure support.

Title: Circuit Courts and District Court - Dishonored Checks - Service Charges
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the service charge from $10 to $30 that may be imposed by a circuit court or the District Court for a dishonored check.
bill_summary: The bill increases the service charge for dishonored checks in Maryland courts from $10 to $30, applicable in cases where checks are not honored or are returned due to insufficient funds or closed accounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings Department
stakeholders: Individuals and businesses involved in court cases involving dishonored checks in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's increase in service charges may incentivize better check management, but its direct impact on reducing small business failure is limited.

Title: Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Transportation to implement all possible incremental near-term safety improvements as soon as practicable if a new approved pedestrian or bicycle safety construction or improvement project is projected to take more than 12 months to complete.
bill_summary: The Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023 requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to incorporate safety measures for pedestrians and bicycles in their projects, implement safety improvements promptly for long-term projects, and submit reports on staffing, project delays, and pedestrian crossing plans, especially in high-density and transit-dependent areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and the State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Pedestrians, bicyclists, residents of suburban activity centers and traditional town centers, and commuters in high-density and transit-dependent areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve safety infrastructure which can lead to increased usage and safety, potentially reducing accidents and related failures for small businesses near these areas.

Title: Business Regulation - Charitable Organizations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "charitable contribution" to exclude an authorization for or a discount on the use of certain services or materials, equipment, or facilities for purposes of provisions of law regulating charitable organizations and charitable representatives; authorizing the Maryland Secretary of State to accept certain documentation in place of an audit or review in connection with a charitable organization's registration statement; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland laws regulating charitable organizations by redefining 'charitable contribution' to exclude certain property donations and service discounts, streamlining registration requirements, and allowing the Secretary of State to accept alternative documentation instead of audits or reviews for certain organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Charitable organizations operating in Maryland and their donors
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies registration and reporting processes for certain charitable organizations, which may reduce administrative burdens and improve financial stability, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Public Schools - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education, before the start of the 2024-2025 school year, to adopt, implement, and publish guidelines in accordance with the State school health service guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in classrooms and common areas; requiring each public school to develop a system to disclose the major food allergens contained in the foods served in the school; requiring each county board to make a good faith effort to adopt certain guidelines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public schools to adopt and implement guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to major food allergens for students with anaphylactic food allergies. It mandates disclosure of major food allergens in school foods, designates food-free zones, and promotes safety measures and communication strategies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students with food allergies, their parents, school staff, and school communities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on school health guidelines and allergen disclosures, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring a tax collector to make certain attempts to contact a certain plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale regarding certain expenses; and authorizing a collector to redeem certain property without a certain satisfaction letter if a plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale fails to respond within 5 days after certain attempts by the collector to make contact.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for tax sale redemptions in Maryland, including requiring tax collectors to attempt contact with holders of certificates of sale and allowing property to be redeemed without a satisfaction letter if there is no response after multiple contact attempts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation or local tax collectors
stakeholders: Property owners, holders of certificates of sale, and local government tax authorities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily impact property tax processes and do not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information – Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board – Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of a business entity's federal employer identification number, name, physical address, mailing address, contact name, e-mail address, and phone number to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its authorized contractors for the purposes of administering the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its contractors to receive certain tax information from the Maryland Comptroller to administer the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust, with specific limitations on the type of information disclosed.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small business owners and entities in Maryland participating in the retirement savings program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By facilitating better administration of retirement savings programs for small businesses, the bill has the potential to improve financial security and stability for small businesses, thereby reducing their failure rate.

Title: Local Government - Regulatory Powers - Regulation of Invasive Bamboo
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing bodies of counties and municipalities to adopt ordinances to regulate invasive bamboo, including by prohibiting a person from selling, planting, and allowing invasive bamboo to grow on the property of the person without proper upkeep and appropriate containment measures.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to regulate invasive bamboo, including prohibiting its sale, planting, and allowing it to grow without proper containment, to prevent its spread to neighboring properties and public areas.
responsible_party: County and municipal governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, and communities affected by invasive bamboo
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets invasive bamboo regulation and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Ground Leases - Collection of Rent, Interest, Fees, and Other Expenses - Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that ground leases or amendments that are not posted on the State Department of Assessments and Taxation's website are not considered registered or amended; prohibiting a ground lease holder from collecting or attempting to collect rent, late fees, interest, collection costs, and other expenses related to a ground lease unless the ground lease is registered with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes registration requirements for ground leases in Maryland, prohibits unregistered ground leases from collecting rent or related fees, and creates a process for resolving disputes over collection efforts through the Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Ground lease holders and leasehold tenants in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying legal collection practices and providing dispute resolution processes, the bill aims to reduce legal conflicts and financial failures among small businesses involved in ground leases.

Title: Residential Ground Leases - Redemption and Extinguishment - Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition against a tenant who is seeking to redeem or extinguish ground rent providing certain documentation and payments to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation earlier than 90 days after an application for redemption or extinguishment has been posted on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes the process for leasehold tenants to redeem or extinguish ground rents by removing the 90-day waiting period after application posting, and clarifies procedures and fees involved in the process.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Leasehold tenants, ground lease holders, property owners, and local governments in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies and streamlines the process for ground rent redemption, potentially reducing legal and administrative barriers for property owners and tenants, which may contribute to increased property stability and reduced failure of small property-related businesses.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance and altering certain requirements for the property insurance policy; and requiring owners of detached units to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to specify mandatory insurance requirements for condominiums, including property and liability insurance, and mandates that owners of detached units carry homeowners insurance on the entire unit. It clarifies the types of elements that must be insured and the responsibilities of the council of unit owners and individual owners.
responsible_party: The council of unit owners and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development.
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners, detached homeowners, and residents of condominiums in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on insurance requirements for condominiums and detached units can help reduce financial risks associated with property damage, potentially lowering the failure rate of small condominium associations and individual homeowners.

Title: Real Property - Actions for Possession - Pet Protections
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to publish a fact sheet on the protection of pets in the event of an eviction or any other loss of possession of real property; requiring a landlord to provide a link to the fact sheet on the Department's website at the execution of a lease on or after November 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to provide a link to the fact sheet at certain times; requiring a sheriff or any other official to return a pet to a tenant or certain other person or to contact an animal shelter or rescue organization; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Agriculture to develop and regularly update a fact sheet on pet care and protection during evictions or loss of property. It mandates landlords to provide a link to this fact sheet at lease signing if tenants have pets, and requires the Maryland Judiciary to include the link in certain warrants. Additionally, it requires officials to inspect for pets during property possession and to return pets to tenants or contact animal rescue organizations, prohibiting leaving pets on public property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Tenants with pets, landlords, animal rescue organizations, and animal shelters in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts tenants and landlords, with indirect effects on small pet-related businesses such as pet care and rescue organizations. It aims to improve pet safety during evictions, which could reduce costs associated with pet loss or injury, but does not directly target small business failure.

Title: Municipalities - Charter Amendments - Notice
Synopsis: Modifying the manner in which the chief executive officer of a municipality may fulfill certain notice requirements concerning proposed municipal charter amendments; and requiring the municipality to maintain certain records or receipts and make the records or receipts available to the public.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the procedures for municipalities in Maryland to provide notice of charter amendments, including requirements for posting notices, publishing summaries in newspapers, and delivering summaries to residents, while also mandating record-keeping and public access to these records.
responsible_party: Municipal governments and their chief executive officers
stakeholders: Municipal residents and local government officials involved in charter amendments
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on municipal notice procedures.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children's Health Program, and Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish an Express Lane Eligibility Program by January 1, 2025, to enroll individuals, based on certain eligibility, in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and the Maryland Children's Health Program; and requiring the Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance to submit a final report to certain committees of the General Assembly by January 1, 2024, of its findings and recommendations, including recommended legislative and regulatory changes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to establish an Express Lane Eligibility Program to automatically enroll individuals in the Maryland Medical Assistance and Children's Health Programs based on their eligibility for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. It also mandates the Workgroup on Low–Income Utility Assistance to submit final reports with recommendations to the General Assembly by January 1, 2024, and makes various updates to existing programs related to health, nutrition, and utility assistance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families eligible for health, nutrition, and utility assistance programs in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on health, nutrition, and utility assistance programs, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Worcester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Ocean City Promoter's License
Synopsis: Establishing an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County to issue the license to a for-profit organization to sell and serve beer, wine, and liquor at an entertainment event that is held on premises located within the corporate limits of the Town of Ocean City, owned by the Town of Ocean City, and approved in writing by the Ocean City Police Department; and authorizing a license fee of $5,000 per entertainment event.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County, allowing for-profit organizations to sell and serve alcohol at entertainment events within Ocean City, subject to certain regulations and approval.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County and the Ocean City Mayor and City Council
stakeholders: Event organizers, alcohol vendors, residents, and visitors attending entertainment events in Ocean City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could support small event organizers and businesses by providing a legal framework to sell alcohol at events, potentially reducing business failure related to licensing issues.

Title: Ground Leases – Notices and Billing – Forms and Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting a leasehold tenant of an unregistered ground lease from being required to hold more than 3 years of ground rent in escrow; requiring a ground lease holder to mail certain notices or bills to a leasehold tenant in a certain manner under certain circumstances; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to make available on its website the form a ground lease holder must use to provide a leasehold tenant bills or notices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new requirements for ground lease notices, billing, and transfer disclosures in Maryland. It limits escrow requirements for tenants of unregistered ground leases, mandates the use of specific forms for notices and bills, and sets procedures for notices related to nonpayment, rent payments, and lease transfers. The bill also clarifies restrictions on enforcement actions for unregistered leases.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Leasehold tenants of ground leases, ground lease holders, property owners, and potential property buyers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces potential legal and financial complications for tenants and ground lease holders by clarifying procedures and restrictions, which may contribute to fewer disputes and failures related to ground lease enforcement.

Title: Mental Health - Treatment Plans for Individuals in Facilities and Resident Grievance System
Synopsis: Requiring a treatment plan for an individual with a mental disorder admitted to a certain health care facility to include a discharge goal and an estimate of the probable length of the inpatient stay before the individual can be transferred to a certain setting; requiring certain facility staff to review and reassess a plan of treatment within certain time periods; requiring the Department of Health to report annually to the General Assembly on the Resident Grievance System and the grievances received related to State facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the inclusion of discharge goals and estimated length of stay in treatment plans for individuals with mental disorders in facilities, establishes review and reassessment procedures, enhances family and individual participation, creates an appeals process, and requires annual reporting on the Resident Grievance System.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental disorders in state facilities and their families
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on mental health treatment plans and grievance systems within healthcare facilities, with no direct provisions affecting small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Laws – HOV Lanes – Plug–In Electric Drive Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain plug-in electric drive vehicles for which a permit has been issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes regardless of the number of passengers in the vehicles; requiring the Administration to charge a fee, not to exceed $20, for issuing the permit; and requiring, on or before January 1 each year, a report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly on the effect of the use of the plug-in electric drive vehicle permits on the operation of HOV lanes.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain plug-in electric drive vehicles with permits to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes at all times, regardless of the number of passengers, and establishes a permit system and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Owners of qualifying plug-in electric drive vehicles and other HOV lane users in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Mandated Reports - Revisions
Synopsis: Modifying certain reporting requirements for practicability and efficiency; and repealing certain reporting requirements that are unnecessary, obsolete, duplicative, or inefficient.
bill_summary: The bill revises and streamlines various reporting requirements across multiple Maryland state agencies and programs, repealing unnecessary, obsolete, or redundant reports, and modifies some reporting deadlines and entities responsible for reporting.
responsible_party: Various Maryland state agencies and departments, including the Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Higher Education Commission, Maryland Department of Environment, Maryland Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Transportation, and others.
stakeholders: State agencies, higher education institutions, local governments, and populations served by programs such as health services, education, environmental initiatives, and social services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on reducing reporting burdens and eliminating unnecessary requirements may indirectly support small business stability by streamlining government processes, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: District Court - Small Claims - Enforcement of Money Judgments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the District Court, in aid of enforcement or execution of a money judgment resulting from a certain small claim action, from ordering the appearance of an individual for an examination or ordering an individual to answer interrogatories.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the District Court from requiring individuals to appear for examinations or answer interrogatories when enforcing or executing a money judgment resulting from a small claims action.
responsible_party: District Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals involved in small claims cases and those subject to enforcement of money judgments in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies enforcement procedures, which could reduce delays and costs for small businesses involved in small claims, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Private Passenger Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance - Enhanced Underinsured Motorist Coverage - Opt-Out Option
Synopsis: Converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in offering of coverage into an opt-out coverage option under provisions of law establishing requirements for private passenger motor vehicle liability insurance; requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to conduct a study on the impact of converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage to an opt-out coverage option and report its findings to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026, and December 31, 2028; etc.
bill_summary: The bill converts enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in to an opt-out option in Maryland's private passenger vehicle insurance policies, requiring insurers to offer this coverage automatically unless the policyholder explicitly waives it.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Private passenger vehicle owners and insured individuals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve consumer protection and coverage options, which could reduce financial hardship after accidents, potentially lowering small business failures related to insurance claims and liabilities.

Title: Criminal Law – Unnatural or Perverted Sexual Practice – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the crime of unnatural or perverted sexual practice.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the crime of unnatural or perverted sexual practice from Maryland law, removing it as a criminal offense and updating related legal definitions and procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals accused or convicted of the now-repealed offense, victims of sexual crimes, legal professionals, and the general public
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Services - Journeyman License - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering certain qualifications for a journeyman license to provide heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services to require having held an apprentice license for 4 rather than 3 years and having completed at least 6,000 rather than 1,875 hours of training under the direction and control of a licensed contractor.
bill_summary: The bill increases the required training hours for applicants to obtain a journeyman license for heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services from 1,875 to 6,000 hours, and extends the apprenticeship period from 3 to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Individuals seeking to become licensed HVACR journeymen in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may reduce small business failure by ensuring more qualified technicians, which can improve service quality and customer satisfaction.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Recovery of Benefits - Limitation and Methods
Synopsis: Limiting the percentage of the weekly benefits amount that the Secretary of Labor may deduct from weekly benefits payable to a claimant to recover certain overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits to 50% of the weekly benefit or 25% if the benefit is less than $100; and clarifying the circumstances under which the Secretary may use certain methods to recover overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits.
bill_summary: The bill limits the percentage of weekly unemployment benefits that can be deducted to recover overpayments, clarifies the methods the Secretary of Labor can use to recover these overpayments, and sets a new effective date of April 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Division of Unemployment Insurance
stakeholders: Unemployment benefit claimants in Maryland, especially those with overpayments or disputes over benefit recovery
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects unemployment benefit recovery processes and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Government – Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs – Alterations
Synopsis: Renaming the Commission on LGBTQ Affairs to be the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs; increasing the number of members of the Commission from 15 to 21; altering certain qualifications for members appointed to the Commission; staggering the terms of Commission members; and altering the duties of the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Commission on LGBTQ Affairs to the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs, modifies its membership, terms, and duties, and establishes its responsibilities to assess challenges, collect data, study best practices, and advise the government on issues affecting LGBTQIA+ communities.
responsible_party: The Maryland Governor’s Office of Community Initiatives, specifically the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs.
stakeholders: LGBTQIA+ community members and advocates in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Inactive Licenses - Requirements After Expiration
Synopsis: Requiring a person who fails to reactivate a real estate broker license on inactive status within 3 years to comply with specified requirements to obtain a license.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for reactivating a real estate broker or salesperson license in Maryland, including the need to meet continuing education requirements and submit evidence of future affiliation with a licensed broker if the license has been inactive for more than three years.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, associate brokers, and salespersons in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying reactivation procedures and extending the inactive period before license expiration, the bill aims to support real estate professionals in maintaining their licenses, potentially reducing business failure due to licensing issues.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Public Hearing Ho. Co. 13-23
Synopsis: Exempting applications for changing certain resident agents from the requirement that the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County hold a public hearing on the applications; and authorizing the Board to hold a public hearing on certain applications if the Board determines there is good cause for the hearing.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain applications for changing resident agents from the requirement of holding a public hearing in Howard County, Maryland, and allows the Board of License Commissioners to hold hearings under specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners and the Howard County Office of Public Information
stakeholders: Businesses applying for alcoholic beverage licenses in Howard County and residents of Howard County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By reducing the regulatory burden of public hearings for certain license changes, the bill may help small businesses in Howard County operate more smoothly and avoid delays.

Title: Maryland Electricians Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the entity that must administer or approve an apprenticeship program for electricians; substituting the term "uninsured" for the term "inactive" in certain provisions of law relating to liability insurance requirements for certain electricians; prohibiting a certain electrician from contracting to provide electrical services unless the electrical work is covered by certain liability insurance; specifying who is authorized and required to purchase certain insurance; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's Electricians Act by changing the entity responsible for approving apprenticeship programs, updating liability insurance requirements for electricians, and clarifying licensing and inactive status procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Electricians
stakeholders: Electricians, electrical contractors, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on licensing, insurance, and inactive status aim to streamline processes and reduce barriers, potentially lowering small business failure rates.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Adaptive Reuse
Synopsis: Establishing that adaptive reuse, retrofitting, and repurposing of existing buildings to develop new affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance provided by the Department of Housing and Community Development; requiring the Department to notify applicants for certain financial assistance that adaptive reuse is an eligible use of funds; and providing that the notice requirement does not apply to individuals applying for loans from the Department that are not focused on housing.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that adaptive reuse of existing buildings for creating affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance from the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development. It requires the Department to notify applicants that adaptive reuse is an eligible use of loan proceeds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals and families seeking affordable multifamily housing, especially those with household incomes below or equal to specified limits.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing clear guidance and support for adaptive reuse projects, the bill may help reduce small business failures related to real estate redevelopment and affordable housing development.

Title: Real Property - Residential Leases - Notification of Rent Increases
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from including a certain term in a lease pertaining to electronic delivery of the notice of a rent increase; requiring a landlord to notify a tenant in writing before increasing the tenant's rent through first-class mail or, if elected by the tenant, electronic delivery; requiring a county or municipality that adopts a certain local law related to limitations on rent increases to report annually certain information on building permits issued for multifamily dwellings intended as rental housing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits landlords from including electronic notice requirements for rent increases in leases, mandates advance written or electronic notice for rent increases over 4%, and requires local jurisdictions to report on rent control laws and building permits for rental housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or local government agencies responsible for housing regulation.
stakeholders: Tenants in Maryland, especially those subject to rent increases and local housing authorities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are focused on tenant protections and rent increase notifications, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Urban Agriculture Grant Programs - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and contents of and the requirements and qualifications under the Urban Agriculture Grant Fund; requiring the Governor, in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2029, to include at least $100,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill; establishing the Urban Agriculture Advisory Committee to recommend guidelines, policies, and practices for the implementation of the Grant Program; and requiring the Advisory Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's urban agriculture grant programs, including changes to the purpose, contents, and qualifications for grants, establishes an Urban Agriculture Advisory Committee, and broadens the definition of 'urban agricultural producer' to include more areas and activities.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Urban farmers, nonprofit organizations, institutions of higher education, and residents of urban areas in Maryland who benefit from increased access to locally grown foods.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support urban agricultural producers and organizations through grants and technical assistance, which can help reduce the failure rate of small urban farms and related businesses.

Title: Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners - Student Members and Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members
Synopsis: Altering the voting rights of and the process for selecting a student member of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; prohibiting the student member from voting on matters before the board relating to personnel and collective bargaining decisions; establishing the Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by April 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process for selecting a student member of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners, clarifies voting rights, and establishes a Task Force to study the compensation and potential addition of a second student member.
responsible_party: Office of the Mayor of Baltimore City and the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners
stakeholders: Students enrolled in Baltimore City Public Schools, Baltimore City residents, and the Baltimore City Public School System
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirements Ho. Co. 11-23
Synopsis: Providing that a resident of the State meets certain residency requirements for an applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County.
bill_summary: The bill amends residency requirements for applying for alcoholic beverage licenses in Howard County, Maryland, including provisions for applicants to be residents of the state and specific conditions for support petitions.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses, residents of Howard County, and local businesses involved in alcohol sales
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and potentially easing residency requirements, the bill may help small businesses and entrepreneurs in Howard County to obtain licenses more easily, reducing barriers to entry.

Title: Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority - Evaluation, Termination of Bond Authority, and Assumption of Functions, Employees, and Contracts (Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority Sunset Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds beginning June 1, 2023; requiring the Department of Legislative Services to evaluate the Authority providing enough detail for the General Assembly to determine whether the Authority should continue in its current form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds starting June 1, 2023, and mandates a comprehensive evaluation of its operations, effectiveness, and potential merger into the Maryland Environmental Service, including a review of its functions, employees, and contracts, with the goal of possibly consolidating or dissolving the authority.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services, Maryland Environmental Service, and the Maryland Clean Energy Center
stakeholders: Local governments, waste management entities, and residents of Maryland, especially those in jurisdictions served by the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to evaluate and potentially streamline waste disposal operations, which could reduce costs and improve efficiency for small businesses involved in waste management and related services, thereby lowering their risk of failure.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Crisfield Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain local law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that a certain individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Crisfield Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; providing for the transfer of creditable service for a certain individual; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that certain law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department become members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System when the department joins the system, and it details the transfer of pension assets and service credits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Crisfield Police Department
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department and the Maryland State Retirement System
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Sexual Offenses - Crime of Violence and Lifetime Supervision
Synopsis: Altering the list of crimes included within a certain definition of "crime of violence" to include sexual abuse of a minor if the offender is at least 21 years old and the victim is under the age of 16 years; and requiring a sentence for certain persons convicted of certain sexual abuse crimes to include a term of lifetime sexual offender supervision.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to expand the definition of 'crime of violence' to include certain sexual offenses involving minors, and mandates lifetime supervision for certain offenders convicted of sexual abuse crimes, especially those involving minors under specific age thresholds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, or the courts responsible for sentencing and supervision.
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of sexual offenses involving minors, victims of sexual abuse, and the general public concerned with public safety.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on criminal law and supervision of offenders; it does not directly impact small business operations or failure rates.

Title: Public Utilities - Energy Efficiency and Conservation Programs - Energy Performance Targets and Low-Income Housing
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to procure or provide for electricity customers energy efficiency and conservation programs and services designed to achieve certain target annual incremental gross energy savings for the 2024-2026 program cycle; establishing the Green and Healthy Task Force to develop policy and statutory recommendations to eliminate barriers to low-income households achieving, energy-efficient, affordable, and low-emissions housing; requiring an annual report beginning July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Public Service Commission to include information on low-income energy efficiency programs in its annual report, and requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to procure or provide energy efficiency and conservation programs targeting low-income households, with specific energy savings goals for 2024-2026. It establishes a Green and Healthy Task Force to coordinate resources and develop plans to provide energy efficiency retrofits to all low-income households by 2031, and includes provisions for funding, contractor requirements, and reporting.
responsible_party: The Department of Housing and Community Development and the Public Service Commission.
stakeholders: Low-income households and communities in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages the use of minority-owned, women-owned, and veteran-owned businesses for program implementation, and sets job and wage standards for contractors, which may support small business participation and success.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Athletic Trainers - Dry Needling Approval
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a certain type of intramuscular manual therapy involving the insertion of one or more solid needles into the muscle and related tissues to effect change in the muscle and related tissues, as a specialized task; requiring 80 hours of instruction in a certain continuing education course, including 40 hours of practical, hands-on instruction under the guidance of a certain licensed health care practitioner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a specific manual therapy involving needle insertion into muscles, under certain training and certification requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Licensed athletic trainers and their patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill establishes a clear certification process for athletic trainers to perform dry needling, which could help them expand their services and reduce the risk of failure due to licensing issues.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims of Sexually Assaultive Behavior
