responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Recipients of electronic benefits, low-income households, and vulnerable populations relying on public assistance programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets benefit recipients and aims to improve security and fraud prevention in electronic benefits programs, which may indirectly support the stability of related small vendors but does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Greenspace Equity Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Greenspace Equity Program in the Department of Natural Resources to provide grants to eligible applicants for enhancing the public health and livability of overburdened and underserved communities by implementing projects to preserve, create, and enhance community greenspace; requiring the Department to submit certain grant applications to the Maryland State Clearinghouse for Intergovernmental Assistance; requiring certain grant applications to be subject to approval by the Board of Public Works; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Greenspace Equity Program within the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to provide grants for projects that create or improve greenspaces in overburdened and underserved communities, aiming to enhance public health and community livability.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Overburdened communities and underserved communities in Maryland, including residents, local governments, land trusts, and nonprofit organizations involved in greenspace projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on greenspace projects and community health, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent unit of State government with the authority to conduct and support advocacy, systems change, and capacity-building efforts to promote inclusive communities and equity in services for individuals with disabilities in the State, research best practices and provide related training and technical assistance to communities in the State, and inform State and local leaders about disability issues.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent unit of State government responsible for advocating for individuals with developmental disabilities, developing a strategic plan, and advising state agencies.
responsible_party: The Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council, which is an independent unit of State government.
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities, their families, guardians, and advocates in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on disability advocacy and support.

Title: Elevator Safety - Privately Owned Single-Family Residential Elevators - Inspection and Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that an elevator installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling on or after October 1, 2023, is subject to certain inspection and registration requirements; prohibiting the Commissioner of Labor and Industry from disclosing to the public any information regarding a registered elevator unit installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling; and requiring the Commissioner to delete certain registration information on the completion of the final acceptance inspection on a certain unit.
bill_summary: The bill establishes inspection and registration requirements for elevators installed in privately owned single-family residential dwellings in Maryland, effective October 1, 2023, including final acceptance inspections and registration procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Elevator Safety Division
stakeholders: Homeowners with privately owned single-family residential elevators in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on residential elevators and safety inspections, which is unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Disabled Law Enforcement Officers and Rescue Workers - Definition and Eligibility
Synopsis: Requiring a county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a law enforcement officer or rescue worker; altering eligibility for the tax credit to include certain disabled law enforcement officers or rescue workers who were domiciled in the State as, or any time within the 5 years before the officer or worker died or was determined to be disabled; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill expands property tax credits for disabled law enforcement officers and rescue workers, including those who were domiciled in Maryland within five years before their disability or death, and clarifies definitions and eligibility criteria.
responsible_party: County or municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Disabled law enforcement officers, rescue workers, their families, and cohabitors in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on property tax credits for certain public safety personnel.

Title: State Board of Elections - Municipal Elections - Publication of Results on Website
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to publish municipal election results on its website immediately after a municipality submits its election results; and requiring, within 30 days after the results of a municipal election are certified, the municipality to submit to the State Board an electronic copy of the election results for each office or question voted on at the election.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to establish an online portal for municipalities to submit election results and to publish these results on its website immediately after submission. Municipalities must submit detailed election results within 30 days of certification.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Municipal governments and residents of Maryland who participate in municipal elections
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Investor-Owned Utilities - Prevailing Wage - Enforcement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce certain prevailing wage requirements for contractors and subcontractors working on projects involving and traffic control activities related to underground gas or electric infrastructure of an investor-owned gas company, electric company, or gas and electric company; requiring certain contractors and subcontractors to request from the Department a copy of a certain wage determination and ensure that employees are paid in compliance with existing prevailing wage rates; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce prevailing wage laws for contractors working on underground gas or electric infrastructure projects of investor-owned utilities, ensuring employees are paid the correct wages and providing guidance on wage rates.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, and employees working on underground gas and electric infrastructure projects of investor-owned utilities in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to ensure fair wages and compliance, which can help small businesses avoid penalties and legal issues, potentially reducing their failure risk.

Title: Agriculture - Use of Antimicrobial Drugs - Reporting Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering the date from February 1, 2020 and each February 1 thereafter, to July 1 each year, on which the Department of Agriculture must submit to the General Assembly a certain annual report regarding the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in cattle, swine, and poultry to the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Agriculture to annually report on the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in cattle, swine, and poultry, including data collection from various federal agencies and trade associations, and submission of veterinary records by licensed veterinarians. The report's deadline is changed to July 1 each year.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers and livestock producers in Maryland, veterinarians, and public health agencies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on antimicrobial use reporting is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily involves data collection and reporting requirements.

Title: City of Annapolis - Alcoholic Beverages - Art Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an art establishment beer and wine license in the City of Annapolis; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners to issue the license to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption to a nonprofit organization primarily engaged in certain arts-related activities; and providing for a license fee of $1,000.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an art establishment beer and wine license in Annapolis, allowing nonprofit organizations engaged in art display, instruction, or live performances to sell or serve beer and wine on-site.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners in the City of Annapolis
stakeholders: Nonprofit art organizations and their audiences in Annapolis
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing opportunity for nonprofit art organizations, which could help them generate revenue and sustain their operations, potentially reducing their risk of failure.

Title: Maryland Stadium Authority - Camden Yards Sports Facilities Funds and Bus Rapid Transit Fund
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Stadium Authority; establishing the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund and the Camden Yards Baseball Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund to enable the Maryland Stadium Authority to take certain actions; requiring the Authority to administer the funds; altering the amount the Comptroller is required to distribute from the State Lottery Fund to certain funds; establishing the Bus Rapid Transit Fund to provide grants to eligible grantees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes specialized funds and modifies the membership and governance of the Maryland Stadium Authority to support financing for sports facilities at Camden Yards, including football and baseball stadiums, and for bus rapid transit projects. It allocates lottery funds to these new funds and other related projects, and sets rules for their administration and investment.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Professional sports teams, sports fans, residents and businesses near Camden Yards, public transit users, and local governments involved in transit projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides dedicated funding and financial mechanisms for sports facilities and transit projects, which can stabilize and support local economies and small businesses in those areas.

Title: Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in the State Department of Education to license outdoor, nature-based early learning and child care programs to expand access to affordable, high-quality early learning and child care programs and investigate the benefits of outdoor, nature-based classrooms; requiring the Department to submit a final report to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027, with recommendations for modifying or expanding the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in Maryland to license outdoor, nature-based early learning and child care programs, aiming to expand access to high-quality, affordable early childhood education and explore the benefits of outdoor classrooms.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children and families seeking outdoor, nature-based early childhood education programs, as well as providers of such programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program could help small outdoor preschool providers by providing licensing and support, potentially reducing failure rates among small nature-based early learning programs.

Title: St. Mary's County - Transfer of Child Support Unit and Personnel to the Child Support Administration
Synopsis: Transferring all the functions, powers, and duties of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State's Attorney for St. Mary's County and certain personnel to the Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the functions, powers, and personnel of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State’s Attorney for St. Mary’s County to the Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services, effective October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Child support enforcement agencies and families in St. Mary’s County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Transfer of Membership – Modifications
Synopsis: Making certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System eligible to receive creditable service at retirement for unused sick leave accrued by the member in the State Employees' Retirement System or State Employees' Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to transfer certain individuals' Employees' Retirement System or Employees' Pension System service to the Correctional Officers' Retirement System on June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to receive credit for unused sick leave from the State Employees' Retirement or Pension Systems at retirement, and mandates the transfer of service credits from these systems to the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for eligible individuals by June 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System and former members of the State Employees' Retirement or Pension Systems who are eligible for transfer and credit for unused sick leave.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to retirement system service credits for government employees.

Title: Gaming - Video Lottery Terminals - Local Impact Grants and Pimlico Community Development Authority Membership - Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering the distribution of certain funds from local impact grants to Baltimore City; and altering the appointment process for certain members of the Pimlico Community Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the distribution of funds from video lottery terminals and local impact grants, including changes to how funds are allocated to Baltimore City and other jurisdictions, and alters the appointment process for the Pimlico Community Development Authority.
responsible_party: Baltimore City government and the Pimlico Community Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those in the Park Heights Corridor and neighborhoods near Pimlico Race Course
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill allocates funds primarily for community development and economic projects, which could support small business stability, but it does not specify direct measures to reduce small business failure.

Title: Election Law - Ballot Issuance, Processing, and Reporting Procedures and 2024 Primary Date
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to send, not later than 43 days before an election, a ballot to voters who have made a request and qualify to vote by absentee ballot; altering the procedures for the canvassing of and curing of errors on absentee and provisional ballots; prohibiting the tabulation of absentee ballot vote totals before the polls close; requiring that the statewide primary election and the primary election for the municipal offices of Baltimore City in 2024 be held on the second Tuesday in May; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's election procedures, including timelines for ballot mailing, canvassing, and reporting election results. It also changes the primary election date to the second Tuesday in May in 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local boards of elections
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, and election officials in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on election procedures and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Earnable Compensation, Nonvested Former Members, and Immediate Vesting
Synopsis: Specifying that the definition of "earnable compensation" does not include certain payments requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to pay a nonvested former member's accumulated contributions to the nonvested former member's designated beneficiary or estate if the nonvested former member dies before withdrawing the member's contributions; and providing a list of individuals who immediately vest on taking certain offices.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the definition of 'earnable compensation' for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifies that certain lump sum payments are excluded from this definition, and mandates that nonvested former members' contributions be paid to their beneficiaries or estates if they die before withdrawing. It also lists individuals who immediately vest upon taking certain state offices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including current and former state employees and beneficiaries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on pension system definitions and benefits for state employees.

Title: State Procurement - Small Procurement - Definition
Synopsis: Increasing certain dollar thresholds of spending for the purposes of defining "small procurement" for State procurement contracts.
bill_summary: The bill increases the dollar thresholds defining 'small procurement' for Maryland state contracts, raising limits from $50,000 to $100,000 for most categories and from $100,000 to $200,000 for construction and capital projects.
responsible_party: The Maryland State procurement agencies, including the Department of General Services and the Department of Transportation.
stakeholders: Small businesses and contractors seeking to participate in state procurement contracts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing the thresholds for small procurement, the bill potentially allows small businesses to access more opportunities, which could reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Family Prosperity Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the percentage of the federal earned income tax credit used for determining the amount that an individual may claim as a refund under the Maryland earned income tax credit under certain circumstances; repealing a certain limitation on the amount certain individuals may claim as a refund under the credit; altering the definition of "qualified child" and income eligibility requirements for purposes of qualifying for a certain credit against the State income tax for certain dependent children; etc.
bill_summary: The Family Prosperity Act of 2023 modifies Maryland's earned income tax credits, including increasing the percentage of the federal earned income tax credit used for refunds, removing certain limitations on refunds, and expanding eligibility criteria for credits related to dependent children and individuals without qualifying children.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue (or equivalent tax authority)
stakeholders: Low- and moderate-income residents of Maryland, especially those with children or without qualifying children who benefit from the earned income tax credits.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets individual taxpayers and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Financial Regulation - Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund - Establishment (Access to Banking Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund as an instrumentality of the State for purposes of developing opportunities for banking institutions and credit unions to better serve the needs of low- to moderate-income tracts; providing for certain assessment offset credits for certain banking institutions and credit unions in certain areas; authorizing the use of the Banking Institution and Credit Union Regulation Fund for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund, a private venture fund aimed at developing financial products and innovations to improve access to capital and financial services in low- to moderate-income areas. It authorizes investments, governance, and funding mechanisms, including matching assessments for banking institutions and credit unions that establish or maintain branches in targeted areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation and the Maryland State Government (specifically the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund)
stakeholders: Banking institutions, credit unions, and residents of low- to moderate-income census tracts in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve access to financial services and capital in underserved areas, which can help small businesses in those areas succeed and reduce failure rates.

Title: Maryland Energy Administration – Energy Programs – Modifications (Clean Transportation and Energy Act)
Synopsis: Altering the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program by extending the duration of the Program through fiscal year 2026, repealing the rebates that may be issued to retail service station dealers, and increasing the limitation on the total amount of rebates that the Maryland Energy Administration may issue in each fiscal year; altering the Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Zero-Emission Vehicle Grant Program by altering the definition of "grant"; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's energy programs, including extending the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program, increasing rebate limits, and prioritizing grants and loans for electric vehicles and infrastructure in low-income and underserved communities. It also allocates funds for renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Individuals, businesses, and government entities involved in electric vehicle infrastructure, renewable energy, and energy efficiency, especially in low-income and underserved communities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial incentives and grants for electric vehicle infrastructure and renewable energy projects, which can support small businesses involved in these sectors and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Office of Statewide Broadband - Study of Broadband Expansion Incentives
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development to conduct a study as to how the State can incentivize broadband service providers to expand broadband infrastructure to communities that are unserved or underserved; and requiring the Office to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study by the Office of Statewide Broadband to explore incentives for expanding broadband infrastructure in Maryland, including regulatory and financial measures, and reports findings by January 1, 2024. It also provides tax incentives such as a subtraction modification for qualified broadband grants and exempts sales and use tax on network equipment used for internet service and broadband deployment.
responsible_party: Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Broadband service providers, unserved and underserved communities in Maryland, and federal and private broadband infrastructure grant recipients.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's incentives for broadband expansion and equipment exemption could help small businesses involved in broadband deployment by reducing costs and encouraging investment, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Economic Development - Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund (Innovation Economy Infrastructure Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program in the Department of Commerce to provide funding for certain costs for infrastructure projects in eligible technology sectors; requiring certain grantees to provide matching funds and to demonstrate certain abilities; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the projects funded through and the economic impact of the Program by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund in Maryland to provide funding for infrastructure projects supporting innovation in specified technology sectors, with requirements for matching funds and project demonstration.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Private companies, nonprofits, local governments, colleges, and universities involved in technology infrastructure projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support innovative infrastructure projects, which can help small businesses in the technology sectors by providing funding and resources, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Military Retirement Income (Keep Our Heroes Home Act)
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain military retirement income received by individuals under the age of 55 years to $12,500 and individuals at least 55 years of age to $20,000 during the taxable year for certain military service; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill increases the amount of military retirement income that is exempt from Maryland income tax, with the exemption amount rising over time for qualifying individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Military retirees and their families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore County - Circuit Court Judgeships
Synopsis: Increasing the number of resident judges of the Circuit Court for Baltimore County from 20 to 21.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of resident judges in the Baltimore County Circuit Court from 20 to 21, effective July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Circuit Court and Maryland Judicial System
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, legal professionals, and the judicial system
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure.

Title: Cannabis Reform
Synopsis: Renaming the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission to be the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission; establishing the Maryland Cannabis Administration as an independent unit of State government; establishing a regulatory and licensing system for adult-use cannabis; imposing a sales and use tax of 9% on the sale of cannabis; requiring the Administration, by July 1, 2023, to convert medical cannabis licenses to licenses to operate a medical and adult-use cannabis business; etc.
bill_summary: This bill reforms Maryland's cannabis laws by establishing a new independent Maryland Cannabis Administration, creating a comprehensive licensing, testing, and regulatory framework for adult-use cannabis, and allocating revenue from cannabis sales to various funds supporting social equity, public health, and community reinvestment.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration, a new independent agency established by the bill.
stakeholders: Individuals and communities impacted by cannabis laws, including social equity applicants, medical cannabis patients, cannabis businesses, and local governments.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for grants, technical assistance, and a capital access program aimed at supporting small, minority, and women-owned cannabis businesses, which could help reduce business failures.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring at least one applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Carroll County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application is filed and to remain a resident of the State for the license to remain valid; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires that applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Carroll County must be residents of Maryland, not just residents of Carroll County, and must remain Maryland residents for the license to stay valid.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board and Maryland Department of Liquor Control
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Carroll County, Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failures by ensuring license stability through residency requirements, but its direct impact on failure rates is limited.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Modification of Seating Requirements
Synopsis: Modifying the seating requirements for Class B, Class BR, and Class C beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Carroll County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the seating requirements for certain beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Carroll County, Maryland, including licenses for hotels, restaurants, and clubs, allowing for up to 15 seats at bars or counters.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Businesses holding alcohol licenses in Carroll County, including hotels, restaurants, and clubs, and their patrons.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By relaxing seating restrictions, the bill may reduce operational challenges for licensees, potentially lowering the risk of business failure.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Event Entertainment Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing an annual fee of $2,000 for a multiple event entertainment alcoholic beverages license where the number of events number 41 or more per year in Carroll County; and repealing the limit on the total number of days for which a multiple event entertainment license may be used.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a fee structure and regulations for a new Class C multiple event alcohol license in Carroll County, removing the previous limit of 40 days per year and allowing certain organizations to hold multiple events with different fee tiers based on the number of events.
responsible_party: The Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Fire departments and arts centers in Carroll County that hold or wish to hold multiple events with alcohol licenses
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies licensing and potentially reduces barriers for organizations to hold multiple events with alcohol, which could support small business and community event organizers.

Title: Town of Mount Airy (Carroll County and Frederick County) - Urban Renewal Authority
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Mount Airy in Carroll County and Frederick County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers within an urban renewal area under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Town of Mount Airy in Maryland the authority to exercise urban renewal powers within designated areas, including slum and blight clearance, land acquisition, redevelopment, and financing through bonds.
responsible_party: The Town of Mount Airy, Maryland, specifically its urban renewal agency or municipal government.
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, and businesses within the designated urban renewal areas of Mount Airy.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for urban renewal, land redevelopment, and financing could help revitalize areas, potentially reducing small business failures by improving infrastructure and economic conditions.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 9 Limited Distillery License - Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of a Class 9 limited distillery license to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license with certain privileges.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes holders of Class 9 limited distillery licenses to sell and deliver their products in bulk both within and outside Maryland, and allows them to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license to distribute their own liquor.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Commission
stakeholders: Small distillery license holders and consumers of craft spirits in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing small distilleries to self-distribute their products and obtain wholesaler licenses, the bill aims to reduce barriers and support the growth of small distilleries, potentially lowering their failure rate.

Title: Opioids - Opioid Restitution Advisory Council and Fund and Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to direct that an Opioid Restitution Fund Advisory Council committee be formed if required by a court or administrative order or settlement agreement entered into by the Attorney General; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, subject to the limitations of the State budget, to allow certain entities to choose the formulation or dosage of an opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the Food and Drug Administration with which the entity is provided through the Overdose Response Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Health to allow entities to choose the formulation or dosage of opioid overdose reversal drugs provided under the Overdose Response Program, and establishes procedures for the formation of advisory committees related to opioid restitution and overdose response. It also details the management of the Opioid Restitution Fund and its distribution to address opioid-related settlements and judgments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Healthcare providers, public health organizations, and individuals at risk of opioid overdose in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for the Department to provide overdose reversal drugs and allow entities to choose formulations aim to support organizations involved in overdose response, potentially reducing small business failures related to opioid crisis management.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study the provision of and access to mental health services in institutions of higher education; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study and recommend improvements in mental health services for college students, including access, best practices, and barriers.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and participating higher education institutions.
stakeholders: College and university students in Maryland, especially those accessing mental health services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on mental health services in higher education, not directly on small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health Benefits - Creditable Service
Synopsis: Requiring the inclusion of all State service while an individual was employed by the State in the Executive, Legislative, or Judicial Branch of government for the purpose of determining eligibility for State retiree health benefits.
bill_summary: The bill requires that all State service, including employment by the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, be counted as creditable service when determining eligibility for State retiree health benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or the relevant State retirement and health benefits agencies.
stakeholders: Retired State employees and their spouses or dependents who are eligible for or receiving retiree health benefits.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on State employee retirement and health benefits.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Food Donations by Qualified Farms - Sunset Repeal and Alterations (Farmers Feeding Families Act)
Synopsis: Repealing certain termination provisions for a tax credit against the State income tax for fresh farm and organic fresh farm food donations; altering the amounts of the tax credit from 50% to 100% of the value of an eligible food donation and from 75% to 100% of the value of the donated certified organic produce a qualified farm is eligible to receive under certain circumstances; applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset provision for a Maryland income tax credit for food donations made by qualified farms, extending the program until 2026. It also adjusts the credit percentages for donations, increasing the maximum credit from 50% to 75% of the donation's value, and from 75% to 100% for certified organic produce.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture in coordination with the Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Qualified farms in Maryland, food donation organizations, and residents benefiting from increased food donations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill supports small farms by providing a tax credit for food donations, which can help reduce waste and improve farm income, potentially decreasing the risk of farm failure.

Title: State Procurement - Purchasing - Compost, Mulch, and Soil Amendments and Aggregate
Synopsis: Requiring each unit of State government to include certain specifications for certain products produced from recycled or organic materials when establishing procurement specifications for compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregate; requiring the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish certain specifications for purchasing of compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregates produced from certain materials and publish and maintain the specifications online for use by State agencies.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to prioritize the use of compost, mulch, and soil amendments made from recycled or organic materials in their procurement processes. It also mandates the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish and publish specifications for these products.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Purchasing Committee and the Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, and contractors involved in land maintenance and landscaping activities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing specifications and promoting the use of recycled organic products, the bill encourages the growth of small businesses producing these environmentally friendly products, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Baltimore City - 41st District - Alcoholic Beverages - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing, for a certain period of time, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to exchange a Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area for a Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor license under certain circumstances; repealing certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Baltimore City; and altering a certain period of time during which a certain alcoholic beverages license may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to exchange certain existing alcohol licenses for new licenses, removes geographic and temporal restrictions on issuing certain licenses, and establishes new licensing provisions for off-premises alcohol sales, including marketplace licenses, with specific time limits for these provisions.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, businesses involved in alcohol sales, and consumers in Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to facilitate small business operations by allowing license exchanges and expanding licensing options, which could reduce barriers to entry and operational challenges for small alcohol-related businesses.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Restitution Orders - Recording Fees
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision to prohibit a court from assessing certain costs on a certain person or governmental unit for recording and indexing an order of restitution issued by any court in the State instead of the court in which the judgment of restitution was entered.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits courts from assessing costs on individuals or governmental units for recording and indexing restitution orders issued by any court in Maryland, including costs for recording a notice of lien or filing a notice of satisfaction.
responsible_party: Courts in Maryland (judicial system)
stakeholders: Individuals ordered to pay restitution, governmental units involved in restitution enforcement, and courts in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces costs associated with recording restitution orders, which may lower financial burdens on courts and related entities, but it does not directly target small business failure.

Title: Health and Human Services Transportation Improvement Act of 2023
Synopsis: Repealing the $500,000 cap on grants that may be awarded by the Maryland Transit Administration under the Maryland Senior Rides Program; repealing the $400,000 cap on the Job Access and Reverse Commute Program; establishing the State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation to examine transportation needs of the elderly, persons with disabilities, and residents requiring transportation assistance to jobs, appointments, citizen programs, and other engagements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Rural Nonemergency Medical Transportation Program to assist individuals in rural Maryland counties with transportation to medical services, and creates a State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation to improve transportation services for vulnerable populations.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Transportation and the State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation.
stakeholders: Individuals in rural Maryland counties who need transportation to medical services, including elderly, disabled, and low- to moderate-income residents.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding and coordination for transportation services, which may help small nonprofit organizations and transportation providers, but its primary focus is on public health and social services.

Title: State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, and Judges’ Retirement System – Surviving Spouse Benefit – Same–Sex Spouses
Synopsis: Authorizing the correction of the designated beneficiary election for certain retirees of the State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, or Judges' Retirement System who retired on or before December 31, 2012, if the retiree named an individual of the same sex to be a designated beneficiary and the retiree married the designated beneficiary on or after January 1, 2013.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain retirees of Maryland's State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, and Judges’ Retirement System to update their beneficiary elections to reflect marriages to same-sex spouses if they married after retirement and before July 1, 2023. It also provides for retroactive adjustments and payments to ensure survivor benefits are correctly paid to spouses or beneficiaries.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Boards of Trustees for the respective retirement systems.
stakeholders: Retirees of the Maryland State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, and Judges’ Retirement System, and their spouses or designated beneficiaries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses retirement and survivor benefit procedures for specific public safety and judicial retirees.

Title: Human Relations - Housing Discrimination - Service Dogs
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from discriminating in the sale or rental of, or otherwise making unavailable or denying, a dwelling to an individual with a disability who has, obtains, or retains a certain service dog.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits discrimination in housing based on a person's possession or retention of a service dog or guide dog, including in sales, rentals, and related services. It also mandates accessible design features for new multifamily dwellings and provides exemptions and protections for individuals with service dogs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities who use service dogs or guide dogs, and potential or current tenants or buyers of housing in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions mainly focus on housing discrimination and accessibility standards, which are unlikely to have a significant direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Nursing – Sunset Extension, Licensure Exceptions, and Board Operations and Membership
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Nursing in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; altering the exceptions to the registered nurse and licensed practical nurse licensure requirements; providing that, for a certain period of time, the Secretary of Health, rather than the Board, has authority over the infrastructure operations of the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the Maryland State Board of Nursing, modifies its operational and staffing authority, and requires an independent evaluation of the Board to improve its efficiency and effectiveness.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, specifically the Secretary of Health, is responsible for implementing the programs and overseeing the Board's operations.
stakeholders: Nurses, nursing students, healthcare facilities, and the general public in Maryland who are served by nursing professionals.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions to evaluate and improve the Board's operations and staffing could lead to more efficient licensing processes, potentially reducing small business failures related to staffing and licensing delays.

Title: Department of Aging - Long-Term Care and Dementia Care Navigation Programs
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Aging to oversee long-term care and train the staff of long-term care and dementia care navigation programs; requiring each area agency to establish a long-term care and dementia care navigation program; and requiring the Department to submit a report by October 1, 2024, and each year thereafter, to the Governor, the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House, and certain committees of the General Assembly about the services provided by the program and to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill establishes statewide long-term care and dementia care navigation programs overseen by the Maryland Department of Aging. It requires each area agency to develop and implement these programs, which include providing information, referrals, cognitive assessments, caregiver support, and coordination with healthcare providers. The Department will oversee staff training, disseminate best practices, and publish annual reports on program activities and outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Individuals with dementia or at risk of dementia, caregivers, healthcare providers, and senior residents in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to improve access to care and support for individuals with dementia, which can help reduce the burden on small healthcare and social service providers, potentially decreasing small business failure related to unmet community needs.

Title: Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals - Extension of Dates
Synopsis: Extending the reporting and termination dates, to July 1, 2024, and June 30, 2025, respectively, for the Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals.
bill_summary: The bill extends the reporting and termination dates for the Workgroup on Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals in Maryland, which studies shortages and recommends ways to increase diversity among behavioral health professionals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and other underrepresented behavioral health professionals and the communities they serve in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Economic Development - Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in the Department of Commerce to provide grants to certain small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises to assist those manufacturers with implementing new Industry 4.0 technology or related infrastructure for certain purposes; establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; and requiring the Governor to include in the budget bill for fiscal years 2025 through 2028 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in Maryland to provide grants to small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises for implementing Industry 4.0 technologies, such as advanced sensors, robotics, AI, and cybersecurity, to boost productivity and competitiveness.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce, with possible administration by a state-chartered corporation under Title 10 of the Maryland Code.
stakeholders: Small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to significantly reduce small business failures by providing financial support for technological upgrades that improve efficiency and competitiveness.

Title: Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding the forms of financial assistance available under the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program; altering eligibility requirements for projects that may receive financial assistance under the Program; altering the time period when applications may be submitted under the Program; repealing certain restrictions on the amount of financial assistance that may be provided under the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and modifies the 'Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program' to provide more types of financial aid, adjust eligibility criteria, extend application periods, and streamline processes for supporting affordable housing projects in historically redlined neighborhoods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Affordable housing developers and residents in low-income census tracts and sustainable communities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support affordable housing projects, which can help reduce small business failures related to real estate development and rehabilitation in targeted communities.

Title: Animal Testing and Research - Human-Relevant Research Funding and Animal Testing and Research Contributions
Synopsis: Establishing the Human-Relevant Research Fund under the administration of the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide grants and loans to promote State-funded research intended to develop human-relevant alternatives to using nonhuman animals in medical and product testing and research; requiring, beginning January 15, 2024, research facilities that engage in animal testing or research to pay a contribution, based on a certain number of animals, to the Secretary of Health; providing a civil penalty for a violation of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Human–Relevant Research Fund to support research on alternatives to animal testing, creates a licensing and contribution system for research facilities using animals, and mandates reporting on the progress of such research in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Research facilities conducting animal testing, public and private research entities, and animals used in testing in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding and support for research on alternatives to animal testing, which could help small research businesses innovate and reduce failure rates related to regulatory or ethical challenges.

Title: Higher Education – Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program – Surviving Spouses of Service Members
Synopsis: Specifying that a certain surviving spouse of a member of the armed forces is eligible to apply for a scholarship under the Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program if the service member died, suffered a service connected disability, or was declared to be a prisoner of war or missing in action under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility criteria for the Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program to include surviving spouses of armed forces members who died, suffered a service-connected disability, or were declared prisoners of war or missing in action under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Surviving spouses of military service members, military families, and students seeking scholarships in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Utility Account Holders - Victims of Abuse - Protections
Synopsis: Authorizing an account holder who is the victim of abuse to terminate, and requiring a utility to allow for the termination of, the account holder's future liability under a utility contract if the account holder provides the utility with certain written notice requesting termination of the account holder's future liability under the contract; requiring a utility to allow an account holder who terminates a utility contract under the Act to open a new utility account notwithstanding a certain account balance or arrearage; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires utilities in Maryland to allow victims of domestic violence to terminate their utility accounts without penalty and to open new accounts regardless of existing balances. It also permits account holders to be released from utility contracts if they provide documentation of abuse, and sets procedures for confidentiality and timely processing.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Utilities Commission and utility companies
stakeholders: Victims of domestic violence who are utility account holders in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individual consumers and domestic violence victims, not small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Hospital Credentialing - Reappointment Process for Physician Staff - Modification
Synopsis: Requiring that the credential reappointment process for physician staff included in certain minimum standards for hospitals licensed in the State be conducted in accordance with standards of the accreditation body that accredits a hospital, rather than every 2 years.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the credentialing reappointment process for hospital physicians in Maryland, requiring it to be conducted according to the standards of the hospital's accrediting body rather than on a fixed schedule.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health (or the Secretary of Health)
stakeholders: Hospitals, physicians, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on hospital credentialing standards is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Public Information Act - Inspection of E-Mail Addresses and Telephone Numbers
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "personal information" for purposes of certain provisions of the Public Information Act to include an individual's personal e-mail address; requiring certain custodians to deny inspection of certain records of personal e-mail addresses and telephone numbers except under certain circumstances; and requiring certain custodians to allow inspection of certain records of business e-mail addresses under the same circumstances as inspection of certain records of business addresses and telephone numbers.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Public Information Act to include email addresses as personal information that can be protected from public inspection, with certain exceptions for business email addresses and specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Information Technology or the custodian of public records in relevant agencies.
stakeholders: Individuals whose personal email addresses and telephone numbers are included in public records, as well as organizations and government agencies that handle such records.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily concerns privacy protections for personal contact information.

Title: Washington County - Deputy Sheriffs and Correctional Deputies - Employment Conditions and Collective Bargaining
Synopsis: Altering the grounds on which a deputy sheriff having a rank of major or below in Washington County may be discharged after 2 years of continuous employment; providing that a special deputy sheriff in Washington County is not a State employee for certain purposes; authorizing sworn deputy sheriffs at the rank of sergeant and below and correctional deputies at the rank of sergeant and below to engage in collective bargaining with the Washington County Sheriff and the County Administrator; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows sworn deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies at the rank of sergeant and below in Washington County to engage in collective bargaining over wages and benefits, establishes procedures for certification of labor organizations, and prohibits strikes. It also clarifies employment conditions and the role of special deputy sheriffs.
responsible_party: Washington County Sheriff’s Office and Washington County government
stakeholders: Sworn deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies at the rank of sergeant and below in Washington County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by clarifying employment and collective bargaining conditions, it may contribute to more stable employment conditions for law enforcement staff.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Golf Simulator Facility
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a Class B-GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a golf simulator facility under certain circumstances; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring the license holder to submit an annual gross sales report to the Board before a license may be renewed; and establishing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County to issue a new type of alcohol license for golf simulator facilities, allowing them to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption if they meet certain criteria, including offering food and having specific sales proportions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facilities, patrons of these facilities, and local businesses in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing opportunity for golf simulator facilities, which could help these small businesses operate more successfully by allowing alcohol sales under specific conditions.

Title: Garrett County - Tax Sales - Auctioneer Fees
Synopsis: Increasing, from $8 to $10, the auctioneer's fee for the tax sale of property in Garrett County for each property sold.
bill_summary: The bill increases the auctioneer's fee for tax sales of property in Garrett County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Garrett County government or tax sale authorities
stakeholders: Property owners, tax sale participants, and local government in Garrett County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages Districts – Legislative Districting Plan References
Synopsis: Updating certain provisions of law regarding Baltimore City alcoholic beverages districts to refer to the Legislative Districting Plan of 2022; and requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to grant a certain exemption to certain persons under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates the boundaries of alcoholic beverages districts in Baltimore City to align with the 2022 Legislative Districting Plan, and allows the Board of License Commissioners to grant exemptions for certain license holders to remain open after hours under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders in Baltimore City, including restaurants, pharmacies, and other licensed establishments
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may help small businesses by allowing certain license holders to stay open later, potentially increasing revenue and reducing the risk of failure.

Title: Talbot County - Board of Education - Election of Officers
Synopsis: Altering the timing of the annual election of the officers of the Talbot County Board of Education to be at its last meeting at the end of each calendar year, or at the meeting in December each year.
bill_summary: The bill changes the timing of the annual election of officers (president and vice president) for the Talbot County Board of Education, specifying that the election will now occur at the last meeting of the calendar year or in December, instead of the first meeting of the year.
responsible_party: Talbot County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Talbot County who are served by the Board of Education
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Real Estate Brokers, Salespersons, and Associate Brokers - Continuing Education Courses - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for the subject matter of continuing education courses for licensees issued an initial license by the Real Estate Commission.
bill_summary: The bill updates the continuing education requirements for real estate licensees in Maryland, specifying the topics and hours needed for license renewal, including fair housing, ethics, brokerage relationships, and other relevant subjects.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees, including brokers, salespersons, and associate brokers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By ensuring real estate professionals are well-educated on current laws, ethics, and industry practices, the bill aims to improve the professionalism and effectiveness of real estate services, which can contribute to the stability and success of small real estate businesses.

Title: Comptroller and State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Enhancing Access to Property Tax Benefits - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to confer to identify ways the Comptroller could collaborate with the Department to enhance access to certain property tax benefits administered by the Department; and requiring the Comptroller and the Department to submit a joint report of their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to collaborate during the 2023 legislative interim to improve access, awareness, and application processes for certain property tax benefits, and to submit a joint report with recommendations by December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland who are eligible for property tax benefits, including homeowners, renters, disabled veterans, and surviving spouses.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on property tax benefits for individuals.

Title: Real Estate Appraisers - Licensing and Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for a real estate appraisal license and for a certificate for residential or general real estate appraisal to include completion of certain criteria in the Practical Applications of Real Estate Appraisal program.
bill_summary: The bill updates the qualifications for real estate appraiser licenses and certificates in Maryland, including the addition of completion of specific criteria in the Practical Applications of Real Estate Appraisal program, and aligns state requirements with federal standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Appraisal Commission
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers, prospective appraisers, and the real estate industry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and updating licensing requirements, the bill aims to streamline the licensing process, potentially reducing barriers for new appraisers and supporting small businesses in the real estate sector.

Title: Garrett County - Board of County Commissioners - Meetings
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of County Commissioners for Garrett County to meet at least twice a month; authorizing the Board to hold public meetings in person or through live video streaming; and prohibiting the Board from meeting solely through live video streaming for more than two consecutive meetings without a formal declaration of a state of emergency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Garrett County Board of County Commissioners to meet at least twice a month, allows meetings to be held in person or via live video streaming, and limits the number of consecutive meetings that can be held solely through live streaming without declaring a state of emergency.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Garrett County and local government officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects government meeting procedures and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration – Fare Price Requirements – Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain requirements that the Maryland Transit Administration increase fares for certain transit services according to the Consumer Price Index; and repealing certain provisions prohibiting the Administration from increasing fares under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements and restrictions related to fare increases for Maryland Transit Administration services, allowing more flexibility in setting and increasing fares without the previous limitations.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Transit riders and commuters in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects transit fare policies and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Historic Trust - Historic Preservation Loan Fund - Qualified Cooperating Nonprofit Organizations - Transfers
Synopsis: Altering the uses of the Historic Preservation Loan Fund; and authorizing the Maryland Historic Trust to transfer funds from the Fund to a qualified cooperating nonprofit organization to pay for the acquisition, restoration, or rehabilitation of certain historic properties, to provide loans for the acquisition, rehabilitation, restoration, or refinancing of certain properties, and for necessary administrative and programmatic expenses.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the uses of the Maryland Historic Preservation Loan Fund, establishes the Historic Preservation Partnership Program and Fund, transfers funds from the Loan Fund to a nonprofit organization for preservation projects, and dissolves the Loan Fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Historic Trust
stakeholders: Historic property owners, preservation nonprofits, and communities involved in historic preservation projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on historic preservation funding and programs, with no direct emphasis on small business failure reduction.

Title: Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland to study the adequacy of trauma center funding across the State for operating, capital, and workforce costs; and requiring the Commission to reports its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study Trauma Center Funding in Maryland to evaluate the adequacy of funding for trauma centers across the state, including operating, capital, and workforce costs, and to make recommendations.
responsible_party: The Maryland Institute for Emergency Medicine Services Systems (MIEMSS) and the Maryland Health Care Commission.
stakeholders: Trauma centers, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland who rely on trauma services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on trauma center funding and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Cemeteries - Interment - Pet Remains
Synopsis: Making certain provisions of law governing cemeteries applicable to pet cemeteries; providing that a certain registered cemeterian, registered crematory operator, or permit holder who sells or offers to sell to the public certain services for pet remains owes a duty of perpetual care for the cemetery in which certain pet remains are interred; and requiring the Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight to adopt regulations to enforce certain provisions of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill extends laws governing cemeteries to include pet cemeteries and pet remains, requiring certain cemetery operators to provide perpetual care for pet remains interred in their cemeteries.
responsible_party: The Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight, which will adopt regulations to enforce the provisions.
stakeholders: Pet owners, pet cemeteries, and operators of cemeteries that inter pet remains.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill mandates perpetual care duties for cemetery operators handling pet remains, which could influence operational costs and business practices, potentially reducing failures related to legal or operational issues.

Title: Pride of Baltimore II - Appropriations - Extension
Synopsis: Extending until fiscal year 2028 the appropriation of $500,000 from the Transportation Trust Fund that the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill for the operation of the replica sailing vessel known as the Pride of Baltimore II.
bill_summary: The bill extends and increases the annual state funding for the operation of the Pride of Baltimore II from $500,000 to $600,000, and prolongs the period during which this funding is provided until 2028. It also requires recipients to submit reports on fund usage, operational purposes, and strategic plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant state transportation agency
stakeholders: Maryland citizens, maritime education programs, tourism industry, and communities visited by the Pride of Baltimore II
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support maritime and tourism activities, which can help sustain small businesses involved in these sectors, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Frederick County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Display of License
Synopsis: Requiring in Frederick County a license holder to frame and conspicuously display an alcoholic beverages license on the licensed premises.
bill_summary: The bill requires alcohol license holders in Frederick County to frame and display their license conspicuously on the licensed premises.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Authority or local licensing officials
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders and patrons in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates, as it mainly involves display requirements.

Title: Income Tax - Student Loan Debt Relief Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the total amount of credits against the State income tax that the Maryland Higher Education Commission may approve in a taxable year for certain individuals with certain student loan debt amounts; requiring the Commission to reserve a certain amount of the tax credits that the Commission is authorized to approve for certain graduates; extending, from 2 years to 3 years, the period of time that an individual who claims the credit has to prove that they used the credit to repay the individual's student loan debt; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the total amount of income tax credits available for individuals with student loan debt, extends the period to prove the use of the credit for loan repayment, and allocates funds specifically for graduates of historically black colleges and universities. It also requires the Office of Student Financial Assistance to inform scholarship recipients about the credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Office of Student Financial Assistance
stakeholders: Individuals with student loan debt, recent graduates, and students receiving scholarships in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets student loan debt relief and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources – Apprentice Hunting License – Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue an apprentice hunting license to a person under the age of 17 years who has previously been issued an apprentice hunting license under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue a second or subsequent apprentice hunting license to persons under 17 who have previously held one, allowing them to continue hunting under supervision.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Young hunters under 17 who have previously held an apprentice hunting license
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily pertains to hunting license regulations.

Title: Financial Regulation - Modernizing Licensing of Non-Depository Institutions and Elimination of Branch License Requirements
Synopsis: Eliminating requirements for collection agencies and certain non-depository financial institutions to maintain separate licenses for branch locations and authorizing them to conduct business at multiple licensed locations under a single license; and altering certain other requirements and provisions governing the licensing and regulation of collection agencies and certain non-depository financial institutions, including applications, assessments, and bond requirements.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes the licensing process for non-depository financial institutions, including collection agencies, mortgage lenders, sales finance companies, money transmitters, check cashing services, and debt management services providers. It eliminates the requirement for maintaining separate branch licenses, allows conduct at multiple locations under a single license, and updates application, bonding, and fee procedures, primarily through the use of the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLS).
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Financial Regulation, specifically the State Collection Agency Licensing Board and the Commissioner of Financial Regulation.
stakeholders: Non-depository financial institutions such as collection agencies, mortgage lenders, sales finance companies, money transmitters, check cashing services, and debt management services providers operating within Maryland.
