decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's streamlining of licensing procedures and the elimination of branch licensing requirements are expected to reduce administrative burdens and costs for small financial businesses, potentially lowering their failure rates.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Trusts - Decanting (Maryland Trust Decanting Act)
Synopsis: Establishing rules governing the exercise of the decanting power to distribute the property of a first trust to one or more second trusts or to modify the terms of a first trust; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act.
bill_summary: The Maryland Trust Decanting Act establishes rules for exercising the decanting power to distribute or modify trust property, applies retroactively, and clarifies fiduciary duties and protections related to trust decanting.
responsible_party: Maryland State Court System and Trustees/Fiduciaries of Trusts
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, settlors, charitable organizations, and fiduciaries involved in trust management in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses trust law and fiduciary responsibilities, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure rates.

Title: Pathways in Technology Early College High (P–TECH) School Program – High School Diplomas
Synopsis: Requiring that each memorandum of understanding establishing a school in the Pathways in Technology Early College High (P-TECH) School Program ensures that each P-TECH student receives a high school diploma immediately following completion of high school graduation requirements.
bill_summary: The bill requires P–TECH schools in Maryland to ensure that students receive a high school diploma immediately upon completing graduation requirements, regardless of whether they complete the pathway sequence. It also establishes funding and partnership requirements to support these schools.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local county school boards
stakeholders: Students enrolled in P–TECH schools, especially those from low-income backgrounds, industry partners, and college partners involved in the program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to strengthen partnerships between schools and industry, provide students with internships and mentoring, and improve employment prospects, which could contribute to reducing small business failure by creating a more skilled workforce.

Title: Maryland African American Museum Corporation - Board of Directors - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Directors of the Maryland African American Museum Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership structure of the Board of Directors of the Maryland African American Museum Corporation, including the composition and appointment process of its members.
responsible_party: Maryland African American Museum Corporation
stakeholders: African American cultural and historical communities, museum visitors, and Maryland residents interested in African American history and culture.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business support or failure reduction programs.

Title: Public Service Commission – Certificates of Public Convenience and Necessity – Local Permits
Synopsis: Establishing that a county or a municipal corporation has the authority to approve or deny any local permit required under a certificate of public convenience and necessity issued by the Public Service Commission for generating stations, transmission lines, and qualified generator lead lines; requiring a county or municipal corporation to approve or deny the local permits in a certain manner; prohibiting a county or municipal corporation from conditioning the approval of the local permits on certain approvals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that counties and municipal corporations in Maryland have the authority to approve or deny local permits required under certificates of public convenience and necessity for generating stations, transmission lines, and qualified generator lead lines, and sets standards for processing these permits within a reasonable time without conditioning approval on certain reviews or findings.
responsible_party: County and municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Local governments, energy project developers, and communities near energy infrastructure projects
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces regulatory uncertainty and delays by streamlining local permit processes, which can help small energy businesses and developers avoid project delays and failures.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Board Membership, Delegated Pharmacy Acts, and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Pharmacy to include a registered pharmacy technician; authorizing a licensed pharmacist, under certain circumstances, to delegate the entry of certain data into databases or patient charts to be performed at a remote location to a registered pharmacy technician and a registered pharmacy intern; prohibiting registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy technician trainees from making decisions requiring the professional judgment of a pharmacist; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the membership of the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to include a registered pharmacy technician, expands delegation of pharmacy acts including remote data entry, clarifies restrictions on pharmacy technicians, and extends the sunset date of the Board's authority to 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacists, pharmacy technicians, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on delegation and technician roles are likely to improve operational efficiency and reduce small business failure rates in pharmacies.

Title: Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund - Allocation of Grants (Rural Communities Improvement Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Authorizing the allocation of grants from the Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund for certain business and workforce development activities.
bill_summary: The bill revises the allocation and disbursement of funds from the Rural Maryland Prosperity Investment Fund to support business, workforce development, infrastructure, health care, and community projects in rural areas, and extends the fund's provisions.
responsible_party: The Rural Maryland Council, with assistance from the Board and the Executive Committee.
stakeholders: Rural communities, local governments, regional councils, nonprofit organizations, educational institutions, and residents of rural Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill allocates funds specifically for rural entrepreneurship, agricultural development, and cooperative support, which are expected to help reduce small business failures in rural areas.

Title: Natural Resources - Black Bass Conservation Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Black Bass Conservation Fund in the Department of Natural Resources to further black bass management; requiring the Department to administer the Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; and requiring the Department to establish a process through which an individual who purchases a certain license online to make a voluntary donation to the Black Bass Conservation Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Black Bass Conservation Fund to support black bass management and conservation efforts in Maryland. It creates a process for voluntary donations to the fund when purchasing certain licenses online, and specifies how the funds will be used and managed.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Black bass populations, anglers, conservation organizations, and the general public interested in aquatic habitat preservation in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it involves voluntary donations through license sales, which may support conservation efforts indirectly benefiting local businesses involved in outdoor recreation.

Title: Talbot County – Speed Monitoring Systems – Intersection of Maryland Route 333 (Oxford Road) and Bonfield Avenue
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of a speed monitoring system at the intersection of Maryland Route 333 (Oxford Road) and Bonfield Avenue in Talbot County, subject to placement and signage requirements; requiring the fines collected by the Town of Oxford as a result of the speed monitoring system to be used to assist in covering the cost of roadway and pedestrian safety improvements in and around the intersection; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of a speed monitoring system at the intersection of Maryland Route 333 and Bonfield Avenue in Talbot County, with fines collected used for roadway and pedestrian safety improvements. It also sets signage and display requirements for the system.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Highway Administration and local jurisdiction authorities in Talbot County.
stakeholders: Motorists, pedestrians, and residents in Talbot County, especially around the intersection of Maryland Route 333 and Bonfield Avenue.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill allocates fines from speed violations to safety improvements, which can enhance local infrastructure and safety, potentially reducing small business failures related to transportation issues.

Title: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission and Offices of the Comptroller, Treasurer, and Attorney General - Compensation and Pay Scales of Employees
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission, in consultation with the Secretary of Health, to set the compensation of certain Commission employees; requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management, in consultation with the Secretary of Health, to determine the positions for which the Commission may set compensation; and authorizing the Comptroller, the Treasurer, and the Attorney General, in consultation with the Secretary of Budget and Management, to set the pay scale of certain positions in their offices.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission and various state offices to set the compensation and pay scales for certain employees, especially those with unique skills or positions that are specific to their agency or commission.
responsible_party: The Maryland Community Health Resources Commission, the Secretary of Budget and Management, and the respective offices of the Comptroller, Treasurer, and Attorney General.
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission, the offices of the Comptroller, Treasurer, and Attorney General, and the state agencies involved.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may improve employee compensation management within state agencies.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Nursing Homes - Acquisitions and Licensure
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to provide certain information regarding the acquisition of a nursing home to the Office of Health Care Quality; requiring the Secretary of Health to consider the information before taking action regarding licensure to operate a nursing home; and requiring the Commission, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to study and make recommendations regarding the expansion of the certificate of need program over acquisitions of nursing homes and report by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill enhances oversight of nursing home acquisitions and licensure in Maryland by requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to provide detailed findings and recommendations to the Office of Health Care Quality, and mandates the Secretary of Health to consider this information before granting licensure. It also directs a study on expanding the certificate of need program for nursing home acquisitions, including issues like eliminating multi-bed patient rooms.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Nursing home residents, nursing home owners, healthcare regulators, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve oversight and transparency in nursing home acquisitions, which could lead to better management and stability of nursing homes, potentially reducing failures.

Title: Declaration of Rights - Right to Reproductive Freedom
Synopsis: Establishing that every person, as a central component of an individual's rights to liberty and equality, has the fundamental right to reproductive freedom; and prohibiting the State from, directly or indirectly, denying, burdening, or abridging the right unless justified by a compelling State interest achieved by the least restrictive means.
bill_summary: The bill proposes amending the Maryland Constitution to establish that every person has a fundamental right to reproductive freedom, including making decisions about pregnancy, and prohibits the state from infringing on this right unless justified by a compelling state interest achieved through the least restrictive means.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Maryland General Assembly and the Office of the Governor
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland, particularly those seeking reproductive health services and making reproductive choices
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on constitutional rights and does not directly address small business support or failure reduction programs.

Title: Community Development - Sustainable Communities - Business Facade Improvement Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Business Facade Improvement Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to assist qualified businesses located in sustainable communities with improving the outside appearance of the qualified businesses' buildings or facilities; requiring the Department to develop an application process for political subdivisions seeking to participate in the Program; and requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Business Facade Improvement Program within the Department of Housing and Community Development to help qualified businesses in sustainable communities improve their building exteriors. It provides funding to counties with sustainable communities, which then distribute grants to eligible businesses for facade improvements.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Businesses located in sustainable communities seeking to improve their building exteriors
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support small businesses by providing financial assistance for facade improvements, which can enhance business appeal and customer attraction, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Office of the Comptroller - Taxpayer Advocate Division
Synopsis: Establishing the Taxpayer Advocate Division in the Office of the Comptroller to assist taxpayers and their representatives in resolving certain taxpayer problems and complaints and represent taxpayers' interests in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Taxpayer Advocate Division within the Maryland Office of the Comptroller to assist taxpayers with resolving problems and complaints related to tax programs and debt collection, and to improve the administration of tax laws.
responsible_party: Office of the Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Taxpayers and their representatives in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve taxpayer services and resolve issues efficiently, which could help small businesses avoid tax-related failures by providing better support and problem resolution.

Title: Modernization of State Financial Systems - 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of the Comptroller, the Office of the State Treasurer, the Department of Budget and Management, the Department of Information Technology, and the Department of General Services, in consultation with a representative of the Modernize Maryland Oversight Commission, to develop, implement, manage, and oversee the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise; and requiring the Office of the Comptroller to periodically report to the General Assembly on the status of the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 21st Century Financial Systems Enterprise to modernize and consolidate Maryland's state financial management systems into a single, cloud-based infrastructure, led by a new council and a director within the Office of the Comptroller.
responsible_party: The Office of the Comptroller, in collaboration with the Office of the State Treasurer, the Department of Budget and Management, the Department of Information Technology, and the Department of General Services.
stakeholders: State government agencies and departments involved in financial management and information technology, as well as the Maryland state government as a whole.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By modernizing and standardizing financial systems, the bill aims to improve efficiency, reduce risks, and enhance the delivery of financial services across the state, which can indirectly support small business stability.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Residential Districts
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law authorizing the use of speed monitoring systems in certain residential districts apply in Anne Arundel County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of speed monitoring systems in residential districts within Anne Arundel County, Maryland, specifically on certain highways and in specific zones, to enforce speed limits and improve traffic safety.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County governing body or local law enforcement agency
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and local government in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns traffic enforcement measures.

Title: Managed Care Organizations - Retroactive Denial of Reimbursement - Information in Written Statement
Synopsis: Altering the information that must be included in a written statement provided by a managed care organization to a health care provider when retroactively denying reimbursement as a result of coordination of benefits.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the requirements for managed care organizations when retroactively denying reimbursement to healthcare providers, specifically regarding the information they must include in written statements about responsibility for payment, especially in cases involving coordination of benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Healthcare providers and managed care organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying the responsibilities and reducing administrative ambiguities for managed care organizations, the bill may help healthcare providers avoid unnecessary claim denials, potentially reducing small business failure related to billing issues.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Peer Advisory Committees, Scopes of Practice, and Licensure Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Nursing to appoint peer advisory committees to provide advice related to midwifery; authorizing registered nurses certified as nurse-midwives and licensed certified midwives to personally prepare and dispense a starter dosage of certain drugs under certain circumstances; altering the exceptions to the certified midwifery licensure requirement and the qualifications required for a license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Nursing to establish peer advisory committees for midwifery, expands the scope of practice for nurse-midwives and certified midwives, and allows them to prepare and dispense starter dosages of certain drugs. It also modifies licensure requirements for midwives and nurses, and directs the Maryland Department of Health to develop recommendations to expand access to birthing services in birthing centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health and the State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Licensed nurses, nurse-midwives, certified midwives, and pregnant women seeking birthing services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions to expand access to birthing centers and allow midwives to dispense medications could improve the viability of small healthcare providers and midwifery practices, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources – Forest Preservation and Retention
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "qualified conservation" for purposes of provisions of law related to forest mitigation banks; altering certain  methods of calculating forest afforestation, reforestation, and preservation requirements; authorizing local jurisdictions to adopt certain alternative afforestation, reforestation, and preservation requirements; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a workgroup to evaluate and recommend incentives for private landowners to conserve forest; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's forest conservation laws by altering definitions, expanding exemptions, and establishing new requirements for afforestation, reforestation, and preservation. It encourages private landowner incentives, updates technical manuals, and sets procedures for local and state programs to maintain or increase forest cover, including the use of mitigation banks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Private landowners, local governments, developers, environmental organizations, and residents of Maryland, especially those in urban and suburban areas affected by land development and forest conservation policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for streamlined processes, exemptions, and incentives aim to reduce regulatory burdens and promote sustainable land use, which could help small businesses involved in land development and forestry to avoid failure due to compliance costs or regulatory hurdles.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Autism Waiver - Military Families
Synopsis: Requiring, unless the child's family requests that the child be removed, that a child on the registry for the Autism Waiver remain on the registry if the child's family relocates out of the State for military service; and providing that if a child on the registry for the Waiver becomes eligible for services while the child's family is out of the State for military service, the child shall be eligible for services through the Waiver if the family relocates to the State.
bill_summary: The bill requires that children on the Maryland Autism Waiver registry remain on the registry if their family relocates out of state due to military service, unless the family requests removal. It also states that children who become eligible for services while their family is out of state will be eligible for services if they relocate back to Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Military families with children on the Autism Waiver registry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: University System of Maryland - Facilities - Bonding Authority and Sale
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; approving the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; providing that the bonds are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions; and authorizing the Board of Regents to approve the use of money received from the sale of certain property for operating expenses at certain campuses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30 million for the development, improvement, and renewal of academic facilities, including a specific project at the University of Maryland, College Park. It also allows the university to use proceeds from the sale of property for operating expenses at nonresidential campuses, with approval.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland and the Board of Regents
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and staff of the University System of Maryland, especially at nonresidential campuses and the University of Maryland, College Park.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Criminal Law - False Statements - Emergency or Commission of Crime (Antiswatting Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from making or causing to be made a false statement, report, or complaint to a governmental emergency report recipient with reckless disregard of causing bodily harm to an individual as a direct result of a response to the statement, report, or complaint; and providing that a person who violates the Act, in addition to any penalties imposed, is civilly liable to an individual harmed by the violation.
bill_summary: The bill establishes penalties for making false statements or reports to emergency or crime-reporting agencies, especially when such false reports cause bodily harm or serious response consequences. It also makes first-time false report violations by minors civil offenses and provides for reimbursement of damages caused by such false reports.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Public safety officials, law enforcement agencies, and the general public who rely on emergency reports
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but it aims to improve emergency response accuracy, which can indirectly benefit small businesses by maintaining public safety and order.

Title: Juvenile Court - Concurrent Jurisdiction - Juvenile Offenses on Military Installations
Synopsis: Establishing that the jurisdiction of the juvenile court is concurrent with that of a federal court sitting in the State over certain proceedings involving violations of federal law by a child on a military installation if the federal court waives exclusive jurisdiction and the violation of federal law is also a crime under State law.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that juvenile court has concurrent jurisdiction with federal courts over certain juvenile offenses involving violations of federal law committed on U.S. military installations in Maryland, provided the federal court waives exclusive jurisdiction and the offense is also a crime under state law.
responsible_party: Maryland judicial system, specifically juvenile courts and federal courts sitting in Maryland
stakeholders: Juvenile offenders, military personnel, and federal and state judicial authorities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on juvenile justice and jurisdictional issues involving federal law and military installations.

Title: Public Safety – Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund to provide grants to local law enforcement agencies for Mental Health First Aid for Public Safety training and Critical Incident Stress Management peer support training; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill for the Fund in fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; and requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to report annually to the Governor and General Assembly on the uses of the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Officer and Community Wellness Training Grant Fund to provide grants to local law enforcement agencies for mental health first aid and critical incident stress management peer support training. It mandates annual funding, administration by the Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Local law enforcement agencies and their personnel, including police departments, sheriff’s offices, and security forces
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on law enforcement training and community wellness programs.

Title: Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits - Preservation and Storage
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the storage and preservation of sexual assault evidence collection kits; requiring sexual assault evidence collection kits collected before January 1, 2000, to be retained and transferred in a certain manner; and requiring the Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee, by December 1, 2023, to issue a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on certain recommendations, in consultation with the Consumer Protection Division of the Office of the Attorney General.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for the storage, preservation, and analysis of sexual assault evidence collection kits in Maryland. It mandates timely transfer and retention of kits, sets a 75-year limit on destruction unless certain conditions are met, and establishes procedures for analysis and reporting. It also includes provisions for kits collected before 2023 and recommends guidelines for older kits.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of the Attorney General and the Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee.
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, healthcare providers, hospitals, and community sexual assault support organizations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on evidence collection and storage procedures related to sexual assault cases, with minimal direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services - Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kit Reporting Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to establish and administer a certain reporting program relating to sexual assault evidence collection kits; requiring a law enforcement agency and a person with control or possession of a sexual assault evidence collection kit to report certain information to the program and comply with certain regulations; and clarifying the uses for the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a reporting program for tracking the location, status, and chain of custody of sexual assault evidence collection kits in Maryland. It requires law enforcement agencies and other entities with control of such kits to report information to the program, and clarifies the use of the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund to support testing of these kits.
responsible_party: The Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories, and organizations involved in sexual assault response and prevention
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding for testing sexual assault kits through the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund, which may indirectly support small forensic laboratories and related service providers, but its primary focus is on victim support and law enforcement.

Title: Montgomery County - Collective Bargaining for Sheriff's Office Employees - Binding Arbitration Procedures MC 13-23
Synopsis: Requiring that the procedures for declaring an impasse and submitting a dispute to binding arbitration be conducted in accordance with certain provisions of the Montgomery County Code if the Sheriff of Montgomery County and a bargaining representative are unable to reach agreement during negotiations on matters applicable to employees of the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office.
bill_summary: The bill requires that collective bargaining procedures for Montgomery County Sheriff's Office employees follow specific local procedures if negotiations reach an impasse, and it establishes rules for bargaining, dispute resolution, and the scope of managerial rights.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Government, specifically the Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office and the Montgomery County Labor Relations Administrator.
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office and the Montgomery County government.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but it streamlines collective bargaining processes for law enforcement employees, which could indirectly impact operational stability.

Title: Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission - Collective Bargaining Agreement Implementation - Impasse Arbitration MC 10-23
Synopsis: Altering the terms and conditions of a certain final offer that the Executive Director of the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County is required to submit to the Montgomery Commission; authorizing the parties to a collective bargaining agreement for employees of the Montgomery Commission to request the services of a mediator-arbitrator during a term of a collective bargaining agreement under certain circumstances; and establishing the process for mediation-arbitration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procedures for collective bargaining and impasse resolution for employees of the Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission, including establishing mediation–arbitration processes, criteria for selecting final offers, and cost-sharing arrangements.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission and its designated mediator–arbitrator panel
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County Housing Opportunities Commission and the Montgomery County community served by the Commission
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on public employee collective bargaining and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; establishing an Executive Director for the Board; and altering the manner in which decisions are made regarding certain proposals for funding.
bill_summary: The bill establishes and modifies the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Boards, including creating a Vetting Board and a Voting Board, and sets up the Senator George C. Edwards Fund to support economic development projects in Allegany, Garrett, and Washington counties.
responsible_party: The Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Boards, including the Vetting Board, Voting Board, and the Executive Director, as well as the Department of Commerce for certain appointments.
stakeholders: Residents, small businesses, and local governments in Allegany, Garrett, and Washington counties in Western Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding and support for economic development projects, which can help small businesses succeed and reduce failure rates in the region.

Title: Blueprint for Maryland's Future - Various Policies and Prekindergarten Enrollment and Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Delaying the school year by which a public school is required to collect a certain alternative income eligibility form until after the State Department of Education has adopted the form; altering the duties of an assistant principal on the career ladder; delaying the date on which county boards of education must select certain experts to write curriculum; altering the definition of a "Tier I child" who may be enrolled in a full-day prekindergarten program beginning in a certain school year to include children who are homeless; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and enhances the Maryland prekindergarten program by including more children, increasing funding, and setting quality standards for providers. It also delays certain implementation deadlines and modifies the duties of education staff, including assistant principals and curriculum writers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and local county school boards.
stakeholders: Children eligible for prekindergarten, families of young children, prekindergarten providers, and educators in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages private prekindergarten providers to expand and meet quality standards, which could help stabilize and grow small education-related businesses.

Title: Assisted Living Programs - Unlicensed Programs - Resident Abuse, Exploitation, and Neglect (The Senator Delores Kelley Residents of Unlicensed Programs Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health or the Office of Health Care Quality to investigate whether residents in an assisted living program have been subject to neglect, exploitation, or abuse, if the assisted living program is operating without a license; subjecting certain assisted living programs operating without a license to immediate prosecution under a certain provision of law under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances enforcement against unlicensed assisted living programs by requiring investigations into resident abuse, exploitation, or neglect, and establishing penalties including fines, imprisonment, and injunctive relief for operating without a license.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Residents of assisted living programs, especially those in unlicensed facilities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets illegal unlicensed operations and does not directly impact licensed small businesses, but it may reduce failures caused by legal penalties or shutdowns.

Title: Public Safety - Emergency Management - Consumer Protections Against Price Gouging
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from selling an essential good or service for more than a certain increase in price during and for a certain time after a certain state of emergency; and requiring the Secretary of State to establish an electronic notification system by which a person may register to receive information on whether a state of emergency has been declared and an executive order issued, that the provisions of the Act are in effect, and which categories of essential goods and services are covered by the executive order.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits selling essential goods and services at prices more than 15% above the highest pre-emergency price during and for 90 days after a state of emergency, with certain exceptions for increased costs. It also requires the Secretary of State to establish an electronic notification system for emergency declarations and related information.
responsible_party: Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Consumers and small businesses in Maryland, especially during and after states of emergency
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to prevent price gouging, which can cause financial strain on small businesses and consumers, potentially reducing business failures during emergencies.

Title: Cigarettes - Wholesalers - Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Requiring each licensed cigarette wholesaler to submit complete and accurate information in the form and manner the Comptroller requires to facilitate compliance with certain provisions of law relating to cigarettes.
bill_summary: The bill requires licensed cigarette wholesalers in Maryland to submit complete and accurate quarterly reports of cigarettes sold, including brand and tax information, to the Comptroller. It also authorizes the disclosure of this information to the Attorney General for enforcement purposes and establishes penalties for violations, including license revocation and civil fines.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and the Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Cigarette wholesalers and the tobacco industry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on regulatory compliance and enforcement, with penalties for violations. It does not directly aim to reduce small business failure but may impact small wholesalers through increased compliance requirements.

Title: Montgomery County - Bicounty Agencies - Commissioner Discipline, Disclosures, Training, and Ethics MC/PG 105-23
Synopsis: Authorizing a bicounty commissioner and an applicant for the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission to submit certain financial statements to the Montgomery County Council electronically; authorizing the Council to discipline a Montgomery County commissioner under certain circumstances; prohibiting a Montgomery County commissioner from engaging in certain political activities while serving on the Commission; prohibiting the chair of the Montgomery County Planning Board from engaging in certain employment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to the appointment, discipline, transparency, and meeting procedures of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission, especially focusing on Montgomery County. It includes requirements for public hearings, financial disclosures, training, and restrictions on employment and political activities for commissioners from Montgomery County.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Council and Montgomery County Executive, Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission, Maryland Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Commissioners from Montgomery County, residents of Montgomery County, and other stakeholders involved in the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses governance and transparency of the planning commission, with no direct measures targeting small business failure rates.

Title: Tax Sales – Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to file a motion with a court to request that a certain certificate of sale be assigned to the governing body of the county or municipal corporation in a certain foreclosure action under certain circumstances; providing that, on a grant of the motion by the court, the holder of the certificate of sale forfeits certain rights and the amount paid to acquire the certificate of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's tax sale laws by allowing counties and municipal governments to request court assignment of certificates of sale, strike final judgments, and take ownership of properties under certain conditions, especially for properties that are vacant, blighted, or intended for demolition or redevelopment.
responsible_party: The governing body of each county or municipal corporation, with courts and tax collectors implementing the procedures.
stakeholders: County and municipal governments, property owners, and communities affected by vacant, blighted, or redevelopment properties.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets properties that are vacant or blighted, which may indirectly support small businesses involved in redevelopment or property management, but it does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Equitech Growth Fund and Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Equitech Growth Fund in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to support the economic competitiveness and inclusive growth of emerging and advanced industries in the State through the creation of supporting infrastructure assets, resources, and a diverse workforce that builds the strengths of the State's economy; establishing the Equitech Growth Commission to create a strategic plan; requiring the Governor in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2033 to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget bill; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Equitech Growth Fund to support emerging and advanced industries in Maryland through grants, investments, and loans, and creates the Equitech Growth Commission to develop a strategic plan for growing the state's innovation economy over 10 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Emerging and advanced industries, minority communities, workforce, higher education institutions, and private sector businesses in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to provide financial assistance and strategic support to businesses, which could help reduce small business failure rates, especially in high-growth sectors.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission – Minority Business Enterprise Utilization Program – Revisions and Extension MC/PG 101–23
Synopsis: Revising the minority business enterprise utilization program within the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including altering the definition of "minority business enterprise", altering the duties of the Office of Supplier Diversity and Inclusion, and merging the program for design/build and construction contracts with the program for the procurement of goods and services; extending until July 1, 2028, provisions relating to procurement from minority business enterprises by the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises and extends the Maryland Public Utilities' programs aimed at increasing minority and women-owned business participation in procurement contracts, including establishing certification standards, reporting requirements, and program administration.
responsible_party: The Office of Supplier Diversity and Inclusion within the Maryland Public Utilities Commission.
stakeholders: Minority and women-owned businesses, small business enterprises, and the communities they serve.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support minority and women-owned businesses through certification, technical assistance, and targeted procurement programs, which could help reduce their failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B and Class C Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses, Inspections, Penalties, and Workgroup PG 302-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license, a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) beer, wine, and liquor license, or a Class C (veterans' organization or club) beer, wine and liquor license in Prince George's County to serve beer, wine, and liquor by the glass or by the bottle for on-premises consumption; establishing the Workgroup to Study Best Practices for Safe Event Promotion and the Leveraging of Alcoholic Beverages Licenses in Prince George's County; requiring a certain report by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain types of alcohol licenses in Prince George's County to serve alcohol for on-premises consumption, establishes regulations for entertainment permits, inspections, and penalties, and creates a workgroup to study best practices for safe event promotion and leveraging alcohol licenses for revenue.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners and Prince George's County Police Department
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, event promoters, residents, and businesses in Prince George's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the regulation and safety of alcohol-related events, which could help small businesses involved in event promotion and alcohol service by providing clearer guidelines and support for safe operations.

Title: Health Insurance - Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocol and Prior Authorization - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to establish a certain process for requesting an exception to a step therapy or fail-first protocol; prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring more than a certain number of prior authorizations for a prescription for different dosages of the same prescription drug; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations on step therapy protocols and prior authorization processes for prescription drugs under health insurance plans in Maryland. It prohibits certain restrictions on drugs used for mental health conditions and establishes clear procedures for requesting exceptions, including timely decision-making and limits on the number of prior authorizations required.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance and private review agents
stakeholders: Insured individuals, healthcare providers, and prescription drug patients in Maryland, especially those with mental health conditions or on complex medication regimens.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions streamline the prior authorization process and reduce administrative burdens, which can help small healthcare providers and insurers manage costs and compliance more effectively, potentially reducing small business failure.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Membership - Emergency Medical Technicians
Synopsis: Authorizing membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain emergency medical technicians under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes emergency medical technicians employed by participating governmental units to become members of the Maryland Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Board of Trustees of the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System.
stakeholders: Emergency medical technicians employed by participating governmental units in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it pertains to pension system membership for emergency medical technicians.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – Frostburg City Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the Frostburg City Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that an individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Frostburg City Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Frostburg City Police Department officers become members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System when the department joins the system, and it details the transfer of pension assets and service credits from other pension systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: Frostburg City Police Department officers and local law enforcement personnel in Frostburg
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Baltimore Regional Transit Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to review and comment on annual budget requests of the Maryland Transit Administration, updates to the Central Maryland Transportation Plan, and certain annual reports and to perform other oversight and advocacy duties related to Baltimore region transit services; and requiring the Commission, by December 1 each year, to report its findings and recommendations on the Baltimore region transit systems to the Administration, the Governor, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to oversee, review, and comment on transit planning, budgeting, and performance in the Baltimore region, including coordination with local transit plans and public input.
responsible_party: The Baltimore Regional Transit Commission, supported by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council and the Maryland Transit Administration.
stakeholders: Residents, commuters, transit riders, local businesses, and government agencies in the Baltimore region.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve transit planning and oversight, which can support local businesses and economic stability, potentially reducing small business failures.

Title: Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission - Collective Bargaining Agreement Implementation - Dispute Arbitration MC/PG 103-23
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that economic provisions of a certain final collective bargaining agreement for employees of the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission be subject to funding by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to instead require that certain terms and conditions of the final agreement be subject to approval by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the collective bargaining process for employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission, including establishing procedures for mediation and arbitration, and clarifies that economic terms requiring funding are subject to approval by county councils.
responsible_party: Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the Montgomery and Prince George’s County Councils
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the county governments of Montgomery and Prince George’s counties
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline and clarify the collective bargaining process, potentially reducing delays and uncertainties that could lead to business failure, especially for public entities and associated small businesses.

Title: Execution on a Judgment - Child Support Arrearages - Workers' Compensation
Synopsis: Specifying that 25% of the net recovery by the debtor on a claim for workers' compensation is subject to execution on a judgment for a child support arrearage.
bill_summary: The bill specifies that 25% of the net recovery from workers' compensation insurance benefits can be used to satisfy child support arrearages through execution on a judgment.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings Department
stakeholders: Parents with child support arrearages and individuals receiving workers' compensation benefits in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education – Sports Wagering Contracts – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a certain regulated gaming entity or a certain agent of a regulated gaming entity if the institution of higher education receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a sports marketing entity if the entity or the institution receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland institutions of higher education from entering into contracts with regulated gaming entities or sports marketing entities if they receive incentives based on student participation in sports wagering, and makes such contracts subject to public inspection.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students attending Maryland higher education institutions and the institutions themselves
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on contracts related to sports wagering are unlikely to have a direct impact on the failure rate of small businesses, as it mainly restricts certain contractual arrangements involving higher education institutions.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees
Synopsis: Altering the method by which administrative fees for participants in the State Retirement and Pension System are calculated by and remitted to the State Retirement and Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to provide certain notice to local participating employers.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how administrative fees for participants in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System are calculated and reimbursed, including requiring the Board of Trustees to notify local employers of their fee estimates and establishing procedures for payments and reimbursements.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System and the Maryland State Retirement Agency.
stakeholders: Participants in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including state and local government employees and employers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on pension system administrative fees and reimbursements does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Amortization of Unfunded Liabilities and Surpluses
Synopsis: Altering the amortization periods to be used for certain unfunded liabilities or surpluses of the State Retirement and Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding and amortization periods for unfunded liabilities and surpluses of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, extending the periods for certain liabilities and allowing adjustments to mitigate volatility.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: State employees and retirees participating in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Autonomous Vehicle Converters – Sale of Autonomous Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing an autonomous vehicle converter to sell, transfer, lease, offer for sale, or resell a converted autonomous vehicle or a motor vehicle purchased with the intent to convert the motor vehicle into a converted autonomous vehicle; establishing that certain portions of the Act apply only to motor vehicles intended for commercial or industrial use; and prohibiting an autonomous vehicle converter from holding certain occupational vehicle licenses issued under the Maryland Vehicle Law.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes autonomous vehicle converters to sell, transfer, lease, or resell converted autonomous vehicles, specifically for vehicles intended for commercial or industrial use, and clarifies that they cannot be licensed as manufacturers, distributors, or dealers.
responsible_party: Autonomous vehicle converters are responsible for implementing the programs, as they are the entities authorized to sell and resell converted autonomous vehicles.
stakeholders: Autonomous vehicle converters and businesses involved in converting and using autonomous vehicles for commercial or industrial purposes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by enabling autonomous vehicle converters to operate legally and sell converted vehicles, opening new business opportunities.

Title: Reproductive Health Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a judge from requiring a person to give certain testimony or a statement or to produce evidence for a case involving an alleged violation of the criminal law of another state relating to health care that is legally protected in the State; prohibiting a judge from issuing an ex parte order to intercept certain communication for the purpose of investigating or recovering evidence related to legally protected health care, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The Reproductive Health Protection Act prohibits certain interstate legal actions and investigations related to legally protected health care, such as abortion and reproductive services, unless they would be crimes in Maryland. It also restricts state agencies and private parties from assisting in investigations that would not be liable or sanctioned in Maryland, and it protects health care practitioners from disciplinary actions or adverse insurance actions related to providing legally protected health care.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health and relevant health occupations boards
stakeholders: Individuals seeking or providing legally protected reproductive health care services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions mainly restrict interstate legal actions and investigations related to legally protected health care, which could reduce legal and financial risks for health care providers and associated small businesses.

Title: State Procurement – Minority Business Enterprise Program – Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering to July 1, 2025, the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to offshore wind projects and video lottery terminals; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination dates of various laws and programs related to the Maryland Minority Business Enterprise Program, including reports, studies, and guidelines, to 2025. It also mandates new analyses and reports on the program's compliance with federal and constitutional requirements, especially concerning offshore wind projects and other capital projects.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs, in consultation with the certification agency, the Office of the Attorney General, and the Maryland Public Service Commission.
stakeholders: Minority-owned businesses, small businesses participating in state procurement, and entities involved in offshore wind and other capital projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the Minority Business Enterprise Program through extended oversight, analysis, and policy development, which could help minority and small businesses succeed and reduce their failure rates.

Title: Hospitals - Testing for Fentanyl (The Josh Siems Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital to include testing for fentanyl as part of a urine drug screening; and requiring the hospital, if a urine drug screening detects fentanyl, to report the deidentified test results  to the Maryland Department of Health through the State-designated health information exchange.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals in Maryland to include fentanyl testing in urine drug screens for patients with known or suspected drug overdoses when requested by a healthcare provider, and to report positive fentanyl results to the Department.
responsible_party: Hospitals and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients with suspected or known drug overdoses, healthcare providers, hospitals, and public health officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Health - Reproductive Health Services - Protected Information and Insurance Requirements
Synopsis: Regulating the disclosure of certain information related to legally protected health care by custodians of public records, health information exchanges, and electronic health networks; requiring that the regulations adopted by the Maryland Health Care Commission regarding clinical information to be exchanged through the State-designated exchange restrict data of patients who have obtained legally protected health care; establishing the Protected Health Care Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the disclosure of legally protected reproductive health care information, establishes standards for health information exchanges, and clarifies insurance coverage requirements for abortion and reproductive health services in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients receiving reproductive health care, health care providers, health information exchanges, insurance companies, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on data sharing and confidentiality are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, but may influence healthcare providers and insurers.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, in consultation with the Maryland Insurance Administration, to conduct a study on available federal and State subsidies and report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill extends the duration of Maryland's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program, establishes a study on federal and state subsidies, and mandates the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to report findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18 to 40 in Maryland who are seeking health insurance coverage
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets young adults and does not directly impact small business failure rates, but may indirectly influence health coverage stability.

Title: Cancer Screening - Health Insurance and Assessment of Outreach, Education, and Health Disparities
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for certain lung cancer diagnostic imaging and limiting the copayment, coinsurance, or deductible that the entities can require for lung cancer screening and diagnosis; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an assessment on certain outreach, education, and health disparities in cancer screening and report the results to the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Breast and Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Program in the Maryland Department of Health, mandates insurance coverage for breast and lung cancer screening and diagnostic imaging with limited copayments, and requires the Department to assess outreach, education, and disparities in cancer screening.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and insurance regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland, especially those at risk for breast and lung cancer, and underserved communities impacted by health disparities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for insurance coverage and assessment programs are aimed at improving early detection and reducing health disparities, which can contribute to better health outcomes and potentially reduce small business failures related to health costs and workforce health.

Title: Procurement - Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprises - Participation Goal Scorecard
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop a scorecard to evaluate units of State government on the units' performance toward meeting certain participation goals under the Minority Business Enterprise Program and the Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprise Program; establishing a certain grading scale for the scorecard; and requiring grades achieved by each unit to be published each year on the Office's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop a scorecard to evaluate state agencies' performance in meeting participation goals for Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran–Owned Small Business Enterprises. The scorecard will include a grading scale and be published annually on the Office's website and in reports to the General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: State government units, minority business enterprises, veteran–owned small businesses, and the general public interested in procurement participation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve participation of minority and veteran-owned small businesses in state procurement, which can enhance their success and reduce failure rates.

Title: State Government - Regulation Procedures and the Maryland Register
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of State Documents to make at least the 15 most recent issues of the Maryland Register available to the public for online searching; altering the requirements for a unit of State government to submit certain proposed or emergency regulations, work plans, and evaluation reports to the Joint Committee on Administrative, Executive, and Legislative Review, the Department of Legislative Services, and the Administrator of the Division of State Documents; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations procedures for Maryland state agencies, including making the Maryland Register more accessible online, streamlining submission and review processes for regulations, and establishing an electronic filing system for regulatory documents.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and the Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Maryland state government agencies, the Joint Committee on Administrative, Executive, and Legislative Review, and the public interested in state regulations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but improves transparency and efficiency in regulatory processes, which could indirectly benefit small businesses.

Title: Public Safety - Regulated Firearms - Possession and Permits to Carry, Wear, and Transport a Handgun
Synopsis: Altering the penalty for a violation of the prohibition on wearing, carrying, or transporting a handgun; requiring the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy to annually report certain information to the Governor and General Assembly; requiring the Department of State Police to transmit a certain summary of certain laws relating to firearms to certain persons; requiring the Secretary of State Police, in consultation with the Attorney General and the Maryland Department of Health, to develop a certain curriculum; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's firearm laws by altering penalties for carrying handguns, establishing reporting requirements, updating disqualifiers for firearm possession, and creating new programs for firearm safety and youth suicide prevention.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Firearm owners, minors, law enforcement, youth and families at risk of firearm-related harm, and the general public
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it includes provisions for firearm safety programs and training that could involve local businesses such as firearm dealers and training centers.

Title: Town of Forest Heights (Prince George's County) - Urban Renewal Authority for Blight Clearance PG 410-23
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers in areas zoned for commercial use for blight clearance and redevelopment under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers for blight clearance and redevelopment in areas zoned for commercial or residential use. It authorizes the municipality to levy taxes, issue bonds, and undertake activities to eliminate blight, acquire and dispose of property, and promote redevelopment.
responsible_party: The Town of Forest Heights, Maryland, specifically its urban renewal agency or designated municipal government authority.
stakeholders: Residents, business owners, and property owners in the blighted areas of Forest Heights, Prince George's County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for urban renewal and redevelopment could help stabilize and revitalize commercial areas, potentially reducing small business failures in those zones.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority in Prince George's County to support and develop a certain neighborhood revitalization plan in coordination with certain residents; and requiring the Authority to report its comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on or before October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority in Prince George's County to support neighborhood revitalization in specific target areas, including Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood. The authority will develop a comprehensive neighborhood revitalization plan focusing on residents, housing, neighborhoods, economic development, and transportation.
responsible_party: The Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority, which includes local government officials, state agency representatives, and community residents.
stakeholders: Residents, local businesses, and communities within the target areas of Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on neighborhood revitalization and economic development may help improve local economic conditions, potentially reducing small business failures in the targeted areas.

Title: Residential Construction - Electric Vehicle Charging
Synopsis: Establishing and altering certain requirements related to the installation of equipment for the charging of electric vehicles during the construction of certain housing units; clarifying that a county or municipal corporation may require a greater number of electric vehicle parking spaces; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration to study certain issues related to the installation of electric vehicle parking spaces at multifamily residential buildings and submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2023; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires new residential construction and significant renovations to include electric vehicle charging infrastructure, such as EV-ready or EVSE-installed parking spaces, especially in buildings with garages or communal parking. It also authorizes local governments to require more EV parking spaces and mandates a study on the costs and implementation of EV charging in multifamily buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents of new and renovated residential buildings, especially those with parking facilities, and electric vehicle owners in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure requirements and a study on costs may help small businesses involved in construction and electrical work by providing clearer guidelines and potential support for EV infrastructure development.

Title: Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure - Requirements (Electric Vehicle Charging Reliability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to expand the EV Pilot Program to allow participating electric companies to install EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities; requiring the Commission to terminate the expansion of the EV Pilot Program on December 31, 2025; requiring an electric company operating an EV charging network to ensure the EV charging stations in the EV charging network maintain certain uptime standards, subject to certain exceptions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to expand the Electric Vehicle (EV) Pilot Program to include installation of EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities, with a termination date of December 31, 2025. It mandates electric companies operating EV charging networks to maintain a minimum uptime of 97%, report detailed data quarterly, and ensure adequate staffing for maintenance and repairs. The bill aims to improve EV infrastructure reliability and expand access in underserved areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric vehicle owners, residents of underserved communities, electric utility companies, and the general public interested in EV infrastructure development.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on infrastructure reliability and expansion, which can support small businesses involved in EV charging station installation and maintenance, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study approaches to water and wastewater governance in the Baltimore region; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the County Executive of Baltimore County, the Governor, and the General Assembly on or before January 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study and recommend improved governance models for water and wastewater services in the Baltimore region, including analysis of existing models, fiscal implications, and potential legislation.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and Baltimore County governments, with consultation from the Maryland Department of the Environment and the Maryland Environmental Service.
stakeholders: Residents and ratepayers in Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and surrounding counties served by the regional water and wastewater systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the management and efficiency of water and wastewater services, which can contribute to stable utility costs and reliable infrastructure, potentially reducing small business failures related to utility issues.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Common Ownership Community Website
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to establish and maintain a website that provides certain information on the rights and responsibilities of individuals living in a common ownership community.
