bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development to create and maintain a website that provides information about the rights and responsibilities of residents in common ownership communities, including links to local programs and recent legislation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of common ownership communities such as condominiums, cooperatives, and homeowners associations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on community housing information and legislation transparency.

Title: Drinking Water - Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department of the Environment for the purpose of authorizing the regulated use of reclaimed water as a source for drinking water treatment facilities; providing for the issuance of potable reuse permits under the Pilot Program; applying certain public participation requirements to potable reuse permits; requiring the Department to submit a report on the status of the Pilot Program to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in Maryland, allowing the regulated use of reclaimed water as a source for certain drinking water facilities, with specific permitting, testing, and public health safeguards.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems, residents served by these systems, and environmental agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to regulate and permit the use of reclaimed water for drinking, which could help small water treatment businesses and utilities adapt to new standards, potentially reducing failures related to water safety compliance.

Title: Public Health - Chief Medical Examiner - Corrections to Autopsy Findings and Conclusions
Synopsis: Altering, from 60 days to 180 days, the time period after a medical examiner files findings and conclusions resulting from an autopsy during which a person in interest may request the medical examiner to correct findings and conclusions on the cause and manner of death recorded on a certificate of death.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period during which a person in interest can request corrections to autopsy findings and conclusions from 60 days to 180 days after the findings are filed by the medical examiner.
responsible_party: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Next of kin or interested parties of deceased individuals, medical examiners, and the Maryland Department of Health
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Division of Rehabilitation Services and Developmental Disabilities Administration - Memorandum of Understanding
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education and the Developmental Disabilities Administration in the Maryland Department of Health to enter into a memorandum of understanding, the terms of which shall include a data sharing agreement for the medical and psychological records of mutual clients in order to expedite decisions regarding eligibility for services.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Division of Rehabilitation Services and the Developmental Disabilities Administration to enter into a memorandum of understanding that includes a data sharing agreement for medical and psychological records of mutual clients to expedite eligibility decisions.
responsible_party: The Maryland Division of Rehabilitation Services and the Developmental Disabilities Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and developmental disabilities who are clients of these agencies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it facilitates better coordination of services for individuals with disabilities, which may indirectly support employment and independence.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Service Near Regional Transit Districts and Neighborhood Centers in Prince George's County - Contracts MC/PG 111-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with the District of Columbia or the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority for the construction, maintenance, and operation of a water supply, sewer, or drainage system for certain property located within a certain distance of a certain mass transit rail station and a regional transit district or neighborhood center in Prince George's County; and requiring that a contract entered into under the Act include and address certain items.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with the District of Columbia and other authorities for water, sewer, and drainage services for properties near transit stations and in Prince George's County, especially focusing on transit-oriented development projects.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Property owners and residents in Prince George's County near transit stations, and entities involved in transit-oriented development projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates infrastructure development and service agreements that could support small businesses in transit-oriented areas, potentially reducing business failures related to utility access and infrastructure delays.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit of the Office of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute cases against persons that violate State criminal environmental and natural resources laws; and requiring the Attorney General, by November 30 each year, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on all the activities of the Unit and any actions taken by the Department of the Environment or the Department of Natural Resources in response to the findings and recommendations of the Unit.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit within the Office of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute violations of environmental and natural resources laws in Maryland, and to assist other departments in civil and criminal enforcement.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General, specifically the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, natural resources departments, law enforcement, and residents of Maryland concerned with environmental protection
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on enforcement and prosecution of environmental laws, which may indirectly support sustainable business practices, but it does not explicitly aim to reduce small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore City to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore City is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City and certain counties to honor certificates of guarantee issued by approved associations or contractors to meet county bond requirements, but they are not required to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and specified Maryland counties' government agencies
stakeholders: Contractors and associations involved in public improvement projects in Baltimore City and certain counties
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by providing more flexible options for meeting bond requirements, which can ease project financing.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Related Event Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Clarifying that the defined term "related event" as it applies to a related event promoter's permit in Baltimore City includes events for which tickets are sold in advance or at the door or cover charges are imposed; reducing the number of days within which a person must apply for a permit, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City must take certain actions relating to the permit, and alterations may be made to the permit; and altering the standards for determining the permit fee.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies regulations for related event promoter's permits in Baltimore City, including definitions, application procedures, fees, and standards for events associated with the CIAA Basketball Tournament, and updates enforcement penalties.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners and related city departments such as the Baltimore City Department of Transportation and Visit Baltimore.
stakeholders: Event organizers, license holders, and the general public attending related events in Baltimore City, especially around the CIAA Basketball Tournament.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines permit application processes and clarifies fee structures, which could reduce administrative barriers and uncertainties for small event promoters, potentially lowering their risk of failure.

Title: Baltimore City - 40th District - Alcoholic Beverages
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City to the holder of a Class C beer and light wine license under certain circumstances; prohibiting certain license holders in certain areas of the 40th alcoholic beverages district from selling alcoholic beverages at certain times of day; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue new alcohol licenses, including specific types like Class C and A-7, in the 40th alcoholic beverages district under certain conditions. It also adjusts restrictions on license issuance near places of worship and schools, and sets specific hours for alcohol sales in certain areas.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, businesses in the 40th district, residents, and community organizations in Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clearer licensing options and conditions, which could help small businesses by allowing more flexibility in license issuance and operation, potentially reducing business failure due to licensing issues.

Title: St. Mary’s County – Metropolitan Commission – New Facilities
Synopsis: Requiring the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to obtain the approval from the Commissioners of St. Mary's County before submitting a loan application where the Commission seeks to incur debt upon the full faith and credit of the county; requiring the Commission to cause studies, plans, and estimates to be made for new facilities in certain portions of the county; requiring any excess revenue made by the Commission in the sale or transfer of certain debt to be exempt from taxation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to obtain approval from the county commissioners before submitting certain loan applications, and to conduct studies, plans, and public notices for new water and sewer facilities. It also establishes procedures for public hearings, protest petitions, and the exemption of excess revenue from taxation related to debt. The bill aims to regulate the development and expansion of water and sewer systems in St. Mary's County.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission and the St. Mary's County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in St. Mary's County, especially those in areas affected by new or expanded water and sewer facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for public notice, hearings, and approval processes are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily focuses on infrastructure development and regulatory procedures.

Title: Homeowners' Property Tax Credit - Qualified Homeowner - Application and Certification Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for the homeowners' tax credit to allow homeowners with certain types of income to file an application every 3 years, subject to a certain certification requirement; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the application process for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit, allowing certain homeowners with limited income sources to apply less frequently and submit certifications instead of full income documentation in some years.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners in Maryland, particularly those with income from Social Security, pensions, or annuities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts homeowners and does not directly address small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Labor and Employment - Workers' Compensation - Hernia
Synopsis: Establishing that a hernia caused as a result of repetitive trauma may be considered an occupational disease and be compensable subject to certain provisions of the workers' compensation law.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's workers' compensation law to specify that hernias caused by repetitive trauma can be considered occupational diseases and be eligible for compensation. It also clarifies reporting requirements and timeframes for hernia claims.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission and employers in Maryland
stakeholders: Employees who suffer hernias related to their work, employers, and insurance providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on workers' compensation claims for hernias, which may help streamline claims processes and reduce financial uncertainty for small businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering a certain condition under which the Board of License Commissioners of Garrett County may issue a certain alcoholic beverages license to a hotel or motel; authorizing a gift basket permit holder to purchase certain alcoholic beverages from a wholesaler; authorizing a holder of a Class C multiple day beer license, beer and wine license, or beer, wine, and liquor license to hold another license that is issued by the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol licensing rules in Garrett County, including licensing conditions for hotels and motels, permits for gift baskets containing alcohol, and licenses for clubs and events. It also adjusts sale hours for alcohol on Sundays and establishes license expiration and extension procedures.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Hotels, motels, gift basket permit holders, clubs, event organizers, and alcohol consumers in Garrett County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clearer licensing rules and extended license validity, which can help small businesses in the alcohol industry operate more smoothly and reduce the risk of license-related failures.

Title: Electricity - Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Program and Property Taxes
Synopsis: Making permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program; requiring a community solar energy generating system to serve at least 40% of its kilowatt-hour output to low-income and moderate-income subscribers under certain circumstances; authorizing a subscription coordinator to act on behalf of a subscriber organization; altering requirements related to the siting and size of certain community solar energy generating systems projects; authorizing the use of consolidated billing for certain charges; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program in Maryland, expands access for low- and moderate-income subscribers, establishes regulations for billing and subscription rates, and provides property tax exemptions for certain community solar systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Residents and businesses, including renters and low- and moderate-income households, participating in or affected by community solar projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages the development of community solar projects with clear regulations, which can reduce barriers for small developers and increase project success.

Title: State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2026, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Commission; and requiring an independent evaluation of the Commission to be conducted in consultation with the Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors to July 1, 2026, and requires an independent evaluation of the Commission to assess its adherence to diversity, equity, and inclusion standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services.
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers, appraisal management companies, home inspectors, and the general public involved in real estate transactions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but aims to evaluate and potentially improve the regulatory environment for real estate professionals, which could indirectly support small businesses in the industry.

Title: Energy Storage - Targets and Maryland Energy Storage Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to establish certain targets for the deployment of new energy storage devices in the State; requiring the Commission to establish and implement the Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet certain energy storage goals and develop a certain energy storage system in the State; and requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly by December 31, 2023, regarding the implementation of the Maryland Energy Storage Program and any needed statutory changes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to set targets for deploying energy storage devices in the state, establish the Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet these targets, and develop a system for energy storage. It aims to increase energy storage capacity to support a clean, reliable, and cost-effective energy grid.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utilities, energy storage providers, and Maryland residents benefiting from a cleaner, more reliable energy grid.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes a robust energy storage market through competitive procurement and incentives, which could support small businesses involved in energy storage technology and services, potentially reducing their failure risk.

Title: Financial Institutions - Student Financing Companies - Required Registration and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring student financing companies to register with the Commissioner of Financial Regulation before providing services in the State; requiring a student financing company to renew its registration on an annual basis; authorizing the Commissioner to adopt registration procedures for student financing companies, which may include certain fees; and requiring student financing companies to annually report certain information, to be made publicly accessible on a certain website, to the Commissioner beginning March 15, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires student financing companies operating in Maryland to register with the Maryland Department of Labor's Financial Regulation Division, report detailed information about their activities annually, and adhere to regulations to ensure consumer protection.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Students and consumers in Maryland who use or are affected by student financing products, and student financing companies operating in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on regulation and transparency of student financing companies, which may indirectly support small business stability in the financial sector, but it does not specifically target small business failure reduction.

Title: Public Service Commission – Judicial Review – Proceedings
Synopsis: Clarifying that a certain proceeding for judicial review of a final decision or order by the Public Service Commission may be instituted in a circuit court for a county in which the public service company that is a party to the proceeding provides service or in the Circuit Court for Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the locations where judicial review of the Public Service Commission's final decisions or orders can be initiated, specifying that reviews can be filed in a circuit court in the county where the public service company provides service or in Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Circuit courts in Maryland, specifically the courts in the counties where the public service companies operate or in Baltimore City.
stakeholders: Public service companies, regulatory agencies, and residents or consumers served by these companies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but clarifying judicial review procedures may streamline legal processes for utility companies, potentially benefiting small utility providers.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Violation Procedures and Fines
Synopsis: Establishing procedures for the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City, in the case of an alleged complaint against a licensed establishment or license holder, to make an offer of a monetary penalty as a compromise in lieu of a hearing before the Board under certain circumstances; and altering the maximum penalty for certain alcoholic beverages violations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedures for the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to offer monetary penalties as a compromise instead of a hearing for violations of alcoholic beverage laws, and updates penalties for violations including sales to minors and pub crawl violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol establishments and their patrons in Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for monetary penalties and streamlined violation procedures could reduce legal and compliance costs for small alcohol businesses, potentially lowering their failure risk.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 46th Alcoholic Beverages District - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to approve a license expansion to a noncontiguous property with a second separate use permit issued by the City if a certain condition is met; authorizing the establishment and conversion of various alcoholic beverages licenses in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; extending for 1 year the expiration of an alcoholic beverage licenses issued for  certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations for alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, including establishing new license types, expanding license issuance and transfer rules in the 46th district, and extending license expiration dates for certain establishments.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners and Baltimore City government authorities.
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees, restaurant owners, and residents of Baltimore City, especially in the 46th district.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides extensions and clarifications for license transfers and renewals, which can help small businesses avoid license lapses and reduce failure risk.

Title: Consumer Protection - Motor Vehicle Glass Repair or Replacement - Advanced Driver Assistance System Recalibration
Synopsis: Establishing consumer protections related to the repair or replacement of motor vehicle glass on motor vehicles equipped with an advanced driver assistance system; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice.
bill_summary: The bill establishes consumer protections for motor vehicle glass repair or replacement on vehicles equipped with advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS). It requires repair facilities to inform customers if ADAS recalibration is needed, ensure repairs meet manufacturer specifications, and prohibits charging for unperformed services.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Safety Glass Facilities (a specific type of repair shop) and enforcement agencies under Maryland law.
stakeholders: Consumers with vehicles equipped with advanced driver assistance systems, motor vehicle repair shops, and manufacturers of ADAS-equipped vehicles.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill sets clear standards and requirements for repair shops, which may help prevent legal issues and improve customer trust, potentially reducing small business failures related to legal or reputation problems.

Title: Economic Development - Program Participation - Cannabis Business Establishments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of Commerce from denying certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State certain economic development program benefits under certain circumstances; clarifying the eligibility of certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State under the Job Creation and One Maryland programs; authorizing certain cannabis business entities to reapply for benefits under certain economic development programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Department of Commerce from denying certain economic development benefits and certifications to cannabis business entities, such as growers, processors, or dispensaries, solely because they are cannabis establishments, provided they meet other program requirements. It also clarifies eligibility for cannabis-related businesses under various economic development programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Cannabis business entities, including growers, processors, and dispensaries, operating in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve access to economic development programs for cannabis businesses, potentially reducing their failure rate by removing barriers related to their legal status as cannabis establishments.

Title: Higher Education - Appointment of Secretary and Student Financial Assistance - Accommodations at Public Institutions for Religious Beliefs
Synopsis: Providing that the Secretary of Higher Education is appointed by and serves at the pleasure of the Governor; requiring each institution of higher education to adopt a written policy that provides reasonable academic accommodations for students to practice sincerely held faith-based or religious beliefs; altering eligibility criteria for and the process for awards from the Delegate Howard P. Rawlings Program of Educational Excellence Awards; altering the administration of the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes policies for reasonable academic accommodations for religious practices at public higher education institutions, modifies eligibility and administration of various student financial aid programs including the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship and the Guaranteed Access Grant, and reorganizes the Maryland Higher Education Commission to establish the Office of Student Financial Assistance as a separate agency.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and public higher education institutions
stakeholders: Students attending public higher education institutions in Maryland, especially those practicing sincerely held faith-based or religious beliefs, and low-income students benefiting from financial aid programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on higher education policies and student financial aid programs, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure rates.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Sunday Sales
Synopsis: Altering the hours during which a licensee may sell alcoholic beverages on Sundays in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcohol sales hours in Frederick County, Maryland, allowing licensees to sell alcoholic beverages from 6 a.m. to 2 a.m. the following day on Sundays, aligning with weekday hours.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Authority and Frederick County licensing authorities
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees, local businesses, and residents of Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By expanding sales hours, the bill may help local alcohol-related businesses increase revenue and reduce financial stress, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Main Street Laurel Development PG 404-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue up to five Class B-DD (Development District) beer, wine, and liquor licenses for restaurants located within the Main Street Laurel development.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of up to five new Class B–DD (Development District) alcohol licenses for restaurants within Main Street Laurel in Prince George's County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants and residents within Main Street Laurel and other specified development areas in Prince George's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support local restaurants by increasing access to alcohol licenses, which can boost revenue and customer attraction, potentially reducing small business failure.

Title: Charles County - Property Tax - Credit for Volunteer Emergency Responders
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Charles County to grant, by law, a  tax credit against the property tax imposed on the owner-occupied residence of certain emergency responders and their surviving spouses if the federal adjusted gross income of the emergency responder or the unmarried surviving spouse for the immediately preceding taxable years is $150,000 or less; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to grant a property tax credit to owner-occupied residences of emergency responders and their surviving spouses, with eligibility based on income and service status.
responsible_party: The governing body of Charles County
stakeholders: Emergency responders, their surviving spouses, and property owners in Charles County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Native Plants Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Native Plants Program to respond to the increasing demand for, use of, and sale of native plants at retail garden centers and wholesale nurseries and to educate the public on native plants; requiring the Department of Agriculture to administer the Program in coordination with the University of Maryland Extension and to establish the "Maryland Natives" marketing program; requiring the University of Maryland Extension to hire an extension agent to serve as a native plant specialist for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Native Plants Program to promote the use, sale, and public education about native plants in Maryland. It involves creating a native plant list, certification for growers and retailers, marketing programs, and educational resources, all managed by the Department of Agriculture and the University of Maryland Extension.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture and University of Maryland Extension
stakeholders: Native plant growers, retailers, landscapers, the general public, and environmental organizations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support native plant growers and retailers through certification and marketing, which could help increase sales and reduce failure rates among small businesses in the native plant industry.

Title: Tax Sales - Data Collection - County Funding
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from disbursing or authorizing the disbursement of certain funds to a county if the county has not provided certain information concerning its tax sales; altering the taxable year for which the Department is required to obtain certain information concerning county tax sales; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation to collect detailed data from counties about their tax sale processes and properties, and to withhold certain funds from counties that do not provide this information.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Counties conducting tax sales, property owners, especially homeowners, and local governments involved in tax sales.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets data collection and funding disbursement related to tax sales, and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: General Provisions - Commemorative Days - Dashain Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor annually to proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates and symbolizes victory of good over evil.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates the victory of good over evil.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Nepalese and South Asian communities in Maryland, and the broader Maryland population interested in cultural diversity and inclusion.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing business failures.

Title: Public Service Commission – Cybersecurity Staffing and Assessments (Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to include on its staff one or more employees that are experts in cybersecurity to perform certain duties; requiring the Commission to establish, in coordination with the Office of Security Management, cybersecurity standards and best practices for regulated entities; requiring each public service company to report a cybersecurity incident to certain entities; requiring the State Security Operations Center to immediately notify certain agencies of a certain reported cybersecurity incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to include cybersecurity experts on its staff, establish cybersecurity standards and best practices for regulated utility companies, and implement a zero-trust cybersecurity approach. It mandates public service companies to adopt these standards, conduct assessments, and report cybersecurity incidents. The bill also enhances coordination between state agencies to improve cybersecurity oversight of utility infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission in collaboration with the Office of Security Management and the Department of Information Technology.
stakeholders: Public service companies, including electric cooperatives, municipal electric companies, gas companies, and water companies, as well as the residents and businesses served by these utilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity standards and assessments aims to strengthen the resilience of utility infrastructure, which can reduce the risk of cyberattacks that might cause business failures, especially for small utility providers and related stakeholders.

Title: Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation to study information on mold assessment and remediation to determine the best practices for identifying mold, preventing the development of mold within indoor environments, and remediating indoor molding conditions harmful to public health; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by October 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation to study and recommend best practices for identifying, preventing, and remediating indoor mold to protect public health. It also mandates the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations setting uniform standards for mold assessment and remediation.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, and the Department of General Services.
stakeholders: Homeowners, tenants, property managers, mold remediation professionals, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to establish clear standards and guidelines for mold assessment and remediation, which can help small businesses involved in mold remediation to operate more effectively and reduce failures due to regulatory uncertainty.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in the Maryland Department of Health to advance forensic science and carry out other duties as provided by law; renaming the State Postmortem Examiners Commission to be the Postmortem Examiners Advisory Committee; requiring and authorizing the Department and the Office to perform certain duties and powers previously performed by the Commission; authorizing the Department to contract with a physician for employment with the Office on a per diem basis; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner within the Maryland Department of Health, redefines its duties, staffing, and organizational structure, and clarifies procedures for investigations of deaths, autopsies, and record-keeping. It also modifies employment and retirement rules for medical examiners and related personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
stakeholders: Medical examiners, forensic pathologists, law enforcement agencies, families of deceased individuals, and the general public involved in death investigations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for employment, staffing, and operational procedures are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Employees – Programs and Scholarships for Human Services Careers and Probation Agents and State Contributions to Supplemental Retirement Plans
Synopsis: Establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers; altering the eligibility criteria for the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Police Officers and the Maryland Police Officers Scholarship Program to include probation agents who work for the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarship; requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to make awards from the Human Services Careers Scholarship Pilot Program in fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes several programs and scholarships to promote careers in human services, law enforcement, and probation in Maryland. It includes a pilot program for human services careers, scholarship programs for students pursuing relevant degrees, and loan repayment assistance for police officers and probation agents. The bill also modifies existing programs and provides funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Human Services, Maryland Higher Education Commission, and the Office of the Governor.
stakeholders: Students in Maryland, current and prospective employees of the Department of Human Services, police officers, probation agents, and their respective educational institutions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on workforce development and education programs for public service careers, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Hunting, Wildlife Conservation, and Outdoor Recreation - Funding, Promotion, Management, Licenses, Permits, and Stamps
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Heritage Conservation Fund to include acquiring interests in land that can be used by the general public for hunting; establishing the Wildlife Conservation, Education, and Outreach Program to provide outreach and foster an interest in outdoor recreation and stewardship, hunting, and wildlife conservation; establishing a stamp for hunting sika deer; authorizing a nonresident attending a college or university in the State to purchase a resident hunting license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's wildlife conservation laws by expanding the Heritage Conservation Fund to include land for public hunting, establishing a Wildlife Conservation, Education, and Outreach Program, creating a sika deer hunting stamp, adjusting licensing fees, and addressing deer overpopulation through a new management plan and increased funding for related programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources in collaboration with the Department of Agriculture.
stakeholders: Wildlife enthusiasts, hunters, landowners, students, and residents interested in outdoor recreation and wildlife conservation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for funding and land acquisition for hunting and conservation are likely to support small businesses involved in outdoor recreation, hunting, and land management, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Public Employee Relations Act
Synopsis: Consolidating and altering certain laws governing collective bargaining for certain public employees, including laws related to the establishment of bargaining units, election and certification of exclusive representatives, employee and employer rights, unfair labor practices, and strikes and lockouts; establishing the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee collective bargaining activities for certain public employees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill consolidates and updates laws governing collective bargaining for public employees in Maryland, establishes the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee these activities, and repeals previous labor relations boards. It sets procedures for union recognition, elections, bargaining, and dispute resolution across various public sectors including schools, community colleges, and state agencies.
responsible_party: The Public Employee Relations Board is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Public employees, including teachers, school staff, community college employees, and state government workers, as well as their respective employers and unions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts public sector labor relations and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Use of Alcoholic Beverages for Educational Purposes
Synopsis: Authorizing certain students who are at least 18 years old and under the age of 21 years to taste certain alcoholic beverages while participating in a course or program in enology, fermenting, brewing, or hospitality and tourism offered by a qualified institution of higher education without criminal penalty to the student, instructor, or institution of higher education under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain students under 21 at higher education institutions to taste alcoholic beverages for educational purposes during approved courses, without criminal penalties, and clarifies related legal provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Administration
stakeholders: Students enrolled in higher education programs related to enology, brewing, or hospitality and tourism, and educational institutions offering these programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce small business failure by enabling educational institutions to offer tasting experiences without additional licensing, potentially attracting more students and partnerships.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Modifying the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by clarifying and altering certain provisions relating to the administration of the Program; establishing the employer and employee shares of the total rate of contribution; prohibiting the total rate of contribution from exceeding 1.2% of an employee's wages; requiring the State to pay for certain contributions for certain covered employees; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse certain community providers for certain employer contributions in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by clarifying administration, establishing contribution shares, prohibiting contribution rates from exceeding a certain percentage of wages, and outlining employer and employee responsibilities, including state reimbursement for certain employer contributions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, community providers, and individuals taking family or medical leave in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for employer contributions, state reimbursements, and private plans aim to reduce administrative burdens and financial risks for small businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Frederick County – Alcoholic Beverages – Miniature Golf Course License
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a Class B-MGC (miniature golf course) beer, wine, and liquor license to a miniature golf course under certain circumstances; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring a license holder to submit an annual gross sales report for alcohol, golf games and food to the Board before a license may be renewed; and providing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County to issue a new type of alcohol license for miniature golf courses, allowing them to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain conditions, including food offerings and sales limits.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Miniature golf course operators and visitors in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear licensing framework and sales conditions that could help miniature golf courses operate more successfully and avoid failure.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Basket of Cheer
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement in Frederick County that alcoholic beverages in a basket of cheer be produced in Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement in Frederick County that alcoholic beverages in a 'basket of cheer' be produced in Maryland, allowing more flexibility in the origin of the beverages included in such baskets for benefit events.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Event organizers, charitable organizations, and participants in benefit events in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies the process for organizing benefit events involving baskets of cheer by removing restrictions on the origin of beverages, potentially reducing barriers for small businesses involved in supplying these beverages.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Consumption Permits
Synopsis: Altering the quantity of certain alcoholic beverages an individual may consume under certain consumption permits issued in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations in Frederick County regarding permits for on-premises consumption of alcohol, increasing the allowed quantities of beer, wine, and liquor that individuals can consume under these permits.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, patrons of licensed establishments, and residents of Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and potentially expanding the permitted quantities of alcohol consumption, the bill may support licensed businesses in offering more flexible services, which could reduce the risk of business failure.

Title: Corporations - Filing Requirements for Dissolution and Termination of Registration or Qualification - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law applicable to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation that prohibit the acceptance of articles of dissolution and issuance of a certificate of termination for certain corporations unless certain reports on personal property are filed with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements that previously prevented the Department from accepting articles of dissolution and issuing certificates of termination for corporations unless specific reports on personal property were filed. It simplifies the process for corporations to dissolve or terminate registration in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations registered or qualified to do business in Maryland, including both domestic and foreign corporations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By removing the requirement to file certain reports before dissolution, the bill reduces administrative burdens on businesses, potentially decreasing the likelihood of failure due to procedural complications.

Title: Commercial Vehicles - Police-Initiated Towing - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions related to the rates the Department of State Police sets for tow companies involved in certain police-initiated towing; establishing the Committee on Rate Setting and Complaint Resolution for Police-Initiated Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Towing and Recovery; and requiring the Committee, on or before December 1, 2023, to recommend approved rates to the Department of State Police that should be charged for police-initiated towing and recovery services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations for police-initiated towing of commercial vehicles in Maryland, including establishing approved rates for medium- and heavy-duty towing, creating a committee to set these rates and handle complaints, and banning per pound billing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and the Committee on Rate Setting and Complaint Resolution for police-initiated towing.
stakeholders: Commercial vehicle owners, towing companies, law enforcement agencies, and vehicle operators involved in police-initiated towing.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to standardize towing rates and improve complaint resolution, which could help towing businesses operate more predictably and reduce financial disputes that may lead to failure.

Title: Wicomico County - Sanitary District - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district, allowing for the establishment and governance of a sanitary district within the county.
responsible_party: Wicomico County governing body
stakeholders: Residents and businesses within Wicomico County, especially those affected by sanitation services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on establishing a sanitary district is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Howard County – Archery Hunting – Safety Zone and Position of Archery Hunter Ho. Co. 15–23
Synopsis: Reducing from 150 yards to 50 yards the size of the safety zone for archery hunters in Howard County who are under the authority of a deer management permit or who are actively participating in a hunting program administered by the county within which archery hunting may not take place except under certain circumstances; and requiring certain archery hunters in Howard County to be in an elevated position when hunting any wild bird or mammal within 50 to 150 yards of certain buildings.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations for archery hunting in Howard County, including the size of safety zones around buildings and requirements for hunters to be in elevated positions when hunting near structures, especially for those with specific permits or participating in county programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Howard County Hunting Authorities
stakeholders: Archery hunters, residents near hunting areas, and wildlife management programs in Howard County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Safety – Refrigerants – Limitations on Use
Synopsis: Providing that, notwithstanding any other provision of law, except for regulations issued by the Department of the Environment, no provision of the State building code or other law or regulation may prohibit or otherwise limit the use of a refrigerant if the refrigerant is designated as acceptable for use under federal listing requirements and any appliance containing the refrigerant meets federal safety standards and use conditions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland laws and regulations, except those issued by the Department of the Environment, from restricting the use of certain federally approved refrigerants in appliances that meet safety standards, aiming to facilitate the use of environmentally acceptable refrigerants.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Manufacturers, service providers, and users of appliances containing refrigerants in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying regulations around refrigerant use, the bill may reduce compliance costs and legal uncertainties for small appliance businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Land Use - Development of Neglected Property PG 406-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to exercise powers of eminent domain to acquire and develop or redevelop, for a public purpose, certain neglected property located in the county that has been designated as a transit-oriented development and is located within a business improvement district; and prohibiting land or property taken by the county through the use of eminent domain under the provisions of the Act to be taken without just compensation, as agreed on between the parties, or awarded by a jury.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to use eminent domain to acquire and develop neglected property within transit-oriented development areas, specifically within business improvement districts, to promote economic development.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government or relevant county agencies responsible for land use and economic development.
stakeholders: Property owners, local businesses, residents, and developers within Prince George's County, especially those in transit-oriented development areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to facilitate redevelopment of neglected properties, which can help revitalize commercial areas and support small business growth, potentially reducing small business failures.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Program - Transfer of Locally Employed Educational Professionals
Synopsis: Requiring educational professionals employed by a county board of education, the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners, or a county public library system who transfer to the Juvenile Services Education Program to be given credit as State employees for certain years of service for the purpose of establishing leave accrual rates; authorizing an individual who transfers to the Program to transfer leave balances in excess of a certain limit under certain circumstances; and applying the Act retroactively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that educational professionals transferring from local public schools or libraries to the Juvenile Services Education Program in Maryland be placed in comparable positions with similar pay and benefits, including the transfer of leave balances and credit for years of service.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and the Juvenile Services Education Program
stakeholders: Educational professionals employed by local public schools or libraries who transfer to the Juvenile Services Education Program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Transportation – Assaults on Public Transit Operators – Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to submit a report by December 1, 2023, and each year thereafter on assaults on public transit operators to each local executive authority, the State's Attorney for each county, and certain committees of the General Assembly; and requiring the report to include information on the nature of each assault, the mode of transit involved, the location of the assault, whether the police were involved, and the outcome of any investigation.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to submit an annual report on assaults on public transit operators, including details of each assault, comparisons with other states, and best practices for prevention. It also mandates additional data collection and evaluations for the first report due in December 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Public transit operators and transit riders in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on safety and data reporting for transit operators, with no direct provisions affecting small business failure rates.

Title: Public Information Act - Decisions of the State Public Information Act Compliance Board - Appeals
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant to appeal a certain decision issued by the State Public Information Compliance Board; authorizing a party aggrieved by a final judgment of a circuit court in a proceeding for judicial review of a certain decision of the Board to appeal to the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Public Information Act to allow applicants to appeal decisions made by the State Public Information Act Compliance Board and to permit parties aggrieved by a final circuit court judgment in judicial review proceedings to appeal to the Maryland Court of Appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Public Information Act Compliance Board and the courts (circuit and appellate courts)
stakeholders: Individuals and governmental units seeking access to public records in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily improves transparency and access to public records, which can indirectly support small businesses by promoting transparency and accountability, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $500.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new performing arts theater beer and wine license in Harford County, allowing nonprofit theaters to sell or serve beer and wine during performances and related events.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Performing arts theaters, nonprofit organizations, theater attendees, and local residents in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new license option that could help nonprofit theaters generate additional revenue, potentially supporting their financial stability.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from one for every 3,000 individuals to one for every 4,000 individuals.
bill_summary: The bill alters the license quota in Harford County for certain alcoholic beverage licenses, increasing the population threshold from 3,000 to 4,000 individuals before the quota applies.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and residents of Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By adjusting the license quotas, the bill may influence the number of licenses available, potentially affecting small businesses involved in alcohol sales.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class HC (Health Club) License
Synopsis: Establishing a 6-day and a 7-day Class HC (health club) beer and wine license in Harford County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue the license to a person who sells health club services; exempting the holder of the license from certain distance requirements related to places of worship and schools; establishing an annual fee of $1,300 for a 6-day license and $1,400 for a 7-day license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class HC (Health Club) license in Harford County allowing health clubs with certain amenities to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, with specific licensing and operational requirements.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Health clubs with indoor or outdoor pools or pickleball courts, their members, and patrons in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing opportunity for health clubs, potentially supporting their business operations and reducing the risk of failure by allowing alcohol sales.

Title: Hate Crimes - Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention to develop strategies to prevent and respond to hate crime activity and evaluate State laws and policies relating to hate crimes; and requiring the Commission to report to the General Assembly on or before December 1 each year, beginning in 2024, on legislative recommendations to address hate crimes in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention within the Maryland Office of the Attorney General. The commission will develop strategies to prevent and respond to hate crimes, evaluate relevant laws and policies, and report annually on policy and legislative recommendations, especially concerning hate crimes in schools.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by hate crimes, including diverse racial, religious, and cultural groups, as well as schools and law enforcement agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Criminal Law and Procedure - Cannabis - Fines for Smoking in Public, Stops, and Searches
Synopsis: Altering the maximum fines for smoking cannabis in a public place; prohibiting a law enforcement officer from initiating a stop or a search of a person, a motor vehicle, or a vessel based solely on certain factors; prohibiting, under certain circumstances, a law enforcement officer from conducting a search of a certain area of a motor vehicle or vessel; providing that evidence obtained in violation of certain provisions of the Act is not admissible in certain proceedings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reduces fines for smoking cannabis in public, limits law enforcement's ability to initiate stops or searches based solely on cannabis odor, possession, or proximity to cash, and establishes that evidence obtained in violation of these rules is inadmissible.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals suspected or accused of cannabis-related offenses, general public, and law enforcement agencies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts law enforcement procedures and public cannabis offenses, with minimal direct effect on small business failure rates.

Title: Income Tax - Automated External Defibrillator Tax Credit
Synopsis: Allowing an individual or a business entity to claim a credit against the State income tax for the first $500 of the purchase price of an automated external defibrillator purchased for use at a restaurant location in the State with annual gross income of at least $400,000; prohibiting the credit from being claimed more than once by any individual or business entity for each restaurant location; and providing certain other limitations.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals or business entities owning restaurants in Maryland with annual gross income of at least $400,000 to claim a tax credit of up to $1,500 for purchasing an automated external defibrillator (AED) for use at the restaurant, with specific limitations and a five-year expiration.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue or equivalent tax authority
stakeholders: Restaurant owners in Maryland with annual gross income of at least $400,000
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a financial incentive for restaurant owners to purchase AEDs, potentially reducing the risk of business failure related to health emergencies and liability.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Education and School System Revisions PG 502-23
Synopsis: Altering the duties and responsibilities of the Prince George's County Board of Education and certain officers of the county board; altering the voting authority of the student board member; requiring the county board to retain counsel and pay certain counsel fees and expenses incurred for defending a member in litigation involving a member's service in the member's official capacity on the county board under certain circumstances; altering certain procedures for the election of the student member of the county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to the governance, election procedures, and oversight of the Prince George's County Board of Education, including establishing an Office of Accountability and Compliance with an Inspector General, and modifies the election and compensation of board members, including the student member. It also authorizes the county to establish a system of public campaign financing for elected officials, excluding the student member.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Board of Education and the Office of Accountability and Compliance, including the Inspector General.
stakeholders: Students, parents, educators, and residents of Prince George’s County, especially those involved in or affected by the public school system and its governance.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the establishment of oversight and accountability measures could indirectly promote a more stable and transparent environment for local businesses involved in education-related activities.

Title: Natural Resources - Oyster Inspection and Severance Taxes - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the inspection tax levied on marketable oysters shipped in the shell to any place outside the State from 30 cents to $1 per bushel; increasing the amount of the severance tax levied on oysters caught within certain natural oyster bars from $1 to $2 per bushel; repealing a certain requirement that a certain tax increase be used for the oyster seed program; and requiring that $1 of each $2 of the severance tax levied be used by certain county oyster committees for the repletion of natural oyster bars.
bill_summary: The bill increases the inspection tax on oysters shipped out of Maryland and the severance tax on oysters caught within certain natural oyster bars. It also reallocates the use of these taxes, removing a previous requirement that part of the tax increase be used for the oyster seed program and instead directing funds to county oyster committees for oyster bar repletion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishermen, oyster industry workers, and communities dependent on oyster harvesting in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on taxes and funding for oyster repletion is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves tax adjustments and funding allocations for oyster conservation.

Title: Wicomico County - Sunday Hunting and Archery Hunting Safety Zones
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person to hunt game birds and mammals on each Sunday of the game bird and game mammal seasons from 30 minutes before sunrise until 10:30 a.m. in Wicomico County; authorizing the Department to allow Sunday hunting in Wicomico County on public land, subject to certain time restrictions; and adding Wicomico County to the list of counties in which the safety zone for archery hunters extends 50 yards from certain structures occupied by human beings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Sunday hunting for game birds and mammals in Wicomico County, Maryland, with specific time restrictions and safety zone adjustments, and allows hunting on certain public lands and during specific seasons.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and residents of Wicomico County and surrounding areas
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects hunting regulations and safety zones.

Title: Baltimore County - Property Tax Exemption - Real Property Owned by Fire Company or Rescue Squad
Synopsis: Altering a certain exemption from property tax for real property that is located in Baltimore County that is owned by an incorporated, nonprofit fire company or rescue squad by providing that the exemption applies only if the property is used or will be used exclusively for the purposes of the fire company or rescue squad; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the property tax exemption for real property owned by nonprofit fire companies or rescue squads in Baltimore County, limiting the exemption to properties used exclusively for their purposes or intended to be used exclusively in the future.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Department of Finance or local tax authorities
stakeholders: Fire companies, rescue squads, and residents of Baltimore County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on property tax exemptions for fire and rescue organizations may indirectly support their financial stability, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Business Improvement Districts PG 407-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to create certain business improvement districts intended to promote the general welfare of the residents, employers, employees, property owners, tenants, consumers, and general public with the geographic area of the districts; requiring the county to adopt certain local laws to provide for the creation and organization of a district; removing Prince George's County from the scope of law governing the establishment of business improvement districts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to create and organize Business Improvement Districts, including establishing a district corporation, imposing taxes, and governing the districts to promote economic development and welfare within the district areas.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government or a municipal corporation within the county
stakeholders: Property owners, business owners, residents, commercial tenants, and the general public within the district areas in Prince George's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a structured framework for business districts that can support local businesses through improved services and infrastructure, potentially reducing small business failures.

Title: Baltimore County - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore County to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore County is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Maryland counties to honor certificates of guarantee issued by approved associations or contractors to satisfy county bond requirements, but does not require counties to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore County and other listed Maryland counties' government agencies
stakeholders: Contractors and associations involved in public improvement projects in the specified counties
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small contractors by providing an alternative to traditional bond requirements, potentially reducing project delays and failures.

Title: Libraries – Regional Resource Centers – Governance Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for governance of libraries designated as regional resource centers; and establishing a governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new governance requirements for regional resource centers within Maryland libraries, including the creation of a governing board for each center, defining the roles of directors and advisory councils, and setting standards for operation, funding, and reporting.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Library Board and the newly established governing boards for each regional resource center.
stakeholders: Public library systems, library staff, and residents in regions served by the regional resource centers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on library governance and regional resource sharing.

Title: Transit - Grant Funding for Local Service - Alterations
Synopsis: Establishing the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program in the Department of Transportation; and authorizing program funds to be sourced from federal and State public transportation programs.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program to provide funding for local transit systems in Maryland, with funds sourced from federal and state transportation programs. Starting in fiscal year 2025, the total grants will exceed the 2019 level adjusted for inflation, with adjustments made for actual inflation rates in subsequent years.
responsible_party: The Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Locally operated transit systems and their riders in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on transit funding and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Harford County - Advisory Plumbing Board
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Harford County to enact a local law providing for the membership and terms of the Harford County Advisory Plumbing Board.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to establish a local law that sets the membership and terms for the Harford County Advisory Plumbing Board, which will assist in drafting, adopting, and enforcing plumbing codes.
responsible_party: Harford County governing body
stakeholders: Plumbers, plumbing code enforcement officials, and residents of Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a framework for plumbing code enforcement, which can help small plumbing businesses by clarifying regulations and enforcement procedures.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission - Dental Services - Survey and Regional Needs Assessment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to conduct a survey of hospitals to identify the availability of hospital operating resources for dentist use; requiring the Department and the Maryland Health Care Commission, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to develop regional plans to ensure the availability of appropriate operating space for the performance of dental procedures for Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission to review and revise reimbursement rates for adult and pediatric dental services under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program. It also mandates conducting surveys and regional needs assessments to ensure adequate access to dental care, including the availability of operating space and anesthesia services for dental procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, dental providers, hospitals, ambulatory surgery centers, and other healthcare providers involved in dental care in Maryland.
