decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve reimbursement rates and access to dental services, which could help reduce the failure rate of small dental practices by ensuring fair compensation and sufficient patient access.

Title: Behavioral Health Care - Treatment and Access (Behavioral Health Model for Maryland)
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to make recommendations to provide appropriate, accessible, and comprehensive behavioral health services that are available on demand to individuals in the State; establishing the Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health; requiring the Department to apply for certain federal planning grant funds; requiring the Department to apply to participate in a certain demonstration program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to improve behavioral health services across Maryland, creates a pilot program for value-based care coordination, expands telehealth services including audio-only options, and sets up certified community behavioral health clinics with federal funding applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland requiring behavioral health services, including mental health and substance use disorder patients, youth, elderly, and underserved populations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes innovative care models and telehealth services which can improve access and efficiency, potentially reducing small business failures in the healthcare sector by fostering new service delivery methods.

Title: Medicaid Waiver Programs - Waitlist and Registry Reduction (End the Wait Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain Medicaid funding to be used to provide community services to individuals waiting for services through waiver programs; authorizing certain Medicaid funding to be used for expanding provider capacity in certain waiver programs; and altering the uses of certain funding appropriated to the Dedicated Purpose Account in the fiscal year 2023 budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill aims to reduce waitlists for various Medicaid waiver programs by 50% starting in fiscal year 2024, expand provider capacity, and allocate funds for community services for individuals on waitlists and registries, including specific provisions for autism, healthcare, and community programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals waiting for Medicaid waiver services, including those with autism, brain injury, and other disabilities, as well as providers and community organizations involved in Medicaid services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes measures to expand provider capacity and improve reimbursement rates, which could help reduce small business failures in healthcare and community service sectors.

Title: Commercial Law and Financial Institutions - Credit Regulation - Shared Appreciation Agreements
Synopsis: Making certain shared appreciation agreements subject to the Maryland Mortgage Lender Law and other provisions of law that regulate certain loans of single extensions of closed end credit and revolving credit plans; and authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to adopt certain regulations regarding the enforcement of and compliance with provisions of law that regulate shared appreciation agreements.
bill_summary: The bill expands the regulation of shared appreciation agreements (SAAs) to make them subject to Maryland's mortgage and credit laws, requiring compliance and enforcement regulations, and clarifies definitions related to loans, mortgage, and SAAs.
responsible_party: Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Borrowers, especially those engaging in shared appreciation agreements, and financial institutions offering these agreements.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's regulation of shared appreciation agreements aims to improve transparency and compliance, which could reduce the risk of small business and lender failures associated with unregulated or poorly understood agreements.

Title: Health Insurance - Reimbursement for Services Rendered by a Pharmacist
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for all services rendered to an enrollee by a licensed pharmacist within the pharmacist's lawful scope of practice to the same extent as services rendered by any other health care practitioner; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's health programs and insurers to cover all services provided by licensed pharmacists within their scope of practice, including reimbursement, to improve access and recognition of pharmacists' roles in healthcare.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and health insurance providers, including Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children’s Health Program, insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations.
stakeholders: Licensed pharmacists, health insurance companies, Medicaid and CHIP enrollees, and the general population receiving pharmacy services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for coverage and reimbursement for pharmacist services are expected to support small pharmacy businesses by expanding service scope and financial sustainability.

Title: Behavioral Health Programs - Residential Programs - Food Service Facility Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to adopt regulations that establish certain food service facility standards that are appropriate to residential programs that have less than 17 residents.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations concerning behavioral health programs in Maryland, specifically exempting certain residential programs with fewer than 17 residents from complying with food service facility regulations established by the Department of Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential behavioral health programs with fewer than 17 residents, residents of these programs, and the Department of Health
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces regulatory burdens on small residential behavioral health programs, potentially decreasing their failure rate by easing compliance requirements.

Title: Pharmacists - Therapy Management Contract - Form
Synopsis: Providing that a therapy management contract may be entered into in writing or orally; requiring, if a therapy management contract is entered into orally, the parties to the therapy management contract to reduce the contract to writing within 30 days after entering into the therapy management contract; and providing that a therapy management contract may be in electronic form.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations regarding therapy management contracts for pharmacists, allowing them to be entered into in writing or orally, with oral agreements to be reduced to writing within 30 days. It also permits these contracts to be in electronic form.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacists, authorized prescribers, and patients involved in therapy management contracts in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it mainly clarifies contractual procedures.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - University of Maryland School of Dentistry Faculty - Qualifying for Examination
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which a dentist who is a faculty member at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and was trained at a foreign dental school must be qualified by the State Board of Dental Examiners to take an examination offered by the American Board of Dental Examiners, Inc., or its successor organization.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for foreign-trained faculty members at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry to take the ADEX dental examination, allowing certain full-time faculty with specific experience and support to qualify more easily.
responsible_party: State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Foreign-trained faculty members at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and the students they teach
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining qualification processes for faculty, the bill may indirectly support the dental education environment, but its direct impact on small business failure is minimal.

Title: Study on the Utilization of the Expedited Licensing Process for Service Members, Veterans, and Military Spouses
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to conduct a study on the utilization of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses for certain occupational and professional licenses in the State; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to conduct a study on the use of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses, including how military experience is credited towards licensing requirements, outreach efforts, and best practices. The study aims to improve the licensing process for military personnel and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and military spouses seeking professional licenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on licensing processes for military personnel and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Alcohol and Tobacco Commission – Technical Corrections and Clarifications
Synopsis: Correcting certain references to the Comptroller of Maryland to be the Executive Director of the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, as appropriate; and clarifying certain powers and duties of the Executive Director of the Commission relating to alcoholic beverages regulation and enforcement.
bill_summary: The bill makes technical corrections and clarifications to the Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, including updating references to the Executive Director, clarifying powers and duties related to alcohol and tobacco regulation, and streamlining enforcement procedures.
responsible_party: The Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, specifically its Executive Director, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Businesses involved in the manufacture, distribution, and sale of alcohol and tobacco, as well as consumers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill clarifies licensing, reporting, and enforcement procedures, which can help small alcohol and tobacco businesses operate more smoothly and reduce the risk of violations that could lead to failure.

Title: Calvert County - Civil Infractions - Prosecutorial Designations
Synopsis: Authorizing the State's Attorney of Calvert County to designate county attorneys or assistant county attorneys to prosecute civil infractions; and authorizing the designated attorneys to exercise the powers of the State's Attorney when prosecuting civil infractions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the State’s Attorney of Calvert County to designate the county attorney or an assistant county attorney to prosecute civil infractions, and grants these designated attorneys certain powers when prosecuting such infractions.
responsible_party: Calvert County State’s Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Calvert County who are involved in civil infractions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could streamline the prosecution process for civil infractions, potentially reducing legal costs and delays for small businesses, thereby helping to prevent business failures related to civil infractions.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Hunting Offenses - Expungement
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of certain criminal records based on a conviction for certain hunting offenses.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals convicted of certain hunting offenses to petition for expungement of their criminal records after a specified period, which varies depending on the offense.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police or the Maryland Judiciary (for processing expungement petitions)
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of hunting offenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to criminal record expungement for hunting offenses.

Title: Calvert County - Length of Service Award Program - Benefits
Synopsis: Altering a certain benefit amount for certain fire and rescue volunteers; and authorizing the board of commissioners to approve an increase in benefit payment for certain fire and rescue volunteers.
bill_summary: The bill increases the death benefit for Calvert County volunteer fire and rescue volunteers from $6,000 to $10,000, allows the Board of County Commissioners to approve increases in benefit amounts based on cost-of-living adjustments, and makes related amendments to the local laws governing the Length of Service Award Program.
responsible_party: Calvert County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Volunteer fire and rescue personnel in Calvert County and their families
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Utilities - Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity and Meter Aggregation
Synopsis: Defining "generating station" as it relates to the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity or approval from the Public Service Commission for a person who constructs a generating station that has the capacity to produce more than 2 but not more than 14 megawatts of electricity from a solar photovoltaic system; requiring an electric company to provide meter aggregation for certain eligible customer-generators under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland regulations regarding solar photovoltaic systems and meter aggregation, including defining 'generating station' for systems over 2 MW, streamlining approval processes, and requiring electric companies to provide meter aggregation for certain eligible customers.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and electric utilities
stakeholders: Solar energy developers, eligible customer-generators such as agricultural, nonprofit, government, and educational institutions, and the general public interested in renewable energy development.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies the approval process for solar projects and mandates meter aggregation, which can reduce costs and barriers for small solar energy businesses and eligible customer-generators, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse to study existing laws, policies, and practices relating to elder abuse and crimes commonly committed against older adults; and requiring the Task Force to submit a final report by December 31, 2024, to the Governor and the General Assembly with its findings and recommendations regarding changes to State law, policy, and practice that would aid in preventing elder abuse.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse to review and recommend improvements to laws, policies, and practices related to elder abuse in Maryland. The task force will study existing laws, make recommendations, and submit reports by December 2023 and December 2024.
responsible_party: The Department of Aging, which will provide staff for the task force.
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland, especially those at risk of abuse, neglect, or exploitation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; its focus is on elder abuse prevention and law review.

Title: Town of Sharpsburg - Parking of Vehicles - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking certain vehicles in the Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County, subject to a certain exception.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits parking certain types of vehicles in the Town of Sharpsburg, Maryland, with specific exceptions for vehicles that are essential to immediate use.
responsible_party: Town of Sharpsburg local government and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners and residents of the Town of Sharpsburg
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses parking restrictions for specific vehicle types.

Title: Elections - Election Judges - Minimum Compensation
Synopsis: Establishing a minimum training course compensation of $50 and minimum daily compensation of $250 for election judges for each election day and each early voting day actually served; requiring the State Board of Elections to reimburse each local board elections for $50 of the extra compensation that is paid to each returning election judge; and requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to assist in the recruitment of individuals to serve as election judges.
bill_summary: The bill establishes minimum compensation levels for election judges in Maryland, including training course pay and daily wages, and requires the State Board of Elections to reimburse local boards for some of the costs. It also mandates a marketing campaign to recruit diverse election judges.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges, voters, and local election boards in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates but may indirectly support election-related employment and administrative stability.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Biomarker Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage for biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence; establishing requirements for deductibles, copayments, and coinsurance for biomarker testing; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the impact of providing biomarker testing.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence. It establishes coverage requirements, including limits on deductibles, copayments, and utilization review, and mandates coverage starting January 1, 2024, with certain provisions phased in over time.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, health insurance policyholders, and patients requiring biomarker testing in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could reduce small business failure by improving access to advanced diagnostics, potentially leading to better health outcomes and reduced long-term healthcare costs.

Title: Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for early childhood education teacher certification completed through an alternative teacher preparation program; requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with the Maryland Higher Education Commission, to establish specific goals for the recruitment and retention of teachers in teacher preparation programs; requiring that "high staff qualifications" for publicly funded eligible prekindergarten providers must be implemented by the 2027-2028 school year; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023 aims to improve teacher recruitment, retention, and diversity through new programs, scholarships, and administrative changes, including establishing a dashboard, joining the Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact, and expanding support for teacher preparation and early childhood education.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Higher Education Commission and other relevant state agencies.
stakeholders: Future and current teachers, early childhood education providers, students in high-need schools, and underserved communities across Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on education workforce development and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Disability or Death and Termination of Employment of a Broker
Synopsis: Requiring an adult family member to submit a death certificate or evidence of disability to the State Real Estate Commission before the family member may carry on the business of a disabled or deceased licensed real estate broker; permitting a certain business to designate a licensed real estate broker to provide real estate brokerage services under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to clarify procedures for family members to carry on the business of a deceased or disabled real estate broker, including requirements for providing proof of death or disability, and allows businesses to designate other licensed brokers to continue brokerage services if a broker is terminated or incapacitated.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers, real estate businesses, and their clients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a structured process for brokers to continue operations after death or disability, which can help prevent business failure due to unforeseen circumstances, thereby supporting small real estate businesses.

Title: Special Education - Judicial Actions - Attorney's Fees and Related Costs
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to award reasonable attorney's fees and related costs to the parent of a child with a disability who is the prevailing party in a certain special education proceeding; prohibiting a court from awarding attorney's fees and related costs to certain parents in a certain proceeding under certain circumstances; and authorizing an award of attorney's fees and related costs to a parent of a child with a disability who is a prevailing party under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes courts to award attorney's fees and related costs to parents of children with disabilities who prevail in special education disputes, with specific provisions about settlement offers and justification for rejecting them.
responsible_party: The Office of Administrative Hearings and the courts in Maryland.
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities, children with disabilities, and public education agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts legal proceedings related to special education disputes and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to annually proclaim January 27 as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day; and requiring the proclamation to include a declaration of the purposes of Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim January 27 as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day, a day dedicated to reflection, education, and commitment to remembering the Holocaust and its lessons.
responsible_party: The Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, educators, religious communities, political bodies, and media organizations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or economic issues; it focuses on Holocaust remembrance and education.

Title: Maryland Insurance Commissioner Enforcement - Specialty Mental Health Services and Payment of Claims - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date by 2 years for certain provisions of law relating to Maryland Insurance Commissioner enforcement duties regarding administrative services organizations that administer a certain delivery system for specialty mental health services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the enforcement authority of the Maryland Insurance Commissioner regarding specialty mental health services and the payment of claims for an additional four years.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Individuals receiving specialty mental health services and insurance providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's extension of enforcement duties aims to ensure continued oversight and compliance, which can help stabilize the mental health services market and reduce small business failures in that sector.

Title: Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment Earnings Limitation - COVID-19 Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting a certain retiree of the Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems from a certain earnings limitation when the retiree is reemployed by a certain previous employer for a certain time period to assist with the administration of federally funded grants or projects related to the COVID-19 pandemic; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to January 1, 2020.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain retired employees of Maryland's Employees’ Retirement and Pension Systems from earnings limitations when reemployed by the Maryland Department of Health for up to 5 years to assist with COVID-19 related grants and projects, retroactively from January 1, 2020, until December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Retired employees of Maryland's Employees’ Retirement and Pension Systems, Maryland Department of Health, COVID-19 response teams, and the general public benefiting from COVID-19 related programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on reemployment of retirees in health-related COVID-19 projects.

Title: Video Lottery Employee Licenses - Crimes of Moral Turpitude - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to modify the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission must disqualify applicants for video lottery employee licenses, specifically removing gambling offenses from the disqualification criteria and clarifying conditions related to crimes involving moral turpitude.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants for video lottery employee licenses, video lottery operation licensees, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns licensing disqualifications for individual employees.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to alter the requirement that certain grantees provide certain matching funds; extending the termination date of certain grants; altering the authorized uses of certain grants; and changing the names of certain grantees.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes various grants and funding for community development, historic preservation, infrastructure, and health facilities across multiple counties in Maryland, extending the duration and altering requirements for some existing grants.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or relevant local government agencies responsible for managing grants and funding programs.
stakeholders: Local communities, historic preservation organizations, health care providers, educational institutions, and residents in Maryland counties receiving grants.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes funding for infrastructure and community projects that can support local economies and small businesses, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Family Law - Child Care - Criminal Background Investigations
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to criminal background investigations for certain individuals who care for or supervise children; and requiring certain facilities to apply to the Central Repository for a national and State criminal history records check for each employee, employer, individual, or volunteer.
bill_summary: The bill requires child care facilities and related organizations to conduct criminal background checks on employees, volunteers, and other individuals who care for or supervise children, including applying for both state and federal criminal history records checks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, specifically the Central Repository of the Criminal Justice Information System.
stakeholders: Children in child care facilities, their families, child care providers, and organizations involved in child care services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily establishes background check requirements for child care providers, which are standard compliance measures rather than business operations risks.

Title: Locating the New Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters in Maryland
Synopsis: Urging the U.S. General Services Administration to select for the new Federal Bureau of Investigation headquarters one of the two finalist sites located in Maryland.
bill_summary: The resolution urges the U.S. General Services Administration to select a site in Maryland, specifically Greenbelt or Landover, for the new FBI headquarters, emphasizing the benefits of locating it in Maryland for security, diversity, and transportation reasons.
responsible_party: U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) and Maryland state government agencies involved in supporting the relocation.
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local communities in Greenbelt and Landover, Maryland's workforce, and federal law enforcement agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, but supporting the FBI headquarters' location could indirectly benefit local small businesses through increased economic activity.

Title: Criminal Law - Wearing, Carrying, or Transporting Firearms - Restrictions (Gun Safety Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm in certain locations; prohibiting a person from wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm onto certain property unless the owner or owner's agent has given certain permission; altering certain provisions of law relating to the authority of the Secretary of State Police to limit the wearing, carrying, or transporting of a handgun at certain times and locations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new restrictions on wearing, carrying, or transporting firearms in Maryland, including prohibitions near certain locations, property without permission, and specific areas like public accommodations and government buildings. It also updates permit requirements, training, and enforcement provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and local law enforcement agencies.
stakeholders: Individuals who carry firearms, gun owners, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for firearm restrictions in certain areas, which may impact businesses operating in those zones, but it primarily focuses on public safety and firearm regulation rather than small business support.

Title: Department of Natural Resources – Documents – Digital or Electronic Issuance
Synopsis: Expanding the requirement that the Department of Natural Resources make available and issue certain licenses and stamps in a digital or electronic format; and providing that, if the Department cannot issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format because of federal restrictions, it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Department issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format whenever the federal restrictions are eliminated.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to make available and issue most of its licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, and certificates in digital or electronic formats, with certain exceptions. It also allows individuals to satisfy requirements by possessing or displaying these documents electronically.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals and entities that need to obtain or display licenses, permits, stamps, registrations, or certificates issued by the Maryland Department of Natural Resources, such as boaters, anglers, and watercraft owners.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's digital issuance of licenses and permits is expected to streamline processes and reduce barriers, potentially lowering the failure rate for small businesses involved in water-related activities.

Title: Department of Transportation - Financing and Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs (State and Federal Transportation Funding Act)
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Capital Debt Affordability Committee include certain debt that is secured by future federal aid within its review of State tax supported debt; altering the calculation of the maximum amount of debt secured by future federal aid that the Department of Transportation may issue; providing that the maximum amount of debt that may be issued is calculated as of June 30; establishing the Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs to review and make recommendations on transportation funding, infrastructure, and project prioritization. It also modifies rules around transportation debt, including federal aid-backed bonds, and requires the Department of Transportation to include a reserve in its financial forecasts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and the Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs
stakeholders: Transportation agencies, state government, transit and transportation infrastructure projects, and residents of Maryland who use transportation services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve transportation funding and infrastructure planning, which can support economic stability and reduce small business failures related to transportation disruptions and infrastructure deficiencies.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Dwellings of Disabled Veterans - Application
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for a certain property tax exemption for a dwelling house owned by a disabled veteran or surviving spouse of a disabled veteran by adding a rating decision of the disabled veteran's disability from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs to the type of supporting documents that may be included with application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the application process for property tax exemptions on dwellings owned by disabled veterans, active duty service members, or surviving spouses of those who died in the line of duty, including provisions for applying before purchasing a home and for refunds if exemptions are not granted.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Disabled veterans, active duty service members, and surviving spouses of fallen service members in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts property tax exemptions for specific populations and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Expungement of Records (REDEEM Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Providing that any unpaid court fees or costs are not a bar to a certain expungement; requiring a court to waive certain court fees and costs when ordering or effecting a certain expungement; adding malicious destruction of property to the list of misdemeanor convictions that may be expunged; and altering the waiting periods applicable to the filing of petitions for expungement of convictions of certain crimes.
bill_summary: The REDEEM Act of 2023 makes it easier for individuals to have their criminal records expunged by removing barriers such as unpaid court fees, expanding the list of misdemeanors eligible for expungement, and adjusting the waiting periods for filing expungement petitions.
responsible_party: The Maryland courts and the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services are responsible for implementing the expungement procedures and waivers.
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records in Maryland seeking expungement, particularly those with misdemeanors and certain felonies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces financial barriers for individuals seeking expungement, which can improve employment opportunities and economic stability, indirectly supporting small business success.

Title: Disaster Service and Uniformed Services Leave Modernization Act of 2023
Synopsis: Adding certain State employees to certain provisions of law authorizing disaster service leave with pay; authorizing certain appointing authorities to waive certain requirements for disaster service leave and to increase the number of days of disaster service leave under certain circumstances; defining "uniformed services" for the purpose of adding certain individuals to certain provisions of law relating to certain paid leave and military administrative leave; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's laws regarding disaster service and uniformed services leave for state employees, including clarifying roles, expanding leave provisions, and authorizing agencies to waive certain requirements during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and the Office of Security Management in the Department of Information Technology.
stakeholders: State employees, emergency management personnel, local government agencies, and volunteers involved in disaster response and cybersecurity.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but supports emergency preparedness and response, which can indirectly benefit small businesses by enhancing community resilience.

Title: Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program - Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2024 or fiscal year 2025 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program Fund to be used for loans under the Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account; and repealing a requirement that 5% of proceeds from video lottery terminals go to the NIMBL Account.
bill_summary: The bill establishes funding and program details for the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center's Nonprofit Interest-Free Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account, including annual appropriations and the allocation of proceeds from video lottery terminals to support nonprofit operations and loans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce, specifically the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland seeking interest-free loans and support for their operations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides interest-free micro loans to nonprofits, which can help improve their financial stability and reduce the risk of failure.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Public Safety Officer
Synopsis: Repealing the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of a certain credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on a dwelling owned by a public safety officer; repealing a certain limitation on the amount of the credit; requiring the governing body of a county or municipal corporation that authorizes the credit to establish, by law, the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of eligibility for the credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing definition of 'public safety officer' for a property tax credit and requires counties and municipal governments to define it by law, allowing for a more flexible and potentially broader application of the property tax credit for public safety officers.
responsible_party: County and municipal governing bodies responsible for establishing the definition of 'public safety officer' and administering the property tax credit.
stakeholders: Public safety officers who own and reside in property within Maryland counties or municipalities, and the local governments that administer the tax credits.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains specifically to property tax credits for public safety officers.

Title: Clerks of the Circuit Courts - Civil Commissions - Presentation and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring an appointee for a civil commission to contact the clerk of the circuit court to which the commission was delivered by the Governor to coordinate a time and place for the administration of the oath of office and presentation of the commission; altering the frequency with which the clerk of a circuit court must report to the Secretary of State the name and office of each officer who has taken the oath of office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for civil commissions, requiring appointees to contact circuit court clerks to coordinate oath-taking, and modifies reporting requirements for clerks of circuit courts to the Secretary of State regarding officers who have taken oaths of office.
responsible_party: Clerks of the circuit courts and the Secretary of State
stakeholders: Public officers, government officials, and legal entities involved in official appointments and oaths of office in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on government appointment procedures and reporting.

Title: Labor and Employment - Apprenticeship 2030 Commission and Representation on the Apprenticeship and Training Council
Synopsis: Requiring that the Apprenticeship and Training Council and consultants to the Council include representation by individuals who are Asian, Black, and Latino; establishing the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to examine and make recommendations to expand access to apprenticeships to reduce skill shortages in high-demand occupations and provide affordable training for career pathways for young people; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to recommend ways to expand access to apprenticeships, reduce skill shortages, and increase the number of apprenticeships in high-demand sectors, aiming for 60,000 apprenticeships by 2030. It also requires increased diversity representation on the Apprenticeship and Training Council and its consultants.
responsible_party: The Department of Labor, the Governor, and the Apprenticeship and Training Council.
stakeholders: Young people, unemployed and underemployed individuals, high school students, and workers in high-demand industries such as healthcare, information technology, manufacturing, and public service.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to expand apprenticeship opportunities and workforce development, which can help small businesses by providing a skilled workforce and reducing skill shortages, thereby potentially decreasing small business failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Real Property Tax Assessment and Tax Rate Increases - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain notices relating to increases in property assessments; altering certain notice requirements relating to the intention of a county or municipal corporation to set a certain real property tax rate that exceeds the constant yield tax rate and requiring instead certain notice when a county or municipal corporation intends to increase its real property tax rate.
bill_summary: The bill updates notice requirements for property tax assessment increases and tax rate hikes, including specific procedures for public notices and hearings when tax rates exceed the constant yield tax rate.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local taxing authorities (county councils, Baltimore City Council, municipal governing bodies)
stakeholders: Property owners, taxpayers, and local government entities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and notice requirements for property tax changes, which can help property owners and small businesses better understand tax implications, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center - Student FAFSA Data - Reporting Requirement
Synopsis: Altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report certain student Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) data to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 15 each year, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2028; and requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide the Center with access to student FAFSA data.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report student FAFSA data to certain legislative committees annually from 2023 to 2028, and mandates the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide the Center with access to FAFSA data collected by the Office of Student Financial Aid.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students applying for federal and state financial aid in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill primarily impacts educational data reporting and does not directly influence small business failure rates.

Title: State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Deferred Retirement Option Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of years of eligibility service that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may have to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) from 30 to 32; increasing the number of years that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may participate in the DROP from 5 to 7; and authorizing certain individuals to elect to extend their participation in the DROP.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum participation period in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, allowing eligible members to extend their participation and retirement age, with specific eligibility criteria and a deadline for extending participation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Boards of Trustees for the State Police Retirement System and the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, including law enforcement officers and police personnel
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts law enforcement personnel and does not directly target small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Electricity - Net Energy Metering and Virtual Net Energy Metering - Accrual of Net Excess Generation (Net Metering Flexibility Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain eligible customer-generator to accrue net excess generation for an indefinite period; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a method for calculating the value of certain accrued net excess generation; and requiring that a subscriber of a community solar energy generating system accrue virtual net excess generation in the same manner as a certain eligible customer-generator.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's net energy metering laws to allow eligible customer-generators to accrue net excess generation indefinitely, with specific rules for payment and for community solar subscribers. It also establishes a pilot program for community solar energy systems and sets regulations for implementation.
responsible_party: The Maryland Public Service Commission (PSC) is responsible for establishing methods for calculating the value of accrued net excess generation and implementing the pilot program.
stakeholders: Electric utility customers, especially those participating in net energy metering and community solar programs, including residential, commercial, and community solar subscribers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for net energy metering and community solar programs could help small businesses reduce energy costs and improve financial stability, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Conditional Licenses to Practice Social Work
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Social Work Examiners, under certain circumstances, to issue a conditional license to practice social work to an applicant who, except for passing a required examination, has met the appropriate education and experience requirements for a certain license if the required examination was unavailable to the applicant for a period of at least 15 business days; providing that a conditional license is valid until 180 days after the examination becomes readily available to the applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners to issue temporary and conditional licenses to social workers under certain circumstances, such as administrative delays or other unforeseen events, to ensure continuity of practice while exam availability issues are resolved.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers seeking licensure and the public who receive social work services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for temporary licensing aim to reduce delays in licensure, which can help social workers maintain employment and reduce the risk of business failure for social work practices.

Title: Public Health - Mental Health Advance Directives - Awareness and Statewide Database
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a public awareness campaign to encourage the use of mental health advance directives in the State; and requiring the Behavioral Health Administration and the Maryland Health Care Commission jointly to study how first responders and behavioral health crisis providers can access a certain advanced directive database when responding to a behavioral health crisis and to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on their findings on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to run a public awareness campaign promoting the use of mental health advance directives and mandates a study on establishing a statewide database of these directives for use by first responders and behavioral health providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Behavioral Health Administration, Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health conditions, their families, healthcare providers, first responders, behavioral health crisis providers, and related organizations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the study and awareness campaign could indirectly support mental health services which may benefit small healthcare providers and organizations.

Title: Prince George's County - Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor, for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Prince George's County Office of the County Executive to be used for the Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program; and requiring that funds made available by the Act are supplemental to, and may not supplant, funds otherwise available for the reentry employment incentives in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Governor allocate $500,000 annually from 2025 to 2028 to fund the Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program, supporting employment opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Office of the County Executive, funded by the Maryland State government through the annual budget.
stakeholders: Formerly incarcerated individuals in Prince George's County seeking employment opportunities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support reentry employment, which can help reduce recidivism and improve employment stability, potentially decreasing small business failures related to workforce instability.

Title: Maryland Aviation Commission - Duties, Composition, and Member Orientation
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Aviation Commission to consider information and advice from certain additional stakeholders when carrying out the Commission's duties; requiring the Commission to consider the aviation, economic, business, environmental, health, and community-related impacts or any other impacts the Commission finds relevant; requiring that certain members of the Commission appointed by the Governor are to be recommended by the Anne Arundel County and Howard County Senate delegations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Aviation Commission to establish policies to mitigate negative impacts of the local aviation and airport industries, consider advice from additional stakeholders, and improve transparency and member orientation. It also specifies the composition, appointment process, and reporting requirements for the Commission.
responsible_party: Maryland Aviation Commission and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Local communities near airports, aviation industry professionals, airport employees, citizens affected by airport impacts, and Maryland residents in general.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by improving airport policies and stakeholder engagement, it may create a more stable environment for small aviation-related businesses.

Title: Maryland State Arts Council - Funding
Synopsis: Clarifying the calculation for certain funding for the Maryland State Arts Council for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; repealing a certain requirement for certain funds distributed to the Maryland State Arts Council to be included in the Council's prior fiscal year appropriation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation method for funding the Maryland State Arts Council from fiscal years 2013 through 2024 and establishes a new funding formula starting in 2025, including adjustments based on general fund revenue growth. It also repeals a previous requirement that funds distributed to the Arts Council be included in its prior fiscal year appropriation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Arts Council and the Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Artists, arts organizations, and cultural institutions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on arts funding and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Task Force to Study Crime Classification
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Crime Classification to study and make recommendations regarding a method for classifying crimes and civil offenses under State law and to identify and logically categorize all crimes and civil offenses that exist under State law; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Crime Classification and Penalties in Maryland, tasked with reviewing and making recommendations on the classification of crimes and civil violations, penalties, and related legal issues.
responsible_party: The Office of the Attorney General shall provide staff for the Task Force.
stakeholders: Legal professionals, law enforcement, policymakers, and residents of Maryland affected by criminal and civil law classifications and penalties.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Environment - Statewide Recycling Needs Assessment and Producer Responsibility for Packaging Materials
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "organics recycling" to include the processing of certain compostable packaging materials in a certain manner; requiring the Department of the Environment to approve a single producer responsibility organization to represent the interests of producers by October 1, 2023; establishing a producer responsibility advisory council to provide advice and make recommendations regarding establishing and implementing a producer responsibility program in the State for packaging materials; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a producer responsibility program for packaging materials in Maryland, requiring producers to submit plans for recycling and waste reduction, and creating a statewide recycling needs assessment and advisory council.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers of packaging materials, local governments, recycling facilities, and residents of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve recycling infrastructure and create clear responsibilities for producers, which could help small businesses involved in recycling and packaging, but also imposes new compliance requirements.

Title: Criminal Law - Child Pornography - Accessing and Intentionally Viewing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly or intentionally accessing and intentionally viewing a certain visual representation of a child under the age of 16 years.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to prohibit knowingly accessing and intentionally viewing visual representations of children under 16 that are indistinguishable from real children, including computer-generated images, with certain exceptions for drawings, cartoons, sculptures, or paintings.
responsible_party: Maryland State Law Enforcement Agencies and the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals involved in the production, distribution, or consumption of child pornography, and the general public concerned with child protection and online safety.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program – Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing that the terms "spouse", "family", "immediate family", "dependent", and any other terms that denote a spousal relationship shall be construed to include a party to a domestic partnership for purposes of the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program; and establishing that the provisions of the Program that apply to spouses shall apply to parties who have entered into a domestic partnership.
bill_summary: The bill expands the definition of spousal relationships within the Maryland State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program to include domestic partnerships, allowing individuals in such partnerships to access the same benefits as married spouses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management, specifically the Secretary of the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program.
stakeholders: State employees and retirees in Maryland who are in domestic partnerships.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects state employee benefits and does not have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Income Tax – Out–of–State Taxes Paid by Pass–Through Entities – Addition Modification
Synopsis: Providing, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022, an addition modification under the Maryland income tax for the amount of a certain tax credit claimed for certain taxes paid to another state by a pass-through entity under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland income tax law to include an addition for the amount of tax credits claimed for taxes paid to other states by members of pass-through entities, such as S corporations, partnerships, LLCs, and trusts. It clarifies how residents can claim credits for taxes paid to other states on pass-through income.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Residents and members of pass-through entities who pay or claim credits for taxes paid to other states
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to clarify tax credit claims related to out-of-state taxes paid by pass-through entities, which could reduce tax-related uncertainties and financial burdens for small businesses, potentially lowering their failure risk.

Title: Commercial Law – Abandoned Property – Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, as Administrator of abandoned property in the State, to determine the value of certain nonmonetary abandoned property; and authorizing the Administrator, if it is determined the property has no commercial value and need not be offered for sale, to return the property to the holder, destroy the property, or dispose of the property.
bill_summary: The bill updates the procedures for handling abandoned property in Maryland, including determining the value of nonmonetary property, and clarifies when such property can be sold, returned, or disposed of by the Comptroller.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Property owners, businesses, and the general public involved in abandoned property transactions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could reduce small business failures by clarifying procedures for handling abandoned property, potentially reducing costs and legal uncertainties.

Title: Income Tax - Work Opportunity Tax Credit - Technical Correction
Synopsis: Correcting a certain incorrect cross-reference to the federal Internal Revenue Code relating to the federal work opportunity credit.
bill_summary: This bill corrects a cross-reference in Maryland's tax code to ensure it accurately points to the federal Internal Revenue Code section related to the Work Opportunity Tax Credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Employers in Maryland who utilize the Work Opportunity Tax Credit and small businesses seeking tax benefits
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's correction helps ensure that employers can properly claim the Work Opportunity Tax Credit, potentially reducing the risk of non-compliance and financial strain for small businesses.

Title: Income Tax - Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for the State child and dependent care tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the eligibility criteria and income limits for the Maryland child and dependent care tax credit, including adjustments to income thresholds and reduction rates.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland who claim the child and dependent care tax credit, particularly those with higher incomes and families with qualifying individuals.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on individual tax credits for child and dependent care expenses.

Title: National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund - Annual Appropriation and Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the amount of a certain appropriation the Governor is required to make for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund; and repealing a provision of law requiring 100% of the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund to be used for community enhancement projects in sustainable communities located, at least in part, within the boundary created by Interstate 495 in the State and the District of Columbia beginning in fiscal year 2024.
bill_summary: The bill increases funding for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund, specifies the annual appropriations from 2021 to 2025, and removes the requirement that 100% of the funds be used solely for community enhancement projects within certain sustainable communities in Prince George's and Montgomery counties, and the District of Columbia.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Communities within Prince George's County, Montgomery County, and the District of Columbia, especially those in sustainable communities and enterprise zones.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on community enhancement projects in strategic areas may support local economic development and small business growth, potentially reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Real Property - Sheriff's Sales - Procedures and Subordinate Interests
Synopsis: Establishing that a sheriff's sale of real property extinguishes subordinate liens on the land being sold; providing that certain provisions of the Act do not impair a lien on land affected by a judgment in favor of a local government for real property maintenance violations or nuisance condition violations that is indexed and recorded in accordance with the Maryland Rules; and authorizing the Judiciary to transfer up to $12,000,000 of a General Fund appropriation to a certain special fund on or before June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures related to sheriff's sales of real property, including notice requirements, the extinguishing of subordinate liens upon sale, and the use of assessment records in lieu of appraisals. It also authorizes the transfer of funds to improve real property records.
responsible_party: The Judiciary of Maryland, specifically the Circuit Court and the Sheriff’s Office.
stakeholders: Property owners, lienholders, mortgage holders, and occupants involved in sheriff's sales of real property in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on clear procedures and the use of assessment records aims to streamline sheriff's sales, potentially reducing delays and complications that could lead to small business or property owner failures.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Independent Investigations Division - Authority to Prosecute
Synopsis: Expanding the investigative jurisdiction of the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General to include a police-involved incident resulting in serious bodily injury to an individual that is not otherwise within the jurisdiction of the Division; requiring the Division to submit an annual report on its activities in the prior calendar year to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before January 31; authorizing the Attorney General to prosecute certain criminal matters under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the authority and jurisdiction of the Independent Investigations Division of the Maryland Office of the Attorney General to investigate police-involved incidents resulting in death or serious injury, and allows the Attorney General to prosecute related criminal cases. It also requires the Division to report annually on its activities.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Police departments, individuals involved in police-involved incidents, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on police investigations and prosecutions, with no direct provisions affecting small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Corrections - Incarcerated Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the term "inmate" to be "incarcerated individual" meaning an individual who is actually or constructively detained or confined in a correctional facility.
bill_summary: The bill changes the terminology from 'inmate' to 'incarcerated individual' in Maryland law and official documents, and requires publishers of the legal code to update references accordingly.
responsible_party: Publisher of the Annotated Code of Maryland in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and legal professionals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $65,600,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $65.6 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and fire/emergency equipment for volunteer fire departments, with the bonds being repaid through property taxes.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners (local government)
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, local government agencies, and public facility users
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public infrastructure and emergency services funding, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Natural Resources - Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund - Uses
Synopsis: Altering the Black Bear Damage Reimbursement Fund to authorize grants from the Fund to be made for projects that prevent damages caused by black bears and reduce conflicts between black bears and humans; renaming the Fund to be the Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund; increasing the maximum amount of reimbursement from the Fund per person annually authorized for damage caused by black bears to $5,000; authorizing the Governor to include at least $50,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Black Bear Damage Reimbursement Fund to include grants for projects that prevent damages caused by black bears and reduce conflicts between bears and humans. It also increases the reimbursement limits for damages caused by black bears and renames the fund to reflect its broader purpose.
responsible_party: The Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Black bears, local communities, farmers, landowners, pet owners, and other residents affected by bear conflicts and damages.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding and grants for nonlethal conflict prevention projects, which can help reduce economic losses and damages, potentially decreasing small business failures related to bear conflicts.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 4 Limited Winery License - Food Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class 4 limited winery license to prepare, sell, or serve any food under certain conditions; altering certain requirements for off-premises and on-premises consumption at a limited winery; and removing the 14-day notice requirement for certain planned promotional events at a limited winery.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes holders of Class 4 limited winery licenses in Maryland to prepare, sell, or serve certain foods, and makes changes to existing regulations regarding winery operations, including food service and promotional activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Commission and Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Limited winery license holders, wine consumers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies licensing and operational requirements for small wineries, potentially reducing barriers and costs, which may help decrease the failure rate of small wineries.

Title: Washington County - Sheriff's Salary - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the salary of the Washington County Sheriff to be 90% of the salary of the State's Attorney of Washington County; and repealing the requirement for the Washington County Salary Study Commission to study and issue a report that contains recommendations relating to the salary of the Sheriff of Washington County.
bill_summary: The bill alters the salary structure of the Washington County Sheriff, establishing that the Sheriff shall receive 90% of the salary of the County's State's Attorney, and repeals the previous requirement for a salary study commission to recommend sheriff's salary.
responsible_party: Washington County government and the County Commissioners of Washington County
stakeholders: Residents of Washington County, Washington County government officials, and law enforcement personnel in Washington County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement - Body-Worn Cameras (Body-Worn Camera Appropriation and Financing Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate certain contracts with third parties for the acquisition or maintenance of body-worn cameras, equipment, or technology for certain law enforcement agencies; requiring the Department of Information Technology, in coordination with the Department of General Services, to study the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide uniform storage and access system for law enforcement body-worn camera data; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate contracts for acquiring and maintaining body-worn cameras and related equipment for law enforcement agencies. It also mandates a study on the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide storage and access system for body-worn camera data, with a report due by December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and their personnel, and the communities they serve
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes the use of contracts and standardized equipment, which could help small businesses in the body-worn camera industry by providing consistent opportunities for contracts and support.

Title: Baltimore City – West North Avenue Development Authority – Membership and Procurement
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; exempting the Authority from certain provisions of State procurement law; and altering the report on the Authority's comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy the Authority is required to submit to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly to be due by December 15, 2023, to include any procurement activities undertaken by the Authority, and to be also submitted to the House Health and Government Operations Committee.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership structure of the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City, extends reporting requirements, and exempts the Authority from certain procurement laws, while clarifying its oversight and operational scope.
responsible_party: The West North Avenue Development Authority, with oversight and reporting responsibilities assigned to the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development and the Maryland Department of Commerce.
stakeholders: Residents and community organizations within the target area of West North Avenue in Baltimore City, including local community associations and development corporations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for exemption from certain procurement laws and focus on neighborhood revitalization may facilitate more efficient project implementation, potentially reducing small business failures in the area.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Account Establishment - Procedures
Synopsis: Establishing certain procedures regarding the persons who may establish or receive distributions from an ABLE account in the Maryland ABLE Program for a certain eligible individual; and requiring the Maryland 529 Board to adopt certain procedures regarding the establishment and operation of an ABLE account by a person other than a certain designated beneficiary.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for the Maryland ABLE Program, including how accounts can be established and operated by individuals other than the designated beneficiary, and clarifies the roles of various parties involved in account management.
responsible_party: The Maryland 529 Board
stakeholders: Eligible individuals with disabilities and their families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on the administration of ABLE accounts for individuals with disabilities.

Title: Maryland Legal Services Corporation - Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program
