Synopsis: Establishing the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program in the Maryland Legal Services Corporation to provide eligible seniors access to affordable civil law-related services; and requiring the Governor to provide an appropriation of $225,000 in the annual budget for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program within the Maryland Legal Services Corporation to provide legal services to seniors, particularly in rural areas, for estate planning and related legal needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation
stakeholders: Seniors in Maryland, especially those aged 65 and older with limited income, and rural communities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics - Planning Grant Funds and Demonstration Application
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration at the Center for Mental Health Services for federal planning, development, and implementation grant funds related to certified community behavioral health clinics for fiscal year 2025; and requiring the Department to apply to the Administration for inclusion in the state certified community behavioral health clinic demonstration program for fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to apply for federal planning and demonstration grant funds to establish and operate certified community behavioral health clinics, which provide comprehensive mental health and substance use services, and to develop payment and quality systems for these clinics.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health or substance use needs in Maryland, including veterans and military service members
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support the establishment of certified community behavioral health clinics, which could help stabilize and sustain small mental health and substance use treatment organizations, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Baltimore City - Commercial Use - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "commercial use" in Baltimore City to include multifamily residential development if the development is located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within a 0.50-mile radius of a commuter rail station.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'commercial use' in Baltimore City to include certain multifamily residential developments located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within 0.5 miles of a commuter rail station.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Planning Department or local zoning authority
stakeholders: Developers, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those involved in multifamily residential projects near waterfronts and transit stations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by promoting development in key areas, it may indirectly support local economic growth.

Title: State Board of Physicians – Inactive and Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, under certain circumstances, to reinstate the license of an individual who is on inactive or emeritus status; exempting licensees who are on inactive status or emeritus status from continuing medical education requirements; repealing the requirement that the Board issue a license to an individual who is on inactive status under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to place physicians on emeritus status, establish conditions for reinstating licenses, and exempts licensees on inactive or emeritus status from certain requirements. It also clarifies restrictions on practicing medicine and using medical titles while on these statuses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians licensed in Maryland, especially those nearing retirement or on inactive/emeritus status
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts licensed physicians and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Offset and Study
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the payment of a benefit by a governmental unit or quasi-public corporation to a covered employee offsets the liability for benefits under the workers' compensation law; and stating that it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Maryland Association of Counties and the Professional Fire Fighters of Maryland jointly research and report data and analysis on the effects of the Act by December 1, 2024, to interested parties and certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's workers' compensation law to clarify when benefits paid by government entities offset other benefits, considers tinnitus as part of hearing loss, and requires an evaluation of the law's impact on benefit offsets.
responsible_party: The Maryland Joint Committee on Workers’ Compensation Benefit and Insurance Oversight, in conjunction with the Maryland Association of Counties and the Professional Fire Fighters of Maryland.
stakeholders: Covered employees of governmental units and quasi-public corporations, especially those with hearing loss or tinnitus, and their dependents.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to clarify benefit calculations and offsets, which could reduce legal disputes and improve benefit accuracy, potentially supporting small business stability.

Title: Economic Development - Upper Shore Regional Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of certain voting and nonvoting members of the Upper Shore Regional Council.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership structure of the Upper Shore Regional Council, including both voting and nonvoting members, to potentially alter representation and participation.
responsible_party: The Upper Shore Regional Council and the Maryland Department of Economic Development
stakeholders: Local government officials, municipal officials, and residents of Cecil, Kent, and Queen Anne's counties in the Upper Shore region
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but by potentially improving regional governance, it may indirectly support local economic stability.

Title: Prince George's County - Judges of the Orphans' Court - Compensation
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Executive and County Council of Prince George's County to determine the compensation for the judges of the Orphans' Court for Prince George's County.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Prince George's County government to determine the compensation for judges of the Orphans' Court, replacing the previous fixed salaries with a system where the County Executive and County Council set the salaries.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Executive and County Council
stakeholders: Judges of the Orphans' Court in Prince George's County and the residents who rely on their services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland to study and make recommendations regarding the effectiveness and viability of certain incentives, offerings, or practices employed in other states to attract, support, and retain individuals in fire fighting and emergency medical services roles; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to study and recommend ways to improve recruitment and retention of fire fighting and emergency medical services personnel in Maryland, including evaluating incentives used in other states.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Labor, Maryland Fire Rescue Institute, Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, Maryland Municipal League, Maryland State Firemen’s Association, Professional Firefighters of Maryland, Maryland Fire Chiefs Association, Metropolitan Fire Chiefs Association, and Maryland Association of Counties.
stakeholders: Fire fighting and emergency medical services personnel, volunteer and career firefighters, and the communities served by these services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but improving emergency services can support community stability, which may indirectly benefit local businesses.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Quasi-Endowment Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland to make transfers of not more than $150,000,000 subject to certain conditions to establish quasi-endowment funds; and authorizing the Board to use investment income produced by quasi-endowment funds in accordance with the University System of Maryland Policy on Endowment Fund Spending Rule to provide need-based student financial aid.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland's Board of Regents to establish quasi-endowment funds by transferring up to $150 million from fund balances held by the State Treasurer. The investment income from these funds can be used to support need-based student financial aid and facility renewal projects. The bill also requires annual reporting on investment performance.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland's Board of Regents
stakeholders: Students at the University of Maryland, especially those requiring need-based financial aid, and the university's administration and financial management teams.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Business Regulation - Home Improvement Commission - Guaranty Fund and Award Limits
Synopsis: Increasing the funding level of the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund that is administered by the Home Improvement Commission from $250,000 to $1,000,000; increasing a certain Fund threshold that determines whether a fee is assessed to each contractor; and increasing the limit, from $100,000 to $250,000, on the amount of money the Commission may award from the Fund to all claimants for the acts or omissions of a single contractor, subject to a certain reimbursement to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill increases the funding level of the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund from $250,000 to $1,000,000, raises the maximum award limits for claims against contractors, and adjusts fee assessments for contractors to support the fund. It also modifies procedures for claims and reimbursements related to home improvement contractor disputes.
responsible_party: The Maryland Home Improvement Commission
stakeholders: Homeowners and contractors involved in home improvement projects in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's adjustments to the guaranty fund and award limits aim to provide better financial protection for consumers, which could reduce disputes and financial failures among small home improvement businesses.

Title: Natural Resources - Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program to provide financial incentives to holders of aquaculture leases who maintain the lease in accordance with certain criteria, maintain the restorative conditions for at least 4 years, and meet certain other criteria the Department considers necessary; authorizing a holder of an aquaculture lease who is participating in the Pilot Program to meet certain requirements by shellfish seed planting only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program in Maryland to provide financial incentives to aquaculture leaseholders who engage in shellfish planting and meet certain environmental and operational criteria, aiming to improve water quality and habitat.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture leaseholders, water quality, habitat, and oyster populations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program offers financial incentives to aquaculture leaseholders, encouraging sustainable practices that can support the viability of small aquaculture businesses and improve their success rates.

Title: Economic Development – Sports Entertainment Facilities – Financing and Construction
Synopsis: Altering the amount of taxable or tax exempt bonds that the Maryland Stadium Authority may issue for certain sports entertainment facilities from $200,000,000 to $220,000,000; altering the entities from which the Authority is required to have received a request for financing and construction management services concerning a sports entertainment facility; altering the entities with which the Authority is required to enter into an agreement before issuing bonds to finance a sports entertainment facility; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of bonds that the Maryland Stadium Authority can issue for sports entertainment facilities from $200 million to $220 million, and updates the requirements for requesting and securing financing for such facilities, including the entities involved and the terms of agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and the relevant state, county, or local government agencies or nonprofit organizations involved in the development and operation of sports entertainment facilities.
stakeholders: State and local government entities, nonprofit organizations, and communities involved in or affected by the development and operation of sports entertainment facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for clear financing requests and agreements may streamline project development, potentially reducing delays and financial risks for small businesses involved in these projects.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Manufacturer’s Licenses and Off–Site Permits
Synopsis: Extending the termination date, to June 30, 2024, for provisions relating to the authorization of holders of certain manufacturer's licenses to sell and deliver and to directly ship their own alcoholic beverages products to certain individuals under certain circumstances; establishing the maximum amount of beer and liquor that holders of certain manufacturer's licenses may directly ship to consumers in a calendar year; delaying the effective date for the authorization of certain manufacturer off-site permits to July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the authorization for certain manufacturer license holders to sell, deliver, and ship alcoholic beverages directly to consumers, sets limits on the amount of alcohol that can be shipped annually, and delays the effective date for certain off-site permits.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission
stakeholders: Manufacturers of alcoholic beverages, consumers, and small alcohol-related businesses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing direct shipping and sales, the bill aims to support small manufacturers and reduce their failure risk by expanding sales channels.

Title: Film Production Activity Income Tax Credit - Alterations and Maryland Entertainment Council
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the credit against the State income tax for certain film production activities to include documentaries and talk, reality, and game shows; increasing the percentage of total direct costs that qualify for the tax credit; increasing the aggregate amount of tax credit certificates that the Secretary of Commerce may issue for fiscal years 2024 through 2026; establishing the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and make recommendations regarding Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland's film production tax credit to include documentaries and talk, reality, and game shows, increases the percentage of costs eligible for the credit, and establishes the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and promote the industry.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce and the Maryland Entertainment Council
stakeholders: Film, television, and entertainment industry professionals, independent film entities, and Maryland residents involved in or affected by film production activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial incentives and support for small and independent film entities, which could help reduce their risk of failure.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County, from time to time, to borrow not more than $56,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to borrow up to $56 million through bonds to finance the construction and improvement of various public facilities, including schools, roads, parks, and public safety buildings, and to levy taxes to repay the bonds.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Commissioners and the County government
stakeholders: Residents of St. Mary's County, including public facility users and local taxpayers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public infrastructure funding and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Task Force to Study Solar Incentives
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Solar Incentives to study the types and impact of solar energy incentives and make recommendations regarding measures and incentives needed to ensure that the State meets the solar energy goals established in the State's renewable energy portfolio standard, minority business participation, the creation of good quality jobs, equitable access to renewable energy, and efficient use of land; and requiring the Task Force to submit its report to the General Assembly on or before December 15, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Solar Incentives in Maryland to analyze and recommend strategies for promoting solar energy development, including financial incentives, land use, and equitable access, to meet the state's renewable energy goals.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Solar energy industry, local governments, minority business enterprises, environmental groups, and residents of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to promote solar development and equitable access, which could support small businesses involved in solar installation and related industries, potentially reducing their failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Land Conservation - Establishment of Goals and Programs (Maryland the Beautiful Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain goals and programs related to land conservation; establishing the Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program to provide loans to land trusts to purchase land for conservation purposes; authorizing the Maryland Environmental Trust to exercise certain remedies under certain circumstances; prohibiting a person from making any false statements affecting a Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program loan; establishing the 40 x 40 Land Conservation Implementation Grant Program to support land conservation goals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes land conservation goals and programs in Maryland, including a land trust revolving loan program, grants for land stewardship and conservation, and a 40x40 land conservation initiative aiming to conserve 30% of land by 2030 and 40% by 2040.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Trust and the Smart Growth Subcabinet
stakeholders: Local land trusts, conservation organizations, local governments, and communities involved in land conservation efforts in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding and support for land trusts and conservation programs, which can help stabilize land-related businesses and organizations, potentially reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Sediment Control Plans, Discharge Permits for Stormwater Associated With Construction Activity, and Notice and Comment Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to review and update specifications for sediment control plans in a certain manner on or before December 1, 2025, and every 5 years thereafter; prohibiting the Department from authorizing the discharge of stormwater associated with construction activity under a general discharge permit unless certain requirements are satisfied; and requiring the Department to take certain public notice and comment actions if a person makes a written request within the public notification period of the permit.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to review and update sediment control plan specifications periodically, restricts the use of general stormwater discharge permits for construction activities over certain sizes or in sensitive areas, and enhances enforcement and public notice procedures for construction-related stormwater violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Construction companies, developers, environmental groups, and residents near construction sites in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on permits and increased enforcement may impose additional compliance costs on small construction businesses, potentially affecting their failure rates.

Title: Charles County - Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages in Charles County; requiring the Task Force to study issues related to student transportation, bus driver wages, and multiyear contracts for bus contractors in Charles County and to research best practices in surrounding jurisdictions related to the facilitation of student transportation; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the members of the Charles County Delegation to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a task force in Charles County to study school bus operator contracts and wages, considers the school board as a joint employer of certain contractor employees, and includes provisions for employee representation in negotiations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Charles County Board of Education
stakeholders: School bus contractors, bus drivers, Charles County students, and the Charles County community
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to study and potentially improve wages and contracts for school bus contractors, which could help reduce business failures in this sector.

Title: Local Procurements - Minority Business Enterprise Utilization Programs - Certification
Synopsis: Requiring that a county or municipality that operates a minority business enterprise utilization program for county or municipal procurements and has a process for the certification of minority business enterprises shall accept as certified a person that holds a certification as a minority business enterprise by the State certification agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires counties and municipalities in Maryland that operate minority business enterprise programs to accept certification from the State certification agency for minority business enterprises.
responsible_party: County and municipal governments in Maryland that operate minority business enterprise programs
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises seeking certification and participating in local procurement programs in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates easier certification recognition for minority businesses, which may improve their chances of success in local procurement opportunities.

Title: Port of Deposit State Historical Park - Planning
Synopsis: Altering composition of the stakeholder advisory committee to advise the Department of Natural Resources on the scope and management of Port of Deposit State Historical Park; requiring the Department to make a certain report to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2024; extending the deadline for the Bainbridge Development Corporation to transfer certain property to the Department to June 1, 2025; authorizing the Governor to include in the State budget an appropriation of at least $400,000 for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Port of Deposit State Historical Park, including its scope, management, and property transfer details, emphasizing preservation and archaeological studies of the site, which includes the Snow Hill archaeological site and adjacent conservation areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Local residents, historical and cultural organizations, and visitors interested in Black American history and archaeology in Cecil County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, but it involves property transfer and archaeological studies that could indirectly support local economic development.

Title: Fire, Rescue, or Emergency Medical Services Entities - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "peer support counseling program" for peer services offered to fire, rescue, or emergency medical services members to be "peer support program"; and requiring peer support programs to be evidence-based.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the requirements for peer support programs for fire, rescue, and emergency medical services members in Maryland. It defines evidence-based peer support programs and specialists, establishes confidentiality rules, and mandates the development of best practices and standards by the Behavioral Health Administration.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration in collaboration with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Fire, rescue, and emergency medical services members in Maryland who will receive peer support services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on mental health support for emergency services personnel and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Insurance – Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund – Assessments
Synopsis: Altering the formula for the calculation of certain assessments by the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund; requiring the Board of Trustees of the Fund, under certain circumstances, to authorize the Fund to withdraw certain amounts from the money held by the Fund from a prior overassessment; prohibiting members of the Industry Automobile Insurance Association from being subject to an annual assessment under certain circumstances; requiring in a certain fiscal year that additional funds be allocated to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the assessment calculation process for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, allows the Fund to withdraw funds from prior overassessments under certain conditions, and makes changes to how assessments and surcharges are handled for insurance associations and vehicle owners, including penalties for lapses in vehicle security.
responsible_party: The Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund and its Board of Trustees, in coordination with the Maryland Insurance Commissioner.
stakeholders: Auto insurance companies, vehicle owners, and policyholders in Maryland, especially those involved with private passenger and commercial auto insurance.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is indirect, primarily through the stabilization of auto insurance assessments and surcharges, which could reduce financial strain on small auto insurance providers and related stakeholders.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2023
Synopsis: Extending to June 30, 2025, the inclusion of certain audio-only telephone conversations under the definition of "telehealth" for the purpose of certain provisions of law relating to reimbursement and coverage of telehealth by the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations; requiring the Maryland Medical Health Care Commission to study and make recommendations regarding the delivery of health care services through telehealth by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2023 extends the inclusion of audio-only telephone conversations as a form of telehealth for reimbursement and coverage purposes until June 30, 2025. It also requires the Maryland Health Care Commission to study telehealth delivery, including payment parity between audiovisual and audio-only services, and submit recommendations to the General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients receiving telehealth services, healthcare providers, insurers, and health plans in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for reimbursement and coverage of telehealth services, including audio-only options, aim to support healthcare providers and insurers, potentially reducing financial barriers and failure risks for small healthcare practices.

Title: Video Lottery Operation License - Renewal
Synopsis: Altering the number of years before the end of the term of a video lottery operation license that a licensee is required to provide certain notice of intent to renew the license and is authorized to apply for renewal; providing for the term of a renewed license; requiring the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to renew a certain license unless the Commission makes a certain finding; requiring the Commission, under certain circumstances, to provide a licensee a certain hearing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the renewal process for Maryland's video lottery operation licenses, including notice requirements, application procedures, license terms, fees, and distribution of proceeds, with the aim of streamlining license renewal and ensuring continued funding for education.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Video lottery licensees, Maryland residents, and the education sector funded by the Education Trust Fund
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for license renewal and fee structure are designed to provide stability and clarity for licensees, potentially reducing the risk of license loss due to procedural issues, thereby supporting small business stability.

Title: Human Relations - Civil Rights Enforcement - Powers of the Attorney General
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate certain civil rights violations under certain circumstances and in a certain manner; authorizing the Attorney General to intervene in certain causes of action under certain circumstances; establishing certain penalties and authorizing the Attorney General to obtain certain relief in certain civil actions, conciliation agreements, and settlement agreements; authorizing the Attorney General to recover certain investigation and litigation costs in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate civil rights violations, and to intervene in certain cases. It establishes procedures for civil rights enforcement, penalties, and remedies, and creates a Civil Rights Enforcement Fund to support these activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, particularly those affected by civil rights violations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on civil rights enforcement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Towing or Removal of Vehicles - Reclamation Hours
Synopsis: Limiting, to at a minimum from 6 a.m. to midnight, the hours during which a certain person in possession of a vehicle that has been towed or removed from a parking lot is required to provide an opportunity for the vehicle owner or the owner's agent to retake possession of the vehicle; and altering a certain signage requirement imposed on the owner or operator of a parking lot relating to hours during which a towed vehicle may be reclaimed.
bill_summary: The bill limits the hours during which vehicle owners or their agents can reclaim towed vehicles, requiring a minimum of from 6 a.m. to midnight, 7 days a week, and mandates clearer signage about these hours.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or parking lot owners/operators
stakeholders: Vehicle owners and operators of parking lots in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce small business failures by clarifying towing and vehicle reclamation processes, potentially reducing disputes and legal issues.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation and Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Established (Serving Every Region Through Vocational Exploration Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; providing that the purpose of the Department is to promote service and volunteerism in the State; establishing the Secretary of Service and Civic Innovation and the duties and responsibilities of the Secretary; altering the provisions of the Maryland Corps Program, including requiring the Department to administer the Program; establishing the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway Fund; providing for the purposes, use, administration, and contents of the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Department of Service and Civic Innovation and the Maryland Corps Program, creating pathways for service year programs for young adults and recent high school graduates, including funding, oversight, and evaluation mechanisms to promote community service, workforce development, and educational opportunities.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Young adults, high school graduates, community organizations, employers, and local governments in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's programs focus on community service and workforce development, which may indirectly support small business success, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Maryland National Guard - Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program - Establishment (Health Care for Heroes Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program in the Military Department for the Department to award grants to reimburse certain members of the National Guard for the cost of premiums for certain health care and dental care plans; and requiring the Department to adopt regulations to administer and implement the program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program in Maryland to reimburse eligible National Guard members and their immediate families for certain health and dental care premiums, with a cap of $60 per month.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety, Military Department, or designated agency responsible for implementing the program.
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their immediate families who are enrolled in Tricare health and dental plans.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily provides health premium assistance to military personnel.

Title: Fair Wage Act of 2023
Synopsis: Increasing the State minimum wage rate; repealing the authority of the Board of Public Works to temporarily suspend an increase in the minimum wage rate; and repealing the requirement that the Governor's budgets for certain fiscal years include certain provider rate increases.
bill_summary: The Fair Wage Act of 2023 increases the Maryland minimum wage rate annually based on consumer price index growth, repeals certain authority of the Board of Public Works to suspend wage increases, and adjusts wages for small employers and employees under 18. It also mandates regular reporting on the impact of wage changes on employment and wages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Department of Health, along with the Board of Public Works for wage rate adjustments and suspensions.
stakeholders: Employees earning minimum wage, small business employers, community service providers, and individuals receiving services from community providers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for gradual wage increases and regular reporting aim to support small businesses by providing predictable wage growth and monitoring economic impacts, potentially reducing business failures.

Title: Recovery Residence Grant Program – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to award competitive grants to recovery residences to support operations, services, and programs; requiring the Department to establish certain procedures; requiring the annual budget bill to include $500,000 for the Program in each of fiscal years 2024 through 2027; and requiring the Department to submit an annual report to the Governor and General Assembly about the number of grants and the program's grant recipients by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to provide grants to support recovery residences that offer alcohol- and drug-free housing for individuals with substance-related or co-occurring mental disorders. The program aims to fund certified recovery residences that meet specific standards and support recovery efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Recovery residences, individuals with substance use or mental health disorders, and the community
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on supporting recovery residences, which are non-profit organizations, through grants to sustain their operations and services, potentially reducing failures among these organizations.

Title: Education - Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Annual Appropriation
Synopsis: Increasing the appropriation required by the Governor in the annual budget bill for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual appropriation for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In–Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000, supporting funding for in-classroom breakfast programs in schools across Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland schools, especially those benefiting from in-classroom breakfast programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily funds school breakfast programs and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the name of a recipient from the Goodwill Excel Center to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allocates $500,000 annually for fiscal years 2024 and 2025 to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City, and changes the official name of the center.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Governor's Office and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: The residents of Baltimore City, potential and current students of the Excel Center, and the local community benefiting from the center's programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but funding for the Excel Center may indirectly support workforce development and economic stability.

Title: Residential Property - Service Agreements - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain service agreement for maintenance, purchase, or sale of residential property from containing certain provisions; and prohibiting the recordation of service agreements prohibited under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill limits the duration of exclusive listing agreements for residential property sales to one year, prohibits certain service agreements related to residential property from being recorded if they violate specific provisions, and establishes rules for service agreements for maintenance, purchase, or sale of residential property, including penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission and local circuit court clerks
stakeholders: Homeowners, real estate brokers, service providers, and residents involved in residential property transactions and maintenance
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on service agreements and exclusive listing agreements aim to clarify legal boundaries, potentially reducing legal disputes and financial failures for small real estate and service businesses.

Title: Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Behavioral Health Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health to establish and implement an intensive care coordination model using value-based purchasing in the specialty behavioral health system; requiring the Governor, for fiscal years 2025 through 2027, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $600,000 for the Pilot Program; and requiring the Department to report by November 1, 2027 on the findings and recommendations from the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a 3-year pilot program in Maryland to improve behavioral health care through intensive care coordination and value-based purchasing, aiming to reduce hospital emergency visits and inpatient admissions among at-risk adults.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Adults with behavioral health conditions at risk of hospital emergency or inpatient psychiatric admission
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program may help small behavioral health providers by offering reimbursement and encouraging better care coordination, potentially reducing failures due to improved outcomes and financial incentives.

Title: Public Health - Parkinson's Disease - Advisory Committee and Website
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Parkinson's Disease Registry Advisory Committee; requiring the Committee to meet quarterly beginning on July 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the State-designated health information exchange, to establish and maintain a website with certain information related to Parkinson's disease by October 1, 2023; and requiring the Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on recommendations for establishing a fully functional State Parkinson's Disease Registry.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Parkinson's Disease Advisory Committee and a public website to collect, analyze, and disseminate data on Parkinson's Disease and related conditions in Maryland. It aims to improve understanding, tracking, and research of Parkinson's Disease within the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease and related Parkinsonisms, healthcare providers, researchers, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it involves data collection and collaboration that could indirectly support health-related research and services.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Provisions - Application of Prohibition
Synopsis: Altering the application of the prohibition on including a noncompete or conflict of interest provision in an employment contract or similar document or agreement that restricts the ability of an employee to enter into employment with a new employer or to become self-employed in the same or similar business or trade.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in employment contracts for employees earning $150% of the Maryland minimum wage or less, making such provisions null and void.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees earning $150% of the Maryland minimum wage or less, employers, and job seekers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By limiting enforceability of noncompete clauses for lower-wage employees, the bill may help small businesses attract and retain talent, potentially reducing business failure rates.

Title: Surplus Military Equipment Reporting - Extension
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of State Police to submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before February 1 each year relating to the acquisition of equipment by law enforcement agencies through surplus programs; and requiring the Department of State Police to include on its public website in a prominent location a link to a certain report.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of State Police to annually report on law enforcement agencies' acquisition of surplus military equipment and to publish a link to a federal surplus report on its website.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies in Maryland and the general public interested in military surplus equipment transfers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Virtual Education
Synopsis: Requiring a teacher preparation program to include certain training related to teaching in a virtual learning environment as a component of instruction; providing that a county board of education may authorize a county superintendent of schools, under certain circumstances, to provide virtual education days to students instead of closing the public schools in the county because of severe weather conditions; altering the requirements for virtual schools established by a county board of education; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates enhanced virtual education programs in Maryland, including teacher training in virtual environments, the establishment of virtual schools, and plans for operating during prolonged emergencies. It also sets standards for virtual instruction, assessment, and support services, and requires ongoing study and reporting on virtual education practices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, and families involved in virtual and public education in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it involves virtual education infrastructure and services that could impact local businesses providing technology and support services.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering - Independent Evaluation of Sports Wagering Content and Sports Wagering Facility Application Amendments
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to identify and license certain independent evaluators to evaluate and rate certain sports wagering content provided by sports wagering experts, sports wagering influencers, and content partners; authorizing the Commission and the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission to consider a request to amend a Class B-2 sports wagering facility license application for the purpose of altering the proposed location of the facility under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and evaluation system for independent evaluators to assess sports wagering content, sets standards for sports wagering content, and requires licensees to contract with these evaluators. It also allows certain amendments to sports wagering facility applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission and the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering licensees, sports wagering experts, influencers, content partners, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on evaluating sports wagering content and licensing evaluators, which may indirectly support small businesses involved in sports wagering content creation and evaluation, but it does not explicitly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Members - Appointment
Synopsis: Requiring that the members of the Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill requires that members of the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate, and specifies that four of the seven members should have no connection with the management or policy of any healthcare facility.
responsible_party: The Maryland Senate and the Governor's Office for appointments to the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
stakeholders: Healthcare providers, healthcare facilities, and patients in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but by clarifying appointment processes for the health commission, it may contribute to more stable healthcare policy oversight.

Title: Historic St. Mary's City Commission Reform Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, including laws relating to membership of the Commission, appointment of certain officers, Commission meeting times, and duties; and specifying the process for the Commission to collaborate with an affiliated nonprofit organization.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the governance and operations of the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, including membership, collaboration with affiliated nonprofit organizations, and program development, to enhance its mission and efficiency.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education, specifically the Historic St. Mary's City Commission.
stakeholders: Residents, students, educators, historians, and the general public interested in Maryland's colonial history and archaeological resources.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, but it promotes collaboration and funding opportunities that could indirectly support local economic development.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – City of Bowie Police Department – Transfers and Purchases of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing a transfer of service credit to, and a purchase of service credit in, the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the City of Bowie Police Department hired on or after January 1, 2007, and not later than December 31, 2015, under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain former employees of the City of Bowie Police Department to transfer or purchase service credit in the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System if they meet specific employment and contribution conditions, with a deadline for application by December 31, 2023.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Former and current law enforcement officers of the City of Bowie Police Department who are eligible for service credit transfer or purchase
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to pension system credits for law enforcement officers.

Title: Maternal Mortality Review Program - Local Teams - Access to Records
Synopsis: Requiring certain health care providers and health care facilities to provide to the local team, on request of the chair, prompt access to all relevant medical records associated with a case under review by the Maternal Mortality Review Program without undue delay; and providing that certain provisions of law related to the confidentiality of medical records do not apply to certain disclosures made to a local team.
bill_summary: The bill enhances access to medical records and information for local maternal mortality review teams, requiring healthcare providers and facilities to provide prompt and immediate access to relevant records and information necessary for reviewing maternal deaths.
responsible_party: Health care providers and health care facilities in Maryland, as well as the Maryland Department of Health.
stakeholders: Maternal health care providers, hospitals, and women whose maternal deaths are being reviewed.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily involves healthcare providers and government agencies, and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Electronic Health Networks and Electronic Medical Records - Nursing Homes - Release of Records
Synopsis: Authorizing a nursing home that contracts with or uses an electronic health information network or electronic medical record vendor to direct the network or vendor to release electronic medical records and electronic health care transactions to a business associate of the nursing home.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes nursing homes in Maryland to direct electronic health networks or electronic medical record vendors to release patient records and health care transactions to business associates, with patient consent, to improve data sharing and healthcare quality.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health or the State–designated Health Information Exchange
stakeholders: Nursing homes, patients in nursing homes, healthcare providers, and electronic health record vendors in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates data sharing for nursing homes, which can improve operational efficiency and patient care, potentially reducing small business failure related to healthcare management.

Title: Public Safety - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the State Disaster Recovery Fund to provide disaster recovery assistance to units of local government for individuals and families and for the repair, restoration, reconstruction, or replacement of public facilities, low-interest or no-interest loans to businesses and nonprofits when a federal disaster declaration is not received, and disaster-related assistance for the unmet needs of individuals and families after a federal disaster declaration or in the event of a certain denial of federal assistance; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the State Disaster Recovery Fund to provide disaster-related assistance to individuals, families, and local governments when federal disaster aid is not received, and to support recovery efforts for natural disasters and government shutdowns. It also repeals the Catastrophic Event Account and transfers its balance to the new fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Individuals, families, local governments, businesses, and nonprofits in Maryland affected by disasters or government shutdowns.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides low-interest or no-interest loans and financial assistance to businesses and nonprofits affected by disasters, which can help reduce the risk of business failure after such events.

Title: Real Estate - Real Estate Brokerage Services and Termination of Residential Real Estate Contracts (The Anthony Moorman Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a real estate broker or an escrow agent, if a purchaser terminates a certain transaction under certain circumstances, to distribute trust money to the purchaser within 30 days after a certain written notice of the termination is sent; requiring a holder of trust money who makes a certain distribution to notify the seller and purchaser of the distribution within a certain period of time, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as The Anthony Moorman Act, establishes new rules for the distribution of trust money in residential real estate transactions, including requirements for timely distribution upon termination of a transaction, notification procedures, and dispute resolution processes involving escrow agents and real estate brokers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or relevant real estate regulatory agency)
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, escrow agents, buyers, and sellers involved in residential real estate transactions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clear procedures and protections for real estate professionals handling trust money, which can reduce legal disputes and financial risks, potentially lowering small business failure rates.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that this Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This act is an annual correction bill that amends various sections of Maryland law to fix errors, update references, and clarify language across multiple articles, including health, alcohol, business regulation, courts, criminal procedure, economic development, education, environment, family law, health occupations, human services, insurance, natural resources, public safety, public utilities, real property, state finance, state government, state personnel, and tax laws.
responsible_party: Publishers of the Annotated Code of Maryland, under the oversight of the Department of Legislative Services.
stakeholders: Maryland residents, small business owners, public officials, legal professionals, and organizations affected by the technical corrections and updates in the law.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's corrections and clarifications are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses technical and reference errors in the law.

Title: Home Amenity Rentals - Sales and Use Tax Imposed and Local Tax Authorized
Synopsis: Applying the sales and use tax to a sale or use of certain home amenity rentals; and authorizing a county or municipality to impose a certain home amenity rental tax under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to impose a local tax on home amenity rentals, which are short-term uses of residential property portions for up to 15 hours. It also clarifies definitions related to the sales and use tax on these rentals and sets maximum tax rates for different counties.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (counties and municipalities) are responsible for implementing and collecting the home amenity rental tax.
stakeholders: Property owners offering short-term home amenities, renters using these amenities, and local governments collecting the tax.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear framework for taxing home amenity rentals, which could streamline compliance and potentially support small property owners by formalizing the tax process.

Title: Department of Natural Resources' Real Property - Exchange With Private Real Property
Synopsis: Authorizing the State to exchange real property owned by the State for the use and benefit of the Department of Natural Resources with private real property under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to exchange certain state-owned real property for private real property under specific conditions, bypassing some existing procedures, to facilitate land management and conservation efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: State government, landowners, conservation groups, and local communities involved in land use and natural resource management.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for property exchanges and related costs are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Military Service Credit
Synopsis: Authorizing members of the State Retirement and Pension System to receive service credit at the rate of 4 months for each full year of attendance at a United States service academy that interrupts the member's employment, not to exceed a total of 16 months.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System to receive credit for attendance at U.S. service academies and military service, including active duty and reserve service, for retirement benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including military personnel and veterans in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or small business support programs.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Certificate of Title – Surviving Spouse
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for the issuance of a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for issuing a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse when ownership of a vehicle is transferred upon the death of the owner.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Surviving spouses of vehicle owners in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individual vehicle owners and their spouses, with minimal direct effect on small businesses.

Title: Public Safety - Deputy State Fire Marshal - Probationary Status and Promotion
Synopsis: Requiring a certain deputy State fire marshal to be on probation for a period of 2 years after the date of appointment to the Office of the State Fire Marshal under certain circumstances; and specifying the pay that a certain deputy State fire marshal is entitled to on promotion.
bill_summary: The bill updates policies regarding probation periods and pay structures for deputy State fire marshals and other police employees in Maryland, including provisions for probation duration and pay upon promotion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Office of the State Fire Marshal, and the Maryland State Police
stakeholders: Deputy State Fire Marshals, police employees, and other law enforcement personnel in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Health - Youth Camps, Development Organizations, and Programs - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository for criminal history records checks for certain youth camp applicants; requiring that the Department issue a certain written determination to a youth camp within 3 business days; repealing the authority of youth development organizations and programs to request from the Department a determination of whether the results of a criminal history records check would prohibit the hiring of a job applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to conduct criminal history checks for youth camp applicants and to provide written determinations on whether the results would prohibit hiring. It also repeals previous authority for youth development organizations to request such determinations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Youth camp applicants, youth camps, and organizations involved in youth development programs in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining the criminal background check process and providing clear guidance, the bill aims to reduce barriers to employment for youth camp staff, potentially decreasing small business failure related to staffing issues.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Commercial Driver's Licenses and Instructional Permits - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the expiration date for a commercial driver's instructional permit held by certain individuals; and exempting a holder of a commercial driver's license who applies for renewal from the requirement to pass a vision test if the holder has a current certificate of physical examination on file with the Motor Vehicle Administration.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations related to commercial driver’s licenses and instructional permits in Maryland, including extending the expiration date for certain instructional permits, exempting some license renewals from vision tests if a current physical exam is on file, and making other clarifications to licensing procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and individuals seeking or renewing commercial driver’s licenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as they mainly involve licensing procedures and health requirements.

Title: State Board of Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2028, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Architects in Maryland, delaying its termination from 2023 to 2028, thereby continuing its regulatory authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Architects in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Architects and architecture firms in Maryland, and the general public who rely on licensed architects' services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on extending the regulatory authority of the Board of Architects, which helps ensure professional standards and consumer protection, but it does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Certified Interior Designers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Certified Interior Designers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Certified Interior Designers in Maryland from 2024 to 2034, allowing the board to continue its regulatory authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Certified Interior Designers within the Department of Business and Occupations
stakeholders: Interior designers in Maryland and related industry professionals
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's extension of the board's authority may help maintain regulatory standards, potentially supporting the stability of interior design businesses, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: State Board of Foresters - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Foresters in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2035, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Foresters, allowing it to continue operating until July 1, 2035, instead of the previous date of July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: State Board of Foresters and the Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Foresters and related professionals in Maryland, and the public who rely on forestry services and regulation
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's extension of the Board's authority helps ensure continued regulation and support for forestry professionals, which can contribute to the stability of small forestry-related businesses.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects, allowing it to continue its regulatory authority until July 1, 2034.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects
stakeholders: Landscape architects and related professionals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's extension of the board's authority helps maintain regulatory oversight, which can support the stability of landscape architecture businesses, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Stationary Engineers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Stationary Engineers, allowing it to continue operating until July 1, 2034, instead of terminating in 2024.
responsible_party: State Board of Stationary Engineers and the Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Stationary engineers and related professionals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it primarily extends the authority of a specific licensing board.

Title: Voluntary Cleanup Program - Determination and Recordation Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering determination and recordation deadlines for the Voluntary Cleanup Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Voluntary Cleanup Program by extending the deadlines for determining application status and recording certificates of completion from 45 days to 60 days, and for recording determinations and certificates of completion in land records from 30 days to 60 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners and developers involved in environmental cleanup and redevelopment projects in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By extending the deadlines, the bill provides more time for small businesses and property owners to complete cleanup processes, potentially reducing failures due to tight time constraints.

Title: Public Safety - State Fuel Security Program
Synopsis: Establishing the State Fuel Security Program to be administered and enforced by the Maryland Energy Administration; applying the Program to motor gasoline, middle distillate, propane, certain residential fuel oil, and aviation gasoline; authorizing the Administration, in coordination with the Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Information Technology, to collect, store, and disseminate certain energy-related data for a certain purpose and subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland State Fuel Security Program to manage and allocate fuel resources during energy emergencies, including setting fuel percentage requirements and creating an assignment system for essential activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Fuel suppliers, wholesale resellers, and consumers in Maryland, especially those involved in critical sectors such as agriculture, emergency services, transportation, and healthcare.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides a structured allocation system for fuel during emergencies, which can help small businesses involved in essential activities to maintain operations and reduce failure risk.

Title: Horse Racing - Extension of Maryland Horse Racing Act and Establishment of Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of the Maryland Horse Racing Act from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2034; establishing the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority; establishing the Maryland Racing Operations Fund to assist the Authority in financing the acquisition, construction, rehabilitation, or other expenses for thoroughbred racetracks in the State; authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority to transfer money from the Racing and Community Development Facilities Fund to the Maryland Racing Operations Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the Maryland Horse Racing Act's sunset date to 2034, establishes the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority, and creates a dedicated Maryland Racing Operations Fund to support thoroughbred racing facilities and activities in the state. It also details property conveyance, funding allocations, and operational provisions for racing venues and related entities.
responsible_party: The Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority and the Maryland Stadium Authority are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Thoroughbred horse racing industry, racetrack operators, horse breeders, trainers, and the communities near racing venues in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support the thoroughbred racing industry through funding and operational improvements, which could help stabilize and grow small businesses involved in horse racing and related services.

Title: Income Tax - Credit for Federal Security Clearance Costs - Alterations
Synopsis: Reestablishing a time period of taxable years from December 21, 2022, to January 1, 2028, for a credit against the Maryland income tax for certain costs incurred by employers to obtain federal security clearances for employees, rent certain spaces, and construct or renovate certain sensitive compartmented information facilities in the State; limiting eligibility for the income tax credit to individuals or corporations that employ not more than 500 employees; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill reestablishes and extends a Maryland income tax credit for costs related to federal security clearances, space rental, and construction or renovation of sensitive compartmented information facilities (SCIFs), specifically for small businesses employing up to 500 employees, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland involved in security-based contracting and federal security clearance activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides financial incentives that can significantly reduce the costs for small businesses engaging in security-related activities, potentially lowering their risk of failure due to high compliance and infrastructure costs.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation – Mandatory Retirement Age – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the mandatory retirement age for the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation and the supervisor of assessments for a county.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the mandatory retirement age of 70 for the Director of the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and county supervisors of assessments, allowing them to serve beyond age 70.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Assessors and supervisors of assessments in Maryland, including the Director and county supervisors, and the residents and taxpayers of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it pertains to staffing and retirement age policies for assessment officials.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electronic Copies Fee - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a $1-per-page fee for electronic copies of certain documents recorded or filed with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the $1 per page fee for electronic copies of documents filed with the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Businesses and individuals who need electronic copies of documents filed with the Department
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: Removing the fee reduces costs for businesses and individuals, potentially lowering barriers to accessing necessary documents, which can support business operations and reduce failure risk.

Title: Health Insurance Carriers - Requirements for Internal Grievance Process - Modification
Synopsis: Altering the process by which a health insurance carrier is required to provide notice of an adverse decision in nonemergency cases under the internal grievance process established by the carrier for its members.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the internal grievance process for health insurance carriers in Maryland, requiring them to inform members of adverse decisions via oral or expedited means and to send detailed written notices within five days, including specific decision bases and contact information.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Health insurance members and providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on clear communication and expedited notification processes can help reduce misunderstandings and disputes, potentially decreasing small business failures related to health insurance issues.

Title: Insurance - Product and Service Offerings
