Synopsis: Authorizing certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer and provide certain products or services in conjunction with a policy at no charge or at a discounted price under certain circumstances; and prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from increasing a premium or denying a claim of a policyholder if the policyholder accepts, rejects, uses, or fails to use a certain product or service.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer products or services at no charge or discounted prices in conjunction with insurance policies, provided they meet certain educational, health, or risk management purposes. It also prohibits these entities from increasing premiums or denying claims based on the acceptance or rejection of such products or services.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and relevant insurance regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Insurance policyholders, health plan members, and small insurance providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small insurance providers by allowing them to offer value-added services without risking premium increases or claim denials, potentially improving customer retention and satisfaction.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in Maryland from July 1, 2023, to July 1, 2026, ensuring the continued existence and authority of the Board.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Psychologists practicing in Maryland and individuals seeking psychological services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to a professional licensing board for psychologists.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2027, ensuring the continued existence and authority of the Board.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Physical therapists and patients in Maryland who are served by licensed physical therapists
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it pertains to the continuation of a regulatory board.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners in Optometry, allowing it to continue its operations until July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners in Optometry within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Optometrists and consumers of optometry services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it pertains to the continuation of a regulatory board.

Title: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2027, ensuring the continuation of its authority and functions.
responsible_party: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential child care professionals and the children they serve in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Department of Disabilities - State Coordinator for Autism Strategy and Maryland Commission on Disabilities - Alterations
Synopsis: Transferring the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy to the Department of Disabilities; requiring the Department to provide staff for the Advisory Stakeholder Group on Autism-Related Needs; and altering the membership of the Maryland Commission on Disabilities to add one individual with a traumatic brain injury.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy from the Governor's Office to the Department of Disabilities, modifies staffing and membership of related advisory groups and commissions, and makes related organizational changes.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, including those with autism, mental illness, traumatic brain injuries, developmental disabilities, and their families, as well as disability advocacy organizations and service providers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but organizational and staffing changes may indirectly impact service provision and support for small businesses in the disability sector.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Allocation of Vehicles
Synopsis: Requiring that any system operated by a vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch or its affiliate for allocating new vehicles to dealers be reasonable and fair.
bill_summary: The bill requires vehicle manufacturers, distributors, or factory branches to operate fair and reasonable systems for allocating new vehicles to dealers. It also mandates disclosure of the allocation method upon request and places the burden of proof on the manufacturer in disputes.
responsible_party: Vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches in Maryland
stakeholders: Vehicle dealers and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By ensuring fair allocation practices and transparency, the bill aims to support vehicle dealers, which can help reduce the risk of dealer failures due to unfair practices.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Funding
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Comptroller distribute $14,000,000 of certain abandoned property funds to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; and extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Governor include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $14,000,000 from the Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends the funding and distribution requirements for the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund, ensuring continued financial support for legal representation in eviction proceedings in Maryland through fiscal year 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction and legal service providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts tenants and legal services, not small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Security Guard Agencies, Security Guard Employers, and Security Guards – Standards and Certifications
Synopsis: Requiring an individual who provides security guard services to the individual's employer to be certified as a security guard, subject to a certain exception; regulating certain security guard employers; altering the certification and renewal standards for security guards; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to identify or establish certain training programs for the certification and renewal of certification of security guards; requiring security guards to complete certain security training programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new standards and certification requirements for security guards, security guard agencies, and security guard employers in Maryland. It mandates security guard certification, training, and reporting procedures, and sets insurance requirements for agencies and employers.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission and the Secretary of State Police
stakeholders: Security guards, security guard agencies, security guard employers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on insurance, training, and certification aim to improve the professionalism and reliability of security businesses, which could reduce small business failures in this sector.

Title: State Procurement - Liquidated Damages - Policies and Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Public Works, in consultation with the Procurement Improvement Council, to publish a model policy on or before January 1, 2024, concerning the inclusion and use of liquidated damages provisions in procurement contracts; requiring a unit of State government to adopt a written policy that is substantially similar to the Board's policy; requiring a unit that decides not to include a liquidated damages clause under certain circumstances to obtain the approval of the head of unit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Public Works to publish a model policy on the use of liquidated damages in procurement contracts and mandates state agencies to adopt policies similar to the model. It establishes procedures for including, excluding, and reporting on liquidated damages in large procurement contracts, especially those valued at $5 million or more.
responsible_party: The Maryland Board of Public Works and state procurement units.
stakeholders: State agencies involved in procurement, contractors, and vendors participating in large state contracts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on structured policies for liquidated damages aims to clarify contractual obligations, potentially reducing disputes and failures in large projects, but its direct impact on small business failure rates is limited as it primarily targets large-scale procurements.

Title: Offshore Wind Energy - State Goals and Procurement (Promoting Offshore Wind Energy Resources Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an application for any new qualified offshore wind project and a certain proposal for an offshore wind transmission facility to be subject to a certain community benefit agreement; requiring the Public Service Commission to request that PJM Interconnection conduct a certain analysis of transmission system upgrade and expansion options; altering the requirements for a certain report on offshore wind projects; requiring the Commission, by a certain date each year starting in 2024, to report on its Supplier Diversity Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Maryland's offshore wind energy goals, sets procedures for approving offshore wind projects and transmission facilities, mandates community benefit agreements, promotes workforce diversity and small business participation, and creates a framework for procuring offshore wind energy and related transmission infrastructure.
responsible_party: The Public Service Commission, Maryland Department of General Services, Maryland Energy Administration, and PJM Interconnection.
stakeholders: Offshore wind project developers, local businesses, small, minority, women–owned, and veteran–owned businesses, residents, and ratepayers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes small business participation through community benefit agreements, outreach, and diversity goals, which could help reduce small business failures in the offshore wind industry.

Title: Preservation and Reuse of Historic Complexes Study and Alterations to the Income Tax Credit for Catalytic Revitalization Projects
Synopsis: Allowing multiple final tax certificates to be issued for a catalytic revitalization project in certain circumstances; and requiring the Smart Growth Subcabinet to study Maryland's historic complexes and make recommendations about an implementation plan to address the preservation and reuse of historic complexes in the State on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Historic Properties Disposition and Preservation Team within the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, extends the income tax credit for catalytic revitalization projects, and mandates a study on the preservation and reuse of historic complexes in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: State agencies, private organizations, and communities involved in historic property preservation and revitalization projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial incentives and support for revitalization projects, which can help small businesses involved in such projects succeed and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Registered Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the registration and termination of domestic partnerships with the register of wills; repealing provisions on legitimacy and illegitimacy of children and providing for the parentage of a child born or conceived by registered domestic partners; requiring the register of wills to recognize as domestic partnerships relationships established under the laws of other jurisdictions if the laws are substantially similar to the provisions of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes legal recognition for registered domestic partnerships in Maryland, including rights related to inheritance, estate distribution, and benefits for surviving partners. It sets procedures for registering and terminating domestic partnerships and recognizes similar relationships from other jurisdictions.
responsible_party: The Register of Wills in Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals in domestic partnerships, their families, and estate beneficiaries in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts estate and inheritance laws, with minimal direct effect on small business failure rates.

Title: Economic Development - Cybersecurity - Cyber Maryland Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Cyber Maryland Program in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to create and execute a talent pipeline that materially reduces workforce vacancies by July 1, 2026, build an advanced cybersecurity workforce, and carry out other purposes related to the cybersecurity workforce in the State; establishing the Cyber Maryland Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Cyber Maryland Program to increase and develop the cybersecurity workforce in Maryland, including creating a talent pipeline, supporting training programs, and promoting diversity. It also creates the Cyber Maryland Fund and Board to oversee these efforts, and expands existing cybersecurity education programs at Maryland higher education institutions.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Cybersecurity students, educational institutions, employers seeking cybersecurity talent, and diverse populations in Maryland interested in cybersecurity careers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to strengthen cybersecurity workforce development, which can help small businesses by improving their cybersecurity defenses and reducing the risk of failure due to cyber threats.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health - Health Care and Dental Care Coverage for Undocumented Immigrants - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for offering affordable health care and dental care coverage to State residents who are ineligible for the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, qualified health plans, or stand-alone dental plans due to the individuals' immigration status; and requiring the Exchange and the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for providing affordable health and dental coverage to undocumented immigrants who are ineligible for existing state health programs due to their immigration status. The report will analyze costs, impacts, and potential benefits of various coverage options for different groups.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Undocumented immigrants in Maryland who are ineligible for existing health and dental programs, and the broader Maryland community that may be affected by expanded coverage options.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by exploring options for providing coverage to undocumented immigrants, it may influence healthcare costs and access.

Title: Natural Resources - Annual State Park Pass - Discounts for Law Enforcement Officers and First Responders
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to provide a discount of at least $40 on annual State park passes for all first responders and law enforcement officers who are Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to provide a minimum $40 discount on annual State park passes for Maryland residents who are first responders and law enforcement officers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: First responders and law enforcement officers in Maryland, and residents who use State parks.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Environmental Health Specialists and Well and Septic Systems Permitting - Studies (Environmental Health Systems Support Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health, in conjunction with the Board of Environmental Health Specialists, to conduct a study on staffing needs for environmental health specialists in local health departments; requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services and the University of Maryland Agriculture and Food Systems Extension Program, to study the delegation of well and septic systems permitting authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes standardized permit forms for on-site sewage disposal systems, promotes consistent standards for environmental health specialists, increases staffing in the Department of the Environment, creates a student loan forgiveness program for environmental health specialists, and studies staffing needs and the delegation of permitting authority.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health, in conjunction with the Board of Environmental Health Specialists, and the Office of Student Financial Assistance.
stakeholders: Environmental health specialists, local health departments, applicants for sewage disposal permits, and students pursuing careers as environmental health specialists.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline permitting processes and improve staffing, which could reduce delays and uncertainties for small businesses involved in sewage system installation, thereby potentially reducing business failures related to permitting issues.

Title: Public Safety - Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to make grants to nonprofit organizations, including faith-based organizations, to provide security enhancements to protect against hate crimes; requiring the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to administer the Fund; and authorizing, for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund to provide grants to nonprofit and faith-based organizations for security enhancements to protect against hate crimes. It authorizes annual funding, starting at $5 million from fiscal year 2025, and outlines administration and reporting procedures.
responsible_party: The Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, including faith-based organizations, and communities targeted by hate crimes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on nonprofit and faith-based organizations, which are not typically small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Local School Systems - Student Field Trips - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill of $500,000 for the State Department of Education to provide grants to local school systems for expenses related to student field trips to museums of cultural import.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor to allocate $500,000 annually in the state budget to fund grants for local school systems to support student field trips to specific museums of cultural importance, including the Holocaust Memorial Museum, the National Museum of African American History and Culture, the Jewish Museum of Maryland, and the Reginald F. Lewis Museum of Maryland African American History and Culture.
responsible_party: State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland public schools, local school systems, and the museums of cultural importance listed in the bill.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it focuses on funding for educational field trips to museums.

Title: Libraries - Circulation Records - Inspection, Use, or Disclosure Requirement Revision
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which public, school, college, or university libraries must permit the inspection, use, or disclosure of the circulation record of an individual.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify when libraries can inspect, use, or disclose an individual's circulation records, limiting such access to cases necessary for library operations, with written consent, or court orders.
responsible_party: Libraries in Maryland (public, school, college, and university libraries) are responsible for implementing the program.
stakeholders: Library users and patrons in Maryland, whose circulation records are protected by the law.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide vouchers and housing assistance payments for low-income families that are currently on a waiting list under the federal Housing Choice Voucher Program for housing in units approved by the Department or a public housing agency, in accordance with guidelines under the federal program; and requiring the Department and public housing agencies to administer the State Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide rental assistance voucher program in Maryland to provide housing vouchers and payments for low-income families on federal housing waitlists, managed by the Department of Housing and Community Development and public housing agencies.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and public housing agencies
stakeholders: Low-income families on federal housing waitlists in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to assist low-income families with housing, which can stabilize their financial situation and reduce the risk of small business failure due to housing instability.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - In Rem Foreclosure of Vacant or Nuisance Property
Synopsis: Authorizing certain vacant property or nuisance property located in Baltimore City to be subject to a certain in rem foreclosure process; requiring certain procedures for an in rem foreclosure; requiring Baltimore City to take certain actions to compensate the interested parties in property that has value and is acquired through an in rem foreclosure; specifying the title acquired in an in rem foreclosure; specifying the circumstances under which an in rem foreclosure judgment may be reopened; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to use an in rem foreclosure process to address vacant or nuisance properties, allowing the city to foreclose on such properties when taxes are delinquent, and to sell or acquire title to these properties to address blight and nuisance issues.
responsible_party: Baltimore City government, specifically the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development and the Circuit Court of Baltimore City.
stakeholders: Property owners, residents, and communities in Baltimore City affected by vacant or nuisance properties.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets vacant and nuisance properties, not small businesses, so its potential to directly impact small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Firearm Safety - Storage Requirements and Youth Suicide Prevention (Jaelynn's Law)
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision relating to the storage of firearms and ammunition in a location that can be accessed by an unsupervised child; and requiring the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services to develop a youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage guide, with recommendations from a stakeholder committee.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's firearm storage laws to enhance youth suicide prevention by requiring the development of a safe storage guide, establishing a tax credit for firearm safety devices, and setting new storage requirements. It also strengthens regulations on firearm possession for certain individuals and creates a stakeholder committee to advise on safety practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services
stakeholders: Families, youth, firearm owners, law enforcement, health and social service providers, and educational institutions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for grants to support education on safe firearm storage, which could help small businesses involved in firearm safety and related services by increasing awareness and sales of safety devices.

Title: State Administrator of Elections - Removal From Office
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the removal from office of the State Administrator of Elections; and repealing the authority of the State Administrator to continue to serve in office until a successor is appointed and confirmed following a certain vote for removal of the State Administrator.
bill_summary: The bill changes the process for removing the State Administrator of Elections in Maryland, removing the previous provision that allowed the Administrator to serve until a successor was confirmed after removal votes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Maryland voters and election officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Social Workers - Sunset Extension, Notification of Complete Application, and Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Social Work Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; establishing the Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure to make certain findings and recommendations regarding examination and licensure of social workers in the State; requiring the Workgroup to submit its final report to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners, establishes a workgroup to explore alternatives to social work examination requirements for licensure, and mandates reports on the findings and recommendations to improve the licensing process and reduce bias.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers, social work applicants, and populations served by social workers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to make social worker licensure more accessible and fair, which could help reduce barriers for social workers entering the field, potentially decreasing failure rates for small social work practices.

Title: Annual Curative Bill
Synopsis: Generally curing previous Acts of the General Assembly with possible title defects; and generally repealing and reenacting without amendments certain Acts of the General Assembly that may be subject to possible title defects in order to validate those Acts.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to provide funding for legal representation in eviction proceedings and related activities in Maryland. It also corrects references to previous Acts in the Real Property and Transportation Articles of the Maryland Code.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, and local jurisdictions implementing access to counsel programs in eviction proceedings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets eviction legal services and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program – Definitions – Therapy Horse
Synopsis: Altering the definition of a "therapy horse" under the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'therapy horse' within the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to specify the types of horses appropriate for interactions with veterans, including those from licensed stables or certified professionals. It also establishes the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program, which aims to support veterans through referrals, funding, outreach, and reducing veteran suicide.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, especially those participating in or benefiting from the Veterans Service Animal Program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program may indirectly support small businesses involved in equine therapy and related services by providing funding and certification standards, potentially reducing failures in these sectors.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Exemptions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue an annual fishing license and stamp exemption to governmental entities and nonprofit organizations to provide fishing clinics and instructional opportunities to certain individuals; and altering certain reporting requirements for governmental entities and nonprofit organizations that are issued certain fishing license and stamp exemptions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue exemptions from fishing license requirements to certain organizations and entities. These exemptions allow for fishing activities, clinics, and instructional events for specific populations, including individuals with disabilities, veterans, and underserved communities, without requiring a standard fishing license.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, veterans, underserved communities, organizations providing fishing clinics and instructional events, and the general fishing community in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on licensing exemptions for organizations and individuals involved in fishing activities and educational events.

Title: Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund - Funding - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the mandated appropriation that the Governor is required to include for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund in the annual budget bill from $250,000 to $625,000 for fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual funding for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund, raising the appropriation from $250,000 to $625,000 starting in fiscal year 2025, to support the operation of the Center.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Governor's Office and the Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Construction industry professionals, construction students, educational institutions, and small construction businesses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The increased funding aims to support construction education and innovation, which can help improve skills and resources for small construction businesses, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Insurance – Credit for Reinsurance Model Law – Reciprocal Jurisdictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Insurance Commissioner from removing from a certain list of reciprocal jurisdictions created and published by the Commissioner certain jurisdictions located outside the United States and certain jurisdictions in the United States that meet certain accreditation requirements.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Insurance Commissioner from removing certain jurisdictions from the list of reciprocal jurisdictions for reinsurance purposes, specifically those outside the U.S. that meet certain agreements or accreditation standards, and U.S. jurisdictions that meet accreditation standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurance companies, reinsurance providers, and jurisdictions involved in reinsurance agreements
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on maintaining reciprocal jurisdiction status may streamline reinsurance processes, potentially reducing administrative burdens and financial risks for small insurance businesses.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Warner Manor in the Town of Kensington - Extinguishment or Termination of Easement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Historical Trust, on or before July 1, 2023, to extinguish or terminate a certain easement the Trust holds in the parcel of land known as Warner Manor (also known as Brainard Warner House and/or Circle Manor) in the Town of Kensington, Montgomery County; and requiring the Trust to complete certain necessary recordings and filings to complete the extinguishment or termination of the easement.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Historical Trust to extinguish or terminate a specific easement on Warner Manor in Kensington by July 1, 2023, and to complete all necessary legal recordings and filings.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: The Maryland Historical Trust, Montgomery County, and the community interested in Warner Manor and its preservation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland 529 Program - Reform
Synopsis: Abolishing and repealing the Maryland 529 Board; specifying that the State Treasurer is the successor to the Maryland 529 Board; transferring to the Office of the State Treasurer the responsibility for administering the Maryland 529 Program, including the Maryland Prepaid College Trust, the Maryland College Investment Plan, the Maryland Broker-Dealer College Investment Plan, and the Maryland ABLE Program; authorizing and requiring the State Treasurer to take certain actions in administering the Maryland 529 Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the Maryland 529 college savings programs by abolishing the Maryland 529 Board, transferring its responsibilities to the Office of the State Treasurer, and establishing new programs and oversight mechanisms to improve administration, transparency, and access to college savings plans, including prepaid, investment, and ABLE accounts.
responsible_party: Office of the State Treasurer of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, families saving for college, individuals with disabilities, and educational institutions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it streamlines and consolidates college savings programs, potentially improving program stability and trust.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Anne Arundel County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application for a license is filed; and providing that a certain license is valid only for as long as the resident applicant remains a resident of the State.
bill_summary: The bill requires that applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Anne Arundel County must be residents of Maryland at the time of application, and the license is only valid as long as the applicant remains a Maryland resident.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board or relevant local licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by ensuring only local residents can hold licenses, which may promote stability and local engagement.

Title: Income Tax - Captive Real Estate Investment Trusts - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "captive REIT" for purposes of a certain addition modification under the Maryland income tax in the amount of the federal dividends paid deduction for captive real estate investment trusts to exclude, under certain circumstances, corporations, trusts, or associations owned or controlled by certain qualified foreign entities and certain trusts owned or controlled by a listed Australian property trust.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the definition of 'captive REIT' for Maryland income tax purposes, specifically excluding certain foreign-controlled entities from the definition and adjusting the tax treatment of dividends paid by these trusts.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Real estate investment trusts (REITs), foreign entities involved in real estate, and Maryland taxpayers with investments in these trusts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects tax definitions and treatment for certain real estate investment trusts, not small businesses directly.

Title: State-Owned Nursing Homes - Deficiencies, Citations, and Fines - Contractor Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring contractors operating State-owned nursing homes to promptly provide notice of certain deficiencies, enforcement actions, citations, and fines to the Governor, the State agency overseeing the nursing home, certain committees of the General Assembly, and members of the General Assembly who represent the district in which the nursing home is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires contractors operating State–owned nursing homes in Maryland to promptly notify the state government and relevant committees about deficiencies, citations, and enforcement actions. It also mandates annual reporting by the Maryland Department of Health on survey activities and enforcement actions at these nursing homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and contractors operating State–owned nursing homes
stakeholders: Residents of State–owned nursing homes, contractors operating these nursing homes, Maryland state government, and oversight committees
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing clear reporting requirements and oversight, the bill aims to improve compliance and operational standards, which can help reduce the failure rate of small businesses operating these facilities.
